email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Jane,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to inquire about the availability of your shipping services for a cargo of 10,000 metric tons of wheat from New York to Rotterdam. Could you please provide a freight quote and available vessel details?

Best regards,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer a vessel with a DWT of 20,000 metric tons and LOA of 150 meters. The starting freight quote is $25 per metric ton. Please let us know if this suits your requirements.

Best regards,
Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Jane,

Thank you for the quote. Could you please clarify the laytime and demurrage charges? Also, is the vessel available for the intended laytime period from October 15th to October 20th?

Best regards,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

The laytime is 3 days, and the demurrage charge is $5,000 per day. The vessel is available for the period you mentioned. Please confirm if you would like to proceed with the booking.

Best regards,
Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Jane,

We would like to proceed with the booking. Please confirm the final freight quote and any additional details we need to be aware of.

Best regards,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Potential Changes Ahead
email_chain.body:
Hello Jorge,

I hope you and your family are doing well.

I've enjoyed working with you over the last couple of years, and I'm sure I'm not the only one.

Although things are looking good right now, I'm afraid we may have to part ways due to ongoing merger and alignment talks.

Best wishes,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Concerns About Company Transition
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Munoz,

I hope you are doing well.

We met at the last GM Conference, though we haven't spoken since. I am writing because I am concerned about the current state of my company.

As you may know, our CEO, Mr. Smith, is leaving and is rumored to be heading for JPS. The news had a significant impact on our market cap; our stock was down 8 percent on the day of the announcement.

The plan is to name an interim replacement while a search is conducted for a successor. Obviously, this is not the best time to be making a change, but it seems unavoidable.

With that said, I'm looking for advice on how to turn this situation around.

Best regards,
Jeff

email_chain.subject: Current Company Concerns
email_chain.body:
Dear Jorge,

I recently heard about the ongoing changes in our company and wanted to reach out to discuss the situation further.

Best,
Carlos

Paul

Do you know their plans for February? They are asking USD 30/Barrel above market for January delivery.

John

email_chain.subject: Re: January Delivery Pricing
email_chain.body:

You got it. They are holding their views and intend to continue with their own price fixing.

Regards,
Claudio

email_chain.subject: Re: January Delivery Pricing
email_chain.body:
John,

That's interesting. Could you tell me anything more about them? What makes them different from others?

Regards,
Claudio

email_chain.subject: Re: January Delivery Pricing
email_chain.body: They are absolutely different from the rest of the players in the market. They are very conservative and they are not happy with the low margins they...

Beatrice

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Naphtha Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Minoo,

Beatrice is the name of our sales manager. She mentioned in her email that her company cannot finalize freight within 48 hours of quoting. She needs to get the rate fixed within 24 hours of quoting. Please let me know if you can do this.

Regards,
Svetlana

email_chain.subject: Re: Naphtha Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Svetlana,

For the email you sent to Minoo, I wonder, was the information contained in that email a true reflection of what the company was looking for, or did she just request that particular bit of information?

Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Naphtha Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

She had asked for it in her last email.

Regards,
Svetlana

email_chain.subject: Re: Naphtha Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Svetlana,

Well, that's pretty cool!

I suppose I just wanted to hear it from you, directly from the horse's mouth! It just wouldn't be cricket to let it drop without asking you a few direct questions.

That little bit of information was probably something of an over-simplification, because I know for sure that it is not always possible for her to finalize freight within 24 hours of quoting.

Best regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Naphtha Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Svetlana,

I'd just like to say that I really appreciate you being so forthcoming with information. It has helped me to understand the situation better. So thanks for that!

Best regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Naphtha Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Svetlana,

I am very grateful for you clearing this up for me. It is much appreciated.

Best wishes,
Robert

email_chain.body: Dear Mr. Wong, Our client, Automaker XYZ, is considering the port of Gioia Tauro for handling their Toyota Camry cars from Jakarta to Italy. We would like to know whether you have experience moving cars from Jakarta. Regards, Davina

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Car Shipping from Jakarta to Gioia Tauro
email_chain.body: Dear Davina, Our company has been moving cars from Jakarta to Gioia Tauro for more than ten years. Our most recent contract has just expired, and we are looking for a new contract. The cars are transported by sea and sent on special carriers that go from Jakarta to Genoa and from there by rail to Gioia Tauro. On average, 250 cars are moved each year. We look forward to cooperating with you and await a favorable answer from you. Regards, Massimo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Car Shipping from Jakarta to Gioia Tauro
email_chain.body: Dear Massimo, I must say we are impressed with your quality of service. Your fleet is not the largest on the market, but we have found that smaller companies often provide a higher quality service. We can therefore look forward to working with you and hope that we can build a long-term relationship. Regards, Davina

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment from Panama to Singapore
email_chain.body: Can you please provide a rate for 10,000MT of crude oil from the Panama Canal to Singapore? Could you also tell us your minimum order size and monthly capacity? Regards, Thomas Rosenthal

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment from Panama to Singapore
email_chain.body: If you quote us for a delivery of 10,000MT of crude oil from Panama to Singapore, you will have the following obligations: for an amount of 180,000,000 tons to be loaded at the Panama Canal and to be discharged in Singapore, you should pay the price of the cargo of US $2,700,000 in advance. You shall send the packing list to us and you should place the FOB cargo on 5 vessels owned by us for a period of 15 days after we receive the payment from you in order to demonstrate your intention to close the transaction and to check your ability to fulfill your obligations. Then you should take full measures to ensure the completion of the cargo loading procedures and upon completion of these procedures you should inform us in writing that you have the cargo loaded on our vessels for a period of 3 days.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment from Panama to Singapore
email_chain.body: Upon our receipt of your above-mentioned confirmation, the balance of the funds shall be transferred to your account. This means that we shall have a problem with the closing of this transaction if you do not send us confirmation of the loading of the cargo on our vessels within 5 days. We shall not refund the advance payment to you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment from Panama to Singapore
email_chain.body: In order to close this deal, we shall transfer you the payment for the balance in advance and we would like to receive the following information: 1. That you have actually placed the cargo on the 5 vessels as promised (if so, please provide us with full information on each of the vessels and photographs of the ships in order to make sure that the cargo has actually been loaded onto the vessels and to ensure that we do not have a problem upon completion of the transaction); 2. Confirm that our office in Latvia shall receive within 5 days from the receipt of the funds by you, in full, the agreement on the conclusion of the contract of carriage for this cargo between your company and the charterer of the vessels on which you have placed the cargo, and that you will provide us with a copy of this agreement, in full, for our office in Latvia by the above-mentioned date, signed by all parties; 3. Confirm that our office in Latvia shall receive within 5 days from the receipt of the funds by you, in full, the shipping documents, and you will provide us with a copy of these documents, in full, for our office in Latvia by the above-mentioned date, signed by all parties.

email_chain.subject: Angular 2 Input with Email Type
email_chain.body:
Hey Bob,

Notice how the email itself doesn't go into the input? That's where everything gets tricky. If you're using input with the type of email, then you should just do the following:

For starters, if you're using Angular 2, you'll want to import FormsModule.

Like so: import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms';
Next, you'll need to add FormsModule to the imports array in the @NgModule declaration.

Like so: imports: [ BrowserModule, FormsModule ],

And you'll need to add [email] to the input tag.

This will give you an input that looks something like this:

<input type="email" [(ngModel)]="email">

At the end of the day, I found it quite trivial, and I suspect that most people would, too.

Best,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Angular 2 Input with Email Type
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

Thanks for the detailed explanation. It makes sense now. I'll follow your instructions and let you know if I run into any issues.

Best,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Angular 2 Input with Email Type
email_chain.body:
Hey Bob,

In the end, I ended up going with the approach that I outlined in the first email. It's super easy to read, and it takes care of the input type issue efficiently.

Best,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Angular 2 Input with Email Type
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

Thanks for the confirmation. I implemented your approach, and it works perfectly. It was indeed quite trivial.

Best,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Exciting Opportunity in Dubai
email_chain.body:
Hi James, I have been in touch with your colleague Tom regarding this position. This is an opportunity to work for a leading company in Dubai, and I am confident you would be the right person to fill the role. As you would be involved in the day-to-day aspects of the office, you would have the opportunity to: 
• Manage admin & accounts for an offshore business 
• Prepare for internal and external audits 
• Communicate with clients via email and phone 
• Liaise with HR, logistics, and maintenance departments 
• Prepare performance reports 
• Resolve problems and queries in a timely manner 
Please let me know if you are interested. We look forward to hearing from you. 
With kind regards, 
Phillip.

The last quotation for Suezmax from Houston to Singapore is dated 28 April 2005 and it is as follows:

Size: 130,000 m3 at 0.8 Tpc, 4.2% S, 130 ppm S, maximum 60 ppm V. Maximum residue shall not exceed 2% of cargo by weight. Further 0.5% max by weight for everything else. Temperature 0-

It is our pleasure to inform you that your Indonesian coal is ready to be shipped from Kalimantan, Indonesia to Rotterdam, the Netherlands on a CIF basis. As a condition of this shipment, you are requested to send us the letter of credit to pay the cost of the shipment within 30 days after the receipt of our statement of your shipment.

We thank you very much and are looking forward to receiving your prompt response.

Sincerely yours,
Aldrich Jaya

Kindly be informed that we have purchased CIF Rotterdam 1,000MT of Indonesian coal from Indonesia. The final payment has already been received. The vessel is now scheduled to leave from Kalimantan on 2 May 2002 and arrive in Rotterdam on 4 May 2002.

Best regards,
Aldrich Jaya

email_chain.subject: Question about Refractive Index Equation
email_chain.body:
Hi Wim,

I was interested in your article about reflective materials in Nature. You had two equations for the refractive index in the article. I am trying to find a proof or derivation of one of those (the one that uses lambda and n) and wanted to see if you knew of a reference for it.

Thank you,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Question about Refractive Index Equation
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Thank you for your message. The equation n=1-sqrt(1-f)/2 is a very general one. It can be found in most books on electromagnetism and optics. I wrote down the reference where I first came across this equation in my Nature paper. Have a look at page 3. But you can also find it in more recent books on plasmonics. For example, in a book by Jain.

Best regards,
Wim

email_chain.subject: Re: Question about Refractive Index Equation
email_chain.body:
Hi Wim,

Do you have any notes or references for the derivation of the equation, f2=1-2n, when n=4*Pi/lambda*d*n*d?

Thanks,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Question about Refractive Index Equation
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Your question is not directly related to this particular website, so I'll reply via email.

The only literature I can think of are two references you probably already have found yourself:

(1) P. Drude, Handbuch der Radiologie, Leipzig: Barth, 1922 (p. 369)
(2) N. Jain, C. J. Kryzhanovsky, and C. H. Chen, Excitation and Detection of Surface Plasmons on Gold Films. In: T. Zimmermann, and A. Berger, eds., Coherence, Statistics, and Quantum Optics IV (Springer, 2005) 146-165

Drude's book is basically the bible on metallic materials.

Best regards,
Wim

email_chain.subject: Re: Question about Refractive Index Equation
email_chain.body:
Hi Wim,

Thanks for your reply. I found those references and have already read them, but I was looking for a clearer derivation that shows how the refractive index in that form, d*n/d, gets related to the frequency, lambda, and amplitude of the refractive index.

Thanks,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Question about Refractive Index Equation
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

I am not sure that there is a clear derivation that you are looking for. You can find it in some other books, but I doubt that you will be very happy with it, since the derivation would be so clear.

I would be very happy if someone from the audience of this website can help you by giving a clear derivation of f2=1-2n.

Best regards,
Wim

email_chain.subject: Learning Visit
email_chain.body: Good morning, Mr. Evin, How are you today? Yes, I’m coming to your house to learn. But, it’s raining. My parents and my brother, Arian, can’t come. We’re waiting for a better day. It’s a big problem. It’s about rain. Thank you. Yours, Kevin

email_chain.subject: Email Introduction Question
email_chain.body: Good afternoon. Glad to hear from you. Hope you are doing fine. Thank you so much for the great video. There is no doubt it is very helpful for us. One question I have is when I send a message by email, can I use 'This is' to introduce myself? I saw a very interesting movie at the cinema. It is about a cat with a magic ability. What do you think about it? The movie is really enjoyable. Thanks a lot. Kevin

email_chain.subject: Re: Email Introduction Question
email_chain.body: Hello Kevin, Thank you so much for sending us a lovely song. Your friend Kevin is a great singer. Your English is really good, too. I'm happy you wrote to us. You can use 'This is' to introduce your message. You can say something like 'This is a song my friend Kevin sings.' 'This is an email I sent my friend Kelly last week.' You can ask a question and talk about a movie like this: 'How was the movie about the cat with a magic ability? It sounds interesting.' Or you can say, 'I'm glad you liked the movie about the cat with a magic ability.' I hope you have a great day. Be well! Olivia and the Yip sisters.

email_chain.subject: Cargo Movement Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good morning Joseph,

Looking to move 500mt of D2 ex Singapore to Tozeur in early August. Do you have any knowledge of how the current strikes are affecting cargo movements?

Kind regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Movement Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

Yes, we've seen significant delays and cancellations due to the industrial action.

Kind regards,
Joseph

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Movement Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Joseph,

Do you have any idea how long these delays will continue for? Just wondering if it's worth waiting and seeing what happens or if we should already be looking at alternative routings.

Best regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Movement Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

With the strikes still continuing, it's difficult to say for sure when cargo movements will return to normal. However, it's worth considering alternative routings, as delays and cancellations are likely to persist in the short term.

Kind regards,
Joseph

email_chain.subject: Review of Freight Container Contract
email_chain.body: Good morning Mr. Gonzales, Our team has been reviewing the contract for freight containers between Rotterdam and Naples for some weeks now. Do you have any further business questions or suggestions regarding our market analysis? Regards, Christa

email_chain.subject: Re: Review of Freight Container Contract
email_chain.body: Morning Christa, If I remember correctly, that contract included only containers shipped by steam ship, but I now know that steam ships have been replaced by modern container ships. I'd like to amend that contract for all types of modern container ships, with an expiration date. Regards, Hugo

email_chain.subject: Re: Review of Freight Container Contract
email_chain.body: Hi Hugo, I've found some documentation from the 1970s that state there was still a fair amount of containers transported by steam ship, despite being a less economical way to transport containers. What do you think? Regards, Christa

email_chain.subject: Re: Review of Freight Container Contract
email_chain.body: Hi Christa, That is no doubt true. Steam ships are extremely dangerous for the containers, even the newest containers. The vibrations produced by the steam engines, and the leaks from the boilers, damage most of the containers in transit. That is why we

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Ethylene Shipment from Houston to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Edmonds,

We are planning to send 8,600MT of ethylene from Houston to Antwerp. Could you please provide a cost estimate for this? Also, are your vessels' timing windows flexible?

Thank you,
Mariam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Ethylene Shipment from Houston to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Mariam,

It is understood that you have an ethylene export vessel currently positioned on the US Gulf Coast and that you are seeking a charter. We understand that your current vessel may need to bunker bunkers in Houston or be repositioned to Houston. The below details are for a voyage from Houston, US Gulf Coast to Antwerp, Belgium. It is understood that this cargo will be discharged within 21 days and loading of this cargo is to be completed within 24 hours of the vessel's arrival in Houston. The vessel will be available to be loaded up to April 25.

Our ethylene specialists will require the following documents to begin your voyage quotation:
- Bunker delivery note
- Documentation allowing for 2 bunkers at Houston
- Vessel details for identification
- Recent drydock certificate
- Current SGS dry cargo logbook

Thank you,
Mr. Edmonds

email_chain.subject: Software Development Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Developer,

We are interested in learning more about your experience with software development. Here are a few questions we have:

1. How many software projects do you currently have under development?
2. About how long have you been programming in Java?
3. Have you developed any Java GUI applications?
4. What IDE do you use to develop Java GUIs?
5. Have you been involved in any multi-threaded programming projects?
6. Have you developed any projects in C/C++?
7. Which C/C++ IDE have you used?
8. How many software projects have you completed in C/C++?
9. What do you think about C/C++ versus Java?
10. What are the things you like most about Java?
11. What are the things you like most about C/C++?
12. What do you think about Java GUIs?
13. What do you think about C/C++ GUIs?

Please let us know at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Recruiter

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for 200CTNs of T-shirts
email_chain.body:
Hello Yue,

We are shipping 200CTNs of T-shirts from Shanghai to Paris. Do you have space this month and how soon can we get a price?

Regards,
Jean

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 200CTNs of T-shirts
email_chain.body:
Hi Jean,

Thank you for your email. I would like to ask you some information regarding your shipment of T-shirts:
1) What is the mark or brand of the T-shirts?
2) What type of T-shirt is it? Tank, tube, long sleeve, short sleeve?
3) Is the T-shirt knitted or woven? And what kind of knit or weave?
4) Does it have any decoration on it? What type of decoration?
5) What type of fabric is it? What is the denier, threads, and fiber count?
6) What is the weight of a T-shirt?
7) Do you want us to pay for the cost of freight, or do you want us to put it on your invoice?
8) How many items in one package?

If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

Best regards,
Yue

email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry for Urea Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Walters,

We have cargo for 12,000 MT of urea from Pengerang to Las Palmas in September. The BAF should be around $120/MT (based on old fix as BAF has changed dramatically). However, if a General Declaration of Weight (GdW) is used, please be aware that the vessel will likely be late when BAF is calculated.

Best regards,
Broker

email_chain.subject: Update on Urea Purchase and Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Walters,

We are still in contact with our vendors in Nanded and are anticipating a price at the end of next week for up to 20,000 MT of various types of urea. As the quantities can change daily, we would like you to provide the last two digits of your credit card number.

I will call you later today to discuss this and to arrange for a flight to Mumbai. As you know, we need to be flexible on the types of urea and quantities, but please feel free to send a list of your requirements. We are anticipating that we may receive it in three or four shipments, so that may be something to consider. Please also provide us with a list of the vessels that you have available.

We are looking forward to seeing you.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Request for Lumber Transport Quote
email_chain.body: Hi Paul, We need 1,200MT of lumber transported from Miami to Aruba. Can you please get us a price? Many thanks, Manuel

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Lumber Transport Quote
email_chain.body: Dear Manuel, I have good news and bad news. The good news is that I have the freight prices for Miami to Aruba. The bad news is that the prices are sky high. I'll be happy to help with the planning of the move, but I'm afraid that there is no way you can make that transport by boat. Unless you want to take a steamer to South America and leave your lumber there, I would suggest that you wait until the next hurricane season, when you'll find the rate a little bit lower. Good luck with the move. Best wishes, Paul

email_chain.subject: Alternative Freight Prices
email_chain.body: Dear Madoka, I have good news and bad news. The good news is that I have the freight prices for Miami to Aruba, and the bad news is that the prices are sky high. Here are some alternatives that you can consider: Miami to Belize: $225 per MT, Miami to Trinidad: $270 per MT, Miami to Cozumel: $275 per MT, Miami to Puerto Rico: $180 per MT, Miami to Havana: $165 per MT, Miami to Venezuela: $240 per MT, Miami to Guantanamo: $175 per MT, Miami to Bahamas: $235 per MT, Miami to Colombia: $250 per MT, Miami to Curacao: $220 per MT. Best wishes, Paul

email_chain.subject: Automobile Transport from Osaka to Tokyo
email_chain.body: Dear Paul, We are going to be moving an automobile from Osaka to Tokyo. The auto is for a young boy, and he is really excited to be getting it. Best regards, Jacinta

email_chain.subject: Scrap Steel Delivery to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Hi Ben,

Our ship is currently in Singapore and we have about 2,500 metric tons of scrap steel to deliver to Osaka. Would you be interested?

Kind regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Scrap Steel Delivery to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Hi Scott,

Thanks for getting in touch. Yes, we’d be interested in 2,500 metric tons of scrap metal. Our usual suppliers are in Malaysia but since you’re in the same port and the scrap is going to the same destination, that’s good news.

How soon can the cargo be delivered to us? We need a bit more information to give you an accurate quote. Do you have the total quantity of each grade and length of scrap, or are you able to send us a sample?

Kind regards,
Ben

email_chain.subject: Re: Scrap Steel Delivery to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Hi Ben,

Thanks for your reply. Our price is US$55 per ton. The grades of steel we have available are:

* SS 200# (bent) * 80” – 180”
* SS 200# (straight) * 80” – 180”

Please let us know if you need any further details.

Kind regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Vessel Schedule and Pilot Services
email_chain.body:
When the following vessel calls in Gdynia for loading, can it come back to Liverpool and unload the same day?

Regards,
Noa

Choose between any two of the three email styles when writing your email to tell us how you will use the template. If you have a preferred style then mention it, or say you’re indifferent.

Pilot services from Sulzheim and Ettlingen are mandatory for tankers. On all other tank terminals in the Rhine region, pilot services are mandatory for vessels over a certain draft. Pilot services are mandatory for tankers and those vessels that do not have a ship’s master certified for the canal.

The minimum towage rates of the EUROTUG pilots are for short draft vessels. EUROTUG reserves the right to calculate the pilotage fees differently. Should you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact the Pilots.

email_chain.subject: Tonnage Availability for Petcoke Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Liam,

Do you have available tonnage for 18,000MT of petcoke from Kandla to Mathura? Could you please provide a market quote and the terms of the charter?

Cheers,
George

email_chain.subject: Re: Tonnage Availability for Petcoke Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

Looks like there are some port delays going through Kandla. We only have tonnage fixed to Mumbai/Kochi. The next most recent port is Chennai. Do you have any interest in loading at Chennai?

Best Regards,
Liam

email_chain.subject: Re: Tonnage Availability for Petcoke Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Liam,

Thanks for your reply.

How about Mumbai for delivery? That would be okay with us.

Cheers,
George

email_chain.subject: Re: Tonnage Availability for Petcoke Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

We only have one vessel in the Gulf that could arrive in Mumbai within your timeframes. It will be in Lasbela (Mub) on 11th July, and can be ready to load on the 13th or 14th July. It is available until 17th July. As it's currently chartered, the berth time will be 10 days at a minimum. The vessel is loading cargo in Tamil Nadu and is due to arrive in Mumbai on July 11th. After that, the ship could sail straight to Mathura, avoiding Mumbai if needed. However, it will likely have 1-2 days at anchor in Mumbai, plus waiting for the berth to be available.

Best Regards,
Liam

email_chain.subject: Re: Tonnage Availability for Petcoke Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

Thank you for your interest. I have since received an enquiry for a different cargo type that the ship could load in Mumbai, so I'm going to offer it to the client in that case. Unfortunately, that means it's not available to you. But please let me know if you are still interested in a ship that could load there, and I will be able to let you know whether the ship is free or not.

Best Regards,
Liam

email_chain.body:

Hope to hear from you soon.

Regards,
Kai

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Light Distillates Cargo from Brazil to Italy
email_chain.body:
Kai,

Thank you very much for your response.

We can use the Baltic area. We can also use the US Gulf.

All right. I will talk with you soon.

Regards,
Kathy

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Oil Rig Transportation
email_chain.body:

Raymond

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Oil Rig Transportation
email_chain.body:

Regards,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Oil Rig Transportation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lam,

The reason I have not confirmed anything is that we are still having difficulties with our parent company regarding terms and conditions, which will affect our ability to use the carrier you quoted.

Regards,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Oil Rig Transportation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lam,

In this industry, you are quite familiar with having your fair share of trouble with clients, and usually, you are able to convince the customer of a good deal. I am aware you have a difficult position in this matter as well. However, I am hoping to use this situation to demonstrate my abilities in negotiations and persuasion. I am sorry for having put you into this difficult position.

Sincerely,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Oil Rig Transportation

Dear Mr. Lam,

Sincerely,
Raymond

email_chain.body:

Best Regards,
Wang

Hi Tito,

Sorry, the rate I quoted before is incorrect. Please check my email one more time.

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: Correction to Quoted Rate
email_chain.body:

Tito

email_chain.subject: Re: Correction to Quoted Rate

Dear Tito,

Thanks for your email. Actually, you should pay attention to the page number on each email. The 89,000 is from my email 3, and the 90,000 is from my email 1. So you can choose 89,000 or 90,000. You can do CIF terms.

Validity is 60 days.

Regards,
Wang

email_chain.subject: Import Delivery Under EXW Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Pal,

Could you please advise if we can deliver your import under EXW terms? If so, could you provide a copy of the bill of lading as soon as it is available, and make sure you've sent a pre-arrival notification of the cargo and owner's details, so that we can facilitate berth preparations and other documentation.

Looking forward to hearing from you,
Yi-shen

email_chain.subject: Re: Import Delivery Under EXW Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Yi-shen,

We can deliver your import cargo under EXW terms. In fact, our suppliers can sell our product under CIF terms, but our cargo is already loaded, and I think our transportation cost under CIF may be higher than ex-works.

I would like to ask you if we can provide you with a copy of the B/L before arrival. Could you advise on whether this will be a problem for you?

As for other documentation, we are not sure how to fill it in, because we only supply high technology components, and your export will be the final user.

Many thanks for your kind assistance.

Regards,
Terry

email_chain.subject: Re: Import Delivery Under EXW Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Terry,

We do require a copy of the bill of lading to be sent to us before arrival. As for the final user, we don't mind, but we will need the information on the final user on the bill of lading, and we would like to know the manufacturer of the products as well, which I will need you to provide us with.

Regards,
Yi-shen

email_chain.subject: Re: Import Delivery Under EXW Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Yi-shen,

Thanks for your reply.

We are very sorry, but I am afraid we are unable to provide you with the final user, because the purchase of our product is for internal use only. As for the name of the manufacturer, we are afraid that we are not allowed to disclose such information.

We are very sorry that we cannot help you.

Best Regards,
Terry

email_chain.subject: Instructions for Importing Shipping Email Dataset
email_chain.body:
To import the Shipping Email dataset, follow these steps:
1. Select EMAILS in the Model section in the menu bar.
2. If you haven't saved your file yet, do so by selecting the first tab in the bottom section of the view menu.
3. Click on the plus button and select Import Dataset.
4. You will be directed to choose a file. Download the dataset from the FISAI_22 assignment page and select the file Shipping Emails.xlsx.
5. Once the upload is finished, you can check your data. Each shipping email will be represented by two different elements: (Value, Time of writing, Sender, Recipient, Port of Departure, Port of Arrival).
Example:
<Value> <Time of writing>
Mr/Ms <Sender> [Hamburg]
Hi <Recipient>,
<Message>

email_chain.subject: Import Shipping Email Dataset Reminder
email_chain.body:
This is a reminder to import the Shipping Email dataset. Follow these steps:
1. Select EMAILS in the Model section in the menu bar.
2. If you haven't saved your file yet, do so by selecting the first tab in the bottom section of the view menu.
3. Click on the plus button and select Import Dataset.
4. You will be directed to choose a file. Download the dataset from the FISAI_22 assignment page and select the file Shipping Emails.xlsx.
5. Once the upload is finished, you can check your data. Each shipping email will be represented by two different elements: (Value, Time of writing, Sender, Recipient, Port of Departure, Port of Arrival).
Example:
<Value> <Time of writing>
Mr/Ms <Sender> [Hamburg]
Hi <Recipient>,
<Message>

email_chain.subject: Steel Shipment from Paldock to Monrovia
email_chain.body: Hello Ben, We’re looking to ship 20,000MT of steel from Paldock to Monrovia. Could you send us your FCL rate and ETA? Also, is it possible to do a post-dated bill of lading? Thanks, Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Paldock to Monrovia
email_chain.body: Hi Grace, Attached you will find our quotations for Paldock to Monrovia for your steel cargo. We will send your cargo within three days of receipt of your irrevocable letter of credit in our account in London. Could you confirm that the steel can be shipped in containers? If not, do you have other requirements (such as barge?); and do you have any specific requirements for the steel? We can carry the bill of lading either to bearer or to the order of your bank, as you require. If you would like us to carry the bill of lading to bearer, please let us know when to expect the irrevocable letter of credit in our London account. You will find our payment terms at the bottom of the quotations. Please confirm your requirements and send us a draft irrevocable letter of credit to enable us to proceed. Best regards, Ben

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Paldock to Monrovia
email_chain.body: Thank you very much. The cargo will be shipped in 20-foot containers, with 400 pieces per container. The cargo will be steel bars. Please deliver the bill of lading to bearer. I have forwarded the irrevocable letter of credit. Best regards, Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Paldock to Monrovia
email_chain.body: Hello Grace, We have received your request. We will charge you USD 700 per 20-foot container. We will deliver the bill of lading as follows: We will issue the bill of lading to bearer. We will send the bill of lading and the other shipping documents to you within five days of the date that we receive the irrevocable letter of credit in our account in London. Best regards, Ben

email_chain.subject: Pricing Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Gloria,

Could you provide me with pricing for travel from Chicago to Charleston?

Kind regards,
Marshall

email_chain.subject: Re: Pricing Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Marshall,

We have a quote for you:

- Arrival to Charleston: 15 Aug 2013
- Departure from Chicago: 25 Aug 2013
- Return from Charleston to Chicago: 31 Aug 2013

Options with stopovers:
- 1 stopover in Chicago, return on 30 Aug or 1 Sep
- 2 stopovers in Chicago, return on 30 Aug or 1 Sep

Pricing:
- Roundtrip ticket: $845.00
- One-way ticket to Charleston: $430.00

Best regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Re: Pricing Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Marshall,

Unfortunately, airlines cannot price out with more than 2 stops. When I inquired about the possibility of pricing with 3 stops, I was informed that all airlines in the U.S. have a maximum of 2 stops when pricing with multiple stops.

I spoke with someone who suggested a stopover in Honolulu on the return trip for better pricing, but they never sent me a new quote.

Additionally, here's what you received as a reply to an inquiry from a California attorney. They included a $1,000 retainer but apparently never had the retainer sent or received confirmation.

18 years of training lawyers not to charge for consults isn't being applied.

@lawyer.twitter.com <1>
@lawyer.twitter.com <2>

Best regards,
Richard Millington

email_chain.subject: Re: Legal Representation
email_chain.body:
Here is our quote:

A new retainer agreement will need to be signed by both parties and sent to our office within two days from today with the $1,000 retainer fee. If it is not returned within two days, I will assume you are no longer interested in representation.

Ok to proceed? If you have any questions regarding my fees, please let me know.

Best regards,
Lawyer

email_chain.subject: Re: Legal Representation
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your reply. I will start working on a list of questions for you, which may take me another day to prepare. Once I'm ready to move forward, I'll send you an email.

I found you through your Twitter account. I look forward to working with you.

Best regards,
Richard Millington

email_chain.subject: Shipment of Waste Plastic Film from Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Scott,

We have a 5,000MT shipment of waste plastic film from Fuzhou to Tianjin that will be finished by July 28. What is the best lead time you can offer, and will you be able to cover our last two shipments for $2,500?

Regards,
Annabelle

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Waste Plastic Film from Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Annabelle,

Thank you for your e-mail. I have several storage tanks and packing equipment available and I will be able to accept a 5,000MT shipment of waste plastic film starting July 28. As for the lead time, it will take me about four days to finish the tanking of the plastic film. I can do all the loading, stuffing, and lashing, and you will be responsible for the fixing and sealing of the hatch. Will the cargo be using hatch cover or will it be double-containerized? Please advise, so I can make the necessary arrangements for the storage.

Regarding your request to cover the last two shipments for $2,500, we could not accept this kind of condition because the terminal handling fees and port storage costs are already included in the quoted price. I think the best arrangement we could do is to have a rate adjustment.

Best regards,
Mrs. Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Waste Plastic Film from Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Scott,

It's Scarlett again. Sorry for the late reply. Our cargo will be using hatch cover. The cargo for the past three shipments will arrive in Tianjin tomorrow. We expect the same quality as before. Please have the cargo loaded as soon as possible and arrange for delivery to our designated terminal before August 15. If everything goes as expected, we will make arrangements for the second shipment.

Best regards,
Scarlett

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Waste Plastic Film from Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Scarlett,

Thank you for your e-mail. Our storage tanks are now available for your cargo. We will need a 10-ton forklift for loading and your cargo will need to use the hatch cover. We do not have much free space at the moment because we have some building works here. There is only a bit of room for our trucks to maneuver around the storage tanks.

Best regards,
Mrs. Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Waste Plastic Film from Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Scott,

10 tons of cargo were loaded yesterday, but we still have some cargo remaining. Please advise the last day we will need to load this cargo to our storage tanks. We expect the cargo to be in good condition and hope that the waiting time at the terminal will not affect your schedule. Please be advised that the available forklifts can only lift a maximum of 10 tons at a time.

Regards,
Scarlett

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Waste Plastic Film from Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Scarlett,

The cargo was loaded yesterday, and I will make arrangements for the delivery of the cargo to the port as soon as possible. We have some pending works in the area that may cause traffic congestion, but we hope this will not delay the delivery of the cargo to the port. We have a team that will be stationed at the port for the smooth delivery of the cargo.

Best regards,
Mrs. Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Waste Plastic Film from Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Scarlett,

Please be advised that the cargo was delivered at 10 a.m. this morning. Our team will keep track of the cargo at all times. We will also keep you updated about the cargo's movement in case we need to deliver the cargo before the schedule. We look forward to doing business with you.

Regards,
Scarlett

email_chain.subject: Impact of Seablue Grounding on Crude Fixing
email_chain.body:
Hi Kathy,

Has the grounding of the Seablue had any impact on your crude fixing level for the short term?

Thanks,
Blayney

email_chain.subject: Re: Impact of Seablue Grounding on Crude Fixing
email_chain.body:
Hi Blayney,

Not at all. Seablue is a crude vessel and almost all crude cargoes have been fixed by the other time-chartered tankers coming out of Chinese yards.

As I mentioned previously, if Seablue did not come out in China, other tankers would come out of the dock and China would be fixed. These tankers would operate at a price level set by the most competitive time charter tanker which is the drydocked Seablue and therefore the price level at which China is fixed would not be different even if Seablue was out of the drydock.

LPG cargoes are different since we cannot use LPG in the crude tankers and crude cargoes are not as easy to fix as LPG, since many producers are contracted and certain prices are set.

The next drydocked Seablue is in

Best regards,
Kathy

And I have checked all the schedules but couldn't find any open slots at all. Our maximum charterers' credit limit is $4M and vessel's $1M. Could you please check again and give us some price guidance?

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Inquiry for Iron Ore Fines Shipment
email_chain.body: I do not know why the shipment is only for 11,200MT. As to the vessel's credit limit, we have a blank vessel from Sinil lines which will sail from Qingdao to Haiphong. The charterer has issued a full credit, and the full trip rate is $41,000. I am waiting for an update from my colleague, who is on leave now.

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Inquiry for Iron Ore Fines Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Lawrence,

I can suggest you the best way to charter is to rely on a good credit insurance to cover all risks. Otherwise, how do you want to go ahead and do the charterer in Hong Kong to sign the credit limit? A reputable credit insurance should insure the credit. In a credit insurance, an ABG can find a solution for a charterer in Hong Kong. Otherwise, your chartering manager from ABG is free.

email_chain.body:

Best,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Financing for Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dr. Al-Bashir,

We are extremely interested in moving forward with our transaction. We can finance 50% of the $800,000, and we need to know how you will finance the other $400,000. I am prepared to wire you $100,000 towards the transaction on the condition that you forward the remaining $300,000 (and the ship documents) within 10 days of receiving this deposit. I understand that this is a small amount relative to the transaction, but I am sending you this deposit on the condition that it will be returned within 14 days if you are not able to complete the transaction. Since this is not a substantial amount, I expect that you will not have any difficulty in wiring me back the $100,000. I am sending you this cash transfer request by express courier today. Please send me a confirmation of the receipt of my transfer.

Best,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Re: Financing for Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Raymond,

I am really sorry for the delay on our side. I was out of the office due to personal reasons for a few days. We have paid all our bills and we have enough funds. I just need your Bank’s Swift Code and your Account Number, then we can proceed to making the payment today.

Regards,
Mohammed Al-Bashir
Managing Director
World Holdings

email_chain.subject: Re: Financing for Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Al-Bashir,

My bank in the Bahamas will be expecting $300,000 today for your company. I understand that you will be wiring me $100,000 as soon as you receive the funds. I will inform my bank that they should expect your wire transfer. Thank you, again.

Sincerely,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Transaction Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Al-Bashir,

This email is attached. I hope this is acceptable to you. We understand that you wish to start the transaction, but you must not expect any additional funds from us. We can only provide the funds for the oil and the delivery of the oil. Your company, at this point, must make payment for the delivery of the oil.

Regards,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

I have a load of palm kernel oil coming from Port Klang to Male. I’d like to move 5,000MT of oil. I have an email below from a freight forwarder in Port Klang, could you help me out with an indicative freight?

Cheers,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Mona,

Thanks for the enquiry. So you are looking for a freight quote to move 5,000MT of palm kernel oil from Port Klang to Male?

I’ll need more details about the cargo before I can give you a quote. Could you please let me know:

- the quality and cleanliness of the cargo,
- the minimum temperature the cargo must be kept at on board,
- if you need a refrigerated vessel, and
- what type of stowage is required.

I’ll also need to know who will arrange for the stowage, loading, discharge, and clearance as this will affect the charges.

Please email all these details to me as soon as you can. Once I have the information, I will be able to provide you with an indicative freight quote.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about G20 Finance Ministers' Meeting Results
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I hope you are doing well. Can you tell me where I can find the results of the G20 meeting? I am particularly interested in the outcomes of the finance ministers’ meeting and their discussions on future financial regulation.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Impact of G20 on Economic Regulation
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I am writing to you because I have a question about the impact of the G20 on economic regulation. Are you familiar with any economic models that have been developed to analyze the impact of the G20 on regulation?

I would appreciate your insight on this topic, as I am currently writing a paper on the topic for a course.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Outcomes of Recent G20 Meeting on Financial Regulation
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I hope you are doing well. I am interested in learning more about the outcomes of the recent G20 meeting on financial regulation. Can you tell me if there were any particular highlights or agreements that stood out to you during the meeting?

I am also curious about the future of financial regulation in light of the G20's recommendations. Will these recommendations be enough to address the issues that were discussed at the meeting?

I would appreciate your insights on these questions, as I am currently researching this topic for a paper.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: G20's Role in Financial Regulation
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I hope you are well. I am writing to you because I have a question about the G20's role in financial regulation. As I understand it, the G20 is a group of the world's leading economies that comes together to discuss and set guidelines for the global financial system.

My question is, what role does the G20 play in promoting financial stability? Are there any specific regulations or guidelines that the G20 has put in place to prevent financial crises from occurring in the future?

I am particularly interested in understanding the role of the G20 in promoting transparency and accountability in the global financial system.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to your response.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Request for Margin Fee Assistance

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Margin Fee Assistance

They represent a major Japanese refiner, Osaka Gas. It’s true that this is a complicated trading project and we have to pay a relatively high margin fee of USD 1,000,000. If you don’t mind, I can arrange to send you the contract and payment procedure, so that you can fully understand the situation. Have a good day. Kim

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for Urea
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Cui,

The earliest transshipment vessel for urea from Iraq to Ho Chi Minh City in August is CTI CHAMPION, scheduled to arrive at Latti on 6/8. You are willing to transship at Latti, and your vessel leaves from Latti on 12/8. Can you confirm the above arrangement?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Yours sincerely,
Johnson

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for Urea
email_chain.body:
It is estimated that the journey will take two days (CTI CHAMPION can arrive at Latti on 6/8, and can leave from Latti on 12/8. If CTI CHAMPION leaves from Latti on 13/8, then the transportation is too late and is unacceptable by the company).

Johnson did not clearly state the cost of transportation.

The seller does not provide the prices of urea.

email_chain.body:

Just wanted to touch base on the chlorosilane we last spoke about. It’s going to take a little longer to get the ships out, and I’m wondering if you might be able to send a few more details of your offer. Specifically, we’re looking at a freight rate between $150-170/MT, and what can you do about the B/L structure?

Look forward to hearing from you,
Alan

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Chlorosilane Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Alan,

I think you are being too strong in some of your statements regarding the vessel. I saw the clinker/coal traffic, but that was a mix of loaded and empty coming from one shipper. I’m just trying to help you work your freight rates.

Below is my question in regard to pricing. When will we hear something back about the freight? We have the timing set for this item at the customer. The timeline could slip a little if we have to adjust.

Best,
Jonathan

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Chlorosilane Shipment
email_chain.body:
Alan,

We really need to get a price on the chlorosilane. It seems the customer may be able to delay the shipment a few days, so I am trying to negotiate your price down. Can you please send your email with a bit more detail and info?

Best,
Joh

Hi Joh,

$150-170/MT is a really wide range. How can we know what to quote? Jonathan should have been more clear in his first email.

email_chain.subject: Grain Transshipment Options
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Cooper,

We are considering two options for transshipments of grain from New York to Vladivostok. Please advise your ETA for your next sailing from each port and the expected transit time for each option.

Regards,
Marina

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Transshipment Options
email_chain.body:
Mr. Marina,

I have added our schedule below:

ETA                       Port                  Days at Port
Nov 23                         New York                1
Nov 26                          New York                1
Nov 27                          New York                1
Nov 28                          New York                1
Nov 30                          New York                1
Dec 2                           New York                1
Dec 3                           New York                1
Dec 4                           New York                1
Dec 5                           New York                1
Dec 7                           New York                1
Dec 8                           New York                1
Dec 9                           New York                1
Dec 11                          New York                1
Dec 12                          New York                1

Kind regards,
Cooper

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Transshipment Options
email_chain.body:
Mr. Cooper,

I was wondering if you could assist me by answering a few questions about our operations?

1. What does the above schedule imply for transit times?
2. How many times per year can you load at New York?
3. Can you accept transshipments of grain from the other side of the Atlantic (Netherlands, Belgium, Germany)?
4. How many times per year can you transship to Vladivostok from Europe?
5. What do your services entail?
6. Can you store bulk products in your vessels?
7. Do you have terminals in New York or Vladivostok?
8. What is your exact transshipment capability?

I appreciate your help!

Regards,
Marina

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Transshipment Options
email_chain.body:
Mr. Marina,

Sorry for the delay! I have some new information.

1. The transit time would be approx. 4 weeks. We normally handle bulk containers (20 feet and 40 feet) but we can try with other vessels if you want. We do not usually carry these products, but we can do it from 15,000 tons per trip.
2. We can accept transshipment of grain from other ports in Europe. In principle it is every two weeks from Europe (Netherlands, Belgium, Germany) with transshipment to Vladivostok once per month. You can also order grain from these ports for the transshipment in the United States.
3. Our services include transshipment of grain from the United States and transshipment from Europe to Vladivostok.

Kind regards,
Cooper

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Transshipment Options
email_chain.body:
Mr. Marina,

We do not have terminals in New York or Vladivostok.
5. We have been doing this for more than 5 years now.
6. We can store grains in our vessels.
7. Yes, we have transshipment capabilities of 70,000 tons.
8. We have 6,000 tons of grain in our inventory in the United States.

Kind regards,
Cooper

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Transshipment Options
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cooper,

Thank you for your quick responses. You provide an excellent and unique service, which is very interesting to us. If possible, please provide the following information:

1. Your average transshipment capacity in the United States.
2. Your average transshipment capacity in Europe (Netherlands, Belgium, Germany).

Regards,
Marina

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Woo,

Could you please provide a 7-day freight estimate for 25,000MT of oil from Copenhagen to Lagos?

Thanks,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

25,000 tons of oil from Copenhagen to Lagos in a seven-day freight? That's quite a bit of oil, Felipe. I assume you need to ship it by sea.

You see, the oil trade operates on a just-in-time inventory management model, whereby oil is shipped to tankers as needed. This provides a stable supply and demand, eliminates inventory storage costs and prevents oil from degrading over time.

Since your request involves shipping 25,000 tons of oil in seven days, my freight quote estimate would exceed what is available.

Please confirm that your request is for 25,000 tons of oil in a seven-day freight and I can provide a quote to the maximum that is available to my company.

Thanks,
Perry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Perry,

Yes, my request is for 25,000 tons of oil for shipping in seven days to Lagos, Nigeria. Could you please provide a quote?

Thanks,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

Again, shipping 25,000 tons in seven days is an unusual request. If you are shipping this amount of oil in an outbound tanker, then the only companies capable of doing so are Shell, Chevron, and Exxon. I don't have contacts with these companies.

If you're shipping by sea, then you'll need a port in Copenhagen to load onto a tanker. I've emailed my contacts in the seaport of Copenhagen. They'll be in touch with me in the morning.

If you're shipping by road, then the quantity would need to be in 45 liter plastic oil drums. The storage space and legal limitations of this option would be impossible to organize in such a short time frame.

I'm going to have to say 'no' to your request for shipping 25,000 tons of oil in seven days. I'm also saying 'no' to your request to contact the seaport in Copenhagen. If you insist, I'll let my seaport contacts know to contact you, but don't expect a reply.

I'm sorry, but I simply don't have the resources to fill your request. I'm going to have to recommend you submit your request to one of the three large oil companies I mentioned before.

I'd like to thank you for your business.

Regards,
Perry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Perry,

I am absolutely okay with you contacting the seaport in Copenhagen. I understand that you don't have the resources to fulfill my request. I will be submitting my request to an oil company.

Thanks,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

Yes, I've contacted the Copenhagen seaport. They say you're 'absolutely okay' with me contacting them? You see, the contact I've made at the seaport of Copenhagen is the Director. He's a very important person who receives hundreds of emails from oil dealers like yourself, so he just needs to be advised that the shipping in question is okay. He's very busy, but if he doesn't reply within two weeks, please email him directly to remind him. You can just copy me on the email.

This is your second response that implies you're okay with me contacting the seaport, so I'm sending you a copy of this email for your reference.

Thank you,
Perry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Perry,

Yes, please contact the seaport in Copenhagen. I will be submitting my request to an oil company.

Thanks,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Rate Confirmation for Oil Seed Cake
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Lewis,

Can you confirm the rates for 7,500MT of oil seed cake from Saint Petersburg to Seoul? Please include details on the length of laycan and any additional costs associated with accelerated discharge.

Regards,
Katherine

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Confirmation for Oil Seed Cake
email_chain.body:
Hi Katherine,

The following rates apply:

- Spot: $50 per MT over 20% IFM + 30/5/20 (laycan 7-10 days),
- Extended: $40 per MT over 20% IFM + 30/10/20 (laycan 10-14 days),
- Longer: $30 per MT over 20% IFM + 30/15/20 (laycan 14-21 days).

The above includes a fixed delay rate (FDR) of $5 per day for the first 7 days, then $10 per day for each day over the first 7 days to be paid on arrival (i.e., if the vessel is delayed 8 days, FDR is $70 - ($5x7) + ($10x1)).

The above does not include accelerated discharge charges.

Regards,
Mr. Lewis

email_chain.subject: Additional Information for Oil Seed Cake Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Katherine,

Thanks for your inquiry and interest in working with us.

I'd like to point out a few things that may be useful for you to consider when doing business with us:

* **Additional charges**: Please note that the above rates do not include accelerated discharge charges for +35 days cargo to be paid by the seller. You will need to bear this cost in mind when considering the above rates.

* **Availability of vessels**: I'm afraid vessel availability may be very limited in this trade during April-May 2023 due to the busy season. We have a few vessels that we can offer at the above rates, but they are all loaded already in their previous trades and are due to return to Russia after discharging. We'll require 20-30 days' notice from you to fit a ballast leg. Hence, you may consider booking a vessel now at the above rates.

Regards,
Mr. Lewis

email_chain.subject: Flexibility on Nailing and Lashing at Montevideo
email_chain.body:
Hello Min,

How flexible are you on the nailing and lashing requirements at Montevideo?

Thanks,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Flexibility on Nailing and Lashing at Montevideo
email_chain.body:
Dear Scott,

Montevideo is flexible on this issue provided the requirements of the church history museum are met. The museum is constructing a rock wall with hand-hewn timbers for the base to hold up the rocks. This wall will be constructed inside the museum to display this room. They will then hang two of our timbers from the inside of this rock wall with chains. The nailing requirement for these timbers will be strictly adhered to in the construction of the display. The museum has asked that the side facing the rock wall be prepared to display it with some sort of protective material. However, it would be the museum that would decide on the type of protective coating to be used. The only nailing that would have to be done at the Museum is for the display.

Best regards,
Min

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Timbers to Denmark
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

We would recommend that you bring the timbers. We have included some additional information below in hopes of answering some of the questions you have sent us in email. We need to know if you are interested in the display materials we have available for your timber and also the additional display material that your representative from us in Denmark has recommended.

You can find our current brochure at the following website. This has all of the prices and descriptions. Also in the attachments, you will find a form you can fill out and return to us with payment. One of the timbers can be sent via FedEx which will cost approximately 1,000 Danish Kroner.

Best regards,
Min

Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LPG Shipment from Dahej to Busan
email_chain.body:

I'll ask our local manager in Singapore to see if we can offer anything. Can you please confirm if your clients want us to submit FOB or CIF? Additionally, can you please confirm if your clients are looking for a Chinese registry vessel, or if they are open to other registries.

Thank you,
Ken

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for LPG Shipment from Dahej to Busan
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your reply, Ken.

Our client has given us the following details:
- The vessel should have a certificate of compliance.
- They prefer a newbuild vessel.
- They want a firm charter, not a time charter.
- For the charter party, they would like to use the Norwegian Shipbrokers' Standard Form.

Please let us know your availability.

Regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Draft Review: Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to share the latest draft of our joint paper with Raphael Ponge. The paper is currently under review at Ann. Pol. Math. and can be accessed here (after a short registration).

The aim of this article is to fill in some significant gaps in the proofs of two fundamental theorems for (non-commutative) freeness, namely Theorem 4.1 and Theorem 5.1 by Voiculescu, in the context of non self-adjoint operator algebras and relative freeness.

Please review and let me know your thoughts.

Best regards,
Denis Cavenagh

email_chain.subject: Fwd: Draft Review: Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Hi Raphael,

Denis has shared the latest draft of our joint paper. It is under review at Ann. Pol. Math. and can be accessed here (after a short registration).

The aim of this article is to fill in some significant gaps in the proofs of two fundamental theorems for (non-commutative) freeness, namely Theorem 4.1 and Theorem 5.1 by Voiculescu, in the context of non self-adjoint operator algebras and relative freeness.

Please review and let me know your thoughts.

Best regards,
Michael Skeide

email_chain.subject: Re: Draft Review: Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Hi Denis,

I have reviewed the latest draft of our paper. It looks great and addresses the gaps in the proofs effectively. I have a few minor suggestions which I will send over shortly.

Best regards,
Raphael Ponge

email_chain.subject: Re: Draft Review: Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Raphael has reviewed the draft and has a few minor suggestions. I will incorporate them and send the updated version for your review.

Best regards,
Denis Cavenagh

Regards,
Lukas

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Tanker Availability

Ms. Olsen,

Thank you for your response.

If you have availability for your 50,000 DWT vessel between 1st September and 5th September for a 7,000 DWT loading, please send me the preliminary vessel specifications and/or price. We are willing to buy at CBOT.

Please also send me the layout of the vessel. I am very interested in the number of ballast tanks. Also, the fuel consumption is an important factor for us. If the price is around $17/MT, that would be nice. I also assume that the ETA is close to 35 days. If the price is $20/MT, we do not want to continue. Can you please confirm these dates?

Regards,
Lukas

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Shipment of Solar Panels from Shanghai to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Hello,

We are booking a shipment of solar panels for Colombo from Shanghai at the beginning of October. Could you please let me know if there will be any availability on your vessel at that time, and what the total costs for carriage from FOB Shanghai to Colombo would be?

Sincerely,
Anonymous

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipment of Solar Panels from Shanghai to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Dear Anonymous,

Thank you for your inquiry. We currently have no space available on our vessel for this shipment. Our other vessel is also fully booked until the end of September.

However, we will keep your information on file in case of any changes or cancellations with other shipments.

Sincerely,
Anonymous

email_chain.subject: Update on Shipment Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Anonymous,

Our other vessel has now become available for this shipment. We have reserved space for you on the departure date of 2nd October.

The total costs for carriage from FOB Shanghai to Colombo are as follows:
+ Freight: $1000
+ Cost: $250
Total: $1250

Please confirm whether you can accept these terms before we proceed with formal confirmation of booking.

Sincerely,
Anonymous

email_chain.subject: Re: Update on Shipment Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Anonymous,

Thank you for confirming that you can accept these terms. Our vessel will depart from Shanghai on the 2nd October and arrive at Colombo on the 18th October.

We look forward to working with you again in the future.

Sincerely,
Anonymous

email_chain.subject: Update on Shipment Status
email_chain.body:
Dear Anonymous,

We would like to update you on the status of your shipment. Our vessel has arrived at Shanghai on schedule and is currently loading the cargo. We expect all loading to be complete by the end of this week.

We will keep you updated with any further developments.

Sincerely,
Anonymous

email_chain.subject: Delay in Loading
email_chain.body:
Dear Anonymous,

Thank you for your inquiry. Unfortunately, there was a slight delay in loading due to some technical issues with the vessel. The loading process is now complete and the vessel is scheduled to depart from Shanghai tomorrow as planned.

Sincerely,
Anonymous

email_chain.body:

I want to send an email saying something like this:

Hi Sebastian,

No.

Kind regards,
Rachel

I have to say this in an email and I want to make sure it is polite. Should it be 'no', 'no.', or 'No.' or something else? Should I write my own name, or put it as 'Rachel' and what about the title? email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Ro-Ro Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi, Would you mind helping us with the following enquiry: Type of cargo: 22,000MT of Ro-Ro Iron Ore. Port of Loading: Santos, Brazil. Discharge Port: Lomé, Togo. Loading date: 16 September 2016. Discharge date: 30 September 2016. Laycan: Oct/Nov 2016. Vessel: Handysize bulk carrier for single vessel transportation. Special equipment or requirement: Deck load of 20MT/m2 with 4.5m on centre line and 2m side shift. Owners will be responsible for all charter party and commercial documents. Minimum charter period: 18 days. Confirmation of your interest and earliest best offer. Regards, Fred

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Ro-Ro Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Sir, We are a professional team based in Singapore, working for our end clients in cargo brokerage and chartering for several years. Our services also include cargo surveying, insurance claim handling, cargo delivery, charter party preparation, and verification. Please do kindly provide us with the following information: Where is the loading port? Where is the discharging port? What type of vessel do you need for the cargo delivery? Estimated loading & discharging dates? Would it be possible for you to provide us with your B/L copy and load port documentation? Is there any insurance, risk, or danger of marine pollution risk involved with the cargo during transportation? Please also let us know your minimum hire period. Any special requirement or instruction in terms of cargo handling & delivery? We look forward to hearing from you soon.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Ro-Ro Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Fred, My best regards to you! Thank you for your email on 8th Sept. This is Jun Wu with the CARGOTRANS team in Shenzhen, China. We’re very pleased to discuss the details of the shipment with you! The detailed information of your cargo is as follows: Loading port: Santos, Brazil. Discharging port: Lomé, Togo. Loading date: Sept. 16, 2016. Discharging date: Oct. 17, 2016. Vessel type: Handysize Bulker for single vessel transportation. Vessel size: No less than 15,000 MT. Cargo type: Ro-Ro Iron ore. Owner will bear all charter party & commercial documents. Deck load: 20MT/m2, 4.5m on centre line, and 2m side shift. Regards, Jun Wu

email_chain.subject: Scam Alert: Email Chain Analysis
email_chain.body: There are 47 emails that look like this, each filled with valuable information, contact info, and requests from scammers. Following these scams' leads, investigators can map out the chain of people behind the scam, determine the next target, and watch them open suspicious links or respond to scam emails. An analysis of the replies to this chain of emails shows that four or more people are involved with creating and supporting these scams. In a world of complex scams, one of the best methods of prevention is education. The more people who are aware of and reject a scam, the less impact it will have on those who don't know any better. To this end, this data has been released to the public to help everyone understand the impact of mass marketing scams. A few highlights of this scam's attempt to fool millions of people include:

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for 700MT of Pharmaceuticals from Riga to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Dear Max,

We’re looking to ship 700MT of pharmaceuticals from Riga to Dubai. How much time do you need to find a suitable vessel?

Regards,
Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 700MT of Pharmaceuticals from Riga to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Hello Grace,

I can give you an idea. My colleague has shared the shipping route from Riga to Dubai. But before I start my search, I would like to hear more about the shipment:
  - How will the goods be loaded? (LCL or FCL)
  - What is the nature of the cargo?
  - What will be the mode of shipment?
  - When do you expect to move the cargo?
  - Is it an urgent shipment? (Please provide the documents)

Regards,
Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 700MT of Pharmaceuticals from Riga to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Dear Max,

We want to ship it by sea with both FCL and LCL. Please give me a quote.

Regards,
Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 700MT of Pharmaceuticals from Riga to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Hi Grace,

Thanks for the response. The goods will be packed as FCL or LCL at the destination warehouse in Riga.

Regards,
Max

email_chain.subject: Current Status of the Vessel
email_chain.body:
What's the current status of the vessel? Any news you can share?

Best,
Nada

email_chain.subject: Re: Current Status of the Vessel
email_chain.body:
Hi Nada,

Here are the latest developments on Almarakib:

Almarakib is outward bound.

Two reasons:
1. Almarakib's Pakistani captain is low on funds and is able to transport items from our port to Pakistan to earn some quick cash. He's a freelancer by nature and is more than happy to take on whatever job comes his way as long as he gets his money upfront.

2. He is asking for $30,000 upfront. We will take out a loan for the money. We cannot afford the loan. I must sell off my share of the ship to pay it back.

I am writing this email on my phone from the bank.

I have agreed to let the bank have your share of the ship and pay off the loan.

Best,
Sada

I have a great deal for Wanganui if you can accept it. May I know if the buyer will accept all shipments? If not, we can try and split the sugar for different buyers, so that all shipments are loaded.

email_chain.subject: Details for Sugar Shipment to Wanganui

Case I:
10kMT Sugar Qty

3500MT
2500MT
500MT

Quantity: 5500MT

Containerized Sugar Qty

3550MT
2950MT
200MT

Overall Average Unit Rate USD 330 (converted from USD 345 / MT)

email_chain.subject: Quote Request for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Anderson,

Would you please provide a quote for our shipment of 10,000MT of M.G. wheat from Dalian to Durban? Can you include any extra charges for overweight or additional services?

Thank you,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Quote for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

Thank you for your quote. Your quote of $7,350 is a great value for a premium wheat like our MG and we were hoping you would have enough of the stock to allow us to charter your vessel to Dalian to load. When is your next voyage to Dalian?

If we could charter your vessel directly from your current port, perhaps London, then that would greatly reduce our shipping costs and we would definitely prefer to charter with you. We will arrange for our vessel to load with your wheat and deliver it to Dalian where we will book a voyage to Durban.

We look forward to hearing from you,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Quote for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

Thank you for your reply. Although we understand that your vessel is heading to Australia, you may be aware that we will have the opportunity to charter a vessel that is in Durban. Please let us know if this is feasible.

Regards,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Quote Approval
email_chain.body:
Mr. Anderson,

We believe your quote for $6,500 is very attractive. We are holding the quote open until the end of the week to allow time for our enquiry to be approved.

Thank you,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Quote for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

Thank you for your reply. We look forward to hearing back from you by Thursday when we will be able to consider your revised quote.

Regards,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Quote for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

We note your revised quote is less competitive than your original quote of $7,350. As we stated in our first enquiry, we are trying to obtain the best value for our shipment of wheat and it would be unwise to have a new agent. We still hold your initial quote of $7,350 open for the time being.

Regards,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability and Charter Conditions
email_chain.body:

Please confirm the availability of a suitable vessel to load at Dalian to deliver to Durban. Can you provide us with your General Conditions of Charter and Charter Party for our approval?

Daniel
