email_chain.subject: Availability of C-Flex 1100 Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

Your new C-Flex 1100 vessels have arrived at Ningbo Port. Would you like to charter this for our next shipment of cargo from Ningbo to Hai Phong? It’s a 4,000-ton shipment of polystyrene.

When do you plan to start delivery?

Regards,
Violet

email_chain.subject: Re: Availability of C-Flex 1100 Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Violet,

Our C-Flex 1100 vessels have indeed arrived. They can be chartered for your next shipment of cargo from Ningbo to Hai Phong. What is the shipment’s ETA?

I’ll need you to give us more information about the shipment, like:
* The cargo’s name, weight, and volume (in cubic meters)
* Any hazardous materials on board
* Cargo description
* Cargo price
* Lashing for securing the cargo
* More requirements (like reefer containers for cargoes that need a particular temperature for preservation, etc.)

We can make a quotation when we have all the required details.

I’ll be waiting for your reply.

Regards,
Alwin

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for Turpentine
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,
Could you let us know what the earliest possible dates are for shipping 3000MT of turpentine from Durban to Alexandria? We don’t need FOB, but we’d like to fix rates asap.
Best,
Andre

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Turpentine
email_chain.body:
Just want to let you know that both emails (1 & 2) were received at the same time (23:42).
NB: I was sitting in my office in South Africa when the above email arrived. So no email delay, no delay in me seeing the email, no delay in me writing the email.

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Turpentine
email_chain.body:
Hi Andre,
Just to reiterate: I did not write Email 2 - I did not exist at the time Email 2 was written.
Do you want me to believe that? or do you want to apologize and accept that you made a mistake?

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Turpentine
email_chain.body:
You could say, for instance, you wrote email 3 in a hurry, when you were not at your best.
I didn't exist at the time. In terms of your earlier comment, 'No, Daniel. I did not exist then. I could not have written it then.' Just to say that we know that you were the one who wrote the email. There is no dispute about that. It's your name on the email. There is a difference between what you wrote and what you did.
That's fair enough. My other reason for contacting you was to discuss the statement on our website, where it says: 'We don't have access to the rest of the page of letters.'
I just want to let you know, as I can see from your first response here (Response #1)

email_chain.subject: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Mr. Cuenca,

Last call to book space on a free 50-foot container moving from Ningbo to Savannah. I'd like to hear from you by the end of the day!

Regards,
Neeta
Neeta Bhojwani
President
Asia-USA Logistics Inc
Ph: 604-568-1058

email_chain.subject: Re: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Hi Neeta,

We did book the container and it will go in around 2 weeks. We also have one 20ft container going from Shanghai to Laem Chabang around the same time.

Regards,
Paul
Paul Cuenca
JDP Transportation Inc.
Tel: 604-557-3643 x225
Fax: 604-557-3644
Email: pcuenca@jdptransportation.com
Website: http://www.jdptransportation.com

email_chain.subject: RE: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Great - you book a 50-foot container, which is not in our scope! Are you sure we have a 50-foot container deal with you? If we had a 50-foot container deal with you, I would've thought you would've offered us the container first because we are an origin based company. Also, I'm not sure what 'book' means in this context. There are not many 50-foot container companies in Canada and if we had a deal with you, I would be sure about that.

Regards,
Neeta
Neeta Bhojwani
President
Asia-USA Logistics Inc
Ph: 604-568-1058

email_chain.subject: Re: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Hi Neeta,

Yes, we will book it as you wish. We will also book the 20ft container for you, however, we need to move it as an OOG from the main line to the OOCL main line. We need to move it to Keelung for OOCL to pick it up from there. We have booked a 20ft container for your company to move from Shanghai to Kaohsiung. We will need the original BL or amendment for the move from Shanghai to Laem Chabang.

Thank you,
Regards,
Paul
Paul Cuenca
JDP Transportation Inc.
Tel: 604-557-3643

email_chain.subject: FW: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Paul,

I am looking for the agreement first. We don't trust your company. We don't need you to book a 20-footer for us. We were never notified that you offered us a 20-foot deal. We don't need anything else from you unless we have the agreement.

Regards,
Neeta
Neeta Bhojwani
President
Asia-USA Logistics Inc
Ph: 604-568-1058

email_chain.body:
Hello Vincente,

Based on last year's grain harvest, there will be a low supply of wheat this year. I can arrange a wheat shipment in early August from Odessa to Barcelona, and my usual demurrage clause is 300,000 USD.

Look forward to hearing from you soon,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Tom,

Good to hear from you. Right now, I'm expecting the demurrage fee to be higher than usual, and the insurance premium will increase by 5%. I believe we can complete the transaction in early August.

Waiting for your reply.
Eddie

email_chain.subject: Reminder: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Vincente,

This is a reminder that we are expecting your reply about the grain shipment. Will there be a high demand for this in early August?

Look forward to hearing from you soon.
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Tom,

I apologize for the delayed reply. There are some concerns from the banks about the fluctuation of the market and the guarantee. We can sign the contract if we have a win-win result after the completion of the grain transaction.

Vincente

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Vincente,

Thanks for your prompt reply. We have a contingency plan for the banks in case of any problems.

Look forward to working with you soon.
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Vincente,

Is the contract still going to be signed?
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Yes, we will sign the contract. We can complete the transaction in 1 week.
Eddie

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Excellent news!

I'm looking forward to the transaction!
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

Please sign the contract and send the confirmation email to us. If you have any questions,
Vincente

My name is Martin Stewart. I am a teacher of English from the United States of America. I just came back to Canada from a trip to England.

Please remember to bring your student visa when you visit the office. The office is next to a bookstore called Barnes and Noble in our downtown area. I hope that you can stop by and say hi sometime. The office has a really beautiful view of the city and I think you will like it.

Sincerely,
Martin Stewart

email_chain.subject: Vessel Readiness Enquiry
email_chain.body: Please advise vessel readiness for 3,300MT of lubricants from Genoa to Haifa this Friday, if at all possible. Could you let me know as soon as you receive this email? Kind regards, Giulia

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Readiness Enquiry
email_chain.body: Which type of ship? DWT? When ETA? If container ship, do you have details for all Vessel Instructions? If so, please provide in PDF format and attach to your reply. If you have not arranged any space with shipping line yet, then when you do arrange, please send me details so I can confirm our rate. To clarify, does your company have existing VLCC business with any of the major oil majors? If so, please advise rates and fix as necessary, in US Dollars. In any case, please send me a copy of the B/L or OBL as soon as we have completed shipment. The original B/L or OBL to go to our agent at Haifa for delivery to buyer. I look forward to your reply, thanks. Best regards, Fred

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Readiness Enquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Mr. Gomez, Thank you for your email. We don’t know yet which shipping line they will choose. We will tell you as soon as we get the confirmation. Yes we can offer you best rates for V/LCC fixing or spot. Could you please confirm what kind of ships do you normally fix? DWT range, age, agency, and that kind of information. Best regards, Giulia

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of our rates and service for shipment of 3300MT lubricants from Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body: Dear Giulia, In response to your email of 11/28/08, we would like to advise you that we have sufficient, fixed VLCC cargo space for 3,300 MT of lubricants. The loading port is in Genoa and the discharge port is Haifa. We can arrange delivery from the loading port by truck, rail, or barge. The rate for carriage by sea is EUR 14,000 per MT. We have estimated our charges at EUR 20,000 and USD 400. (attached as Exhibit A) Our commission rate is USD 1,000. The term for this shipment is CIF as shown in the attached general terms (Exhibit B). The bill of lading is our own form of bill of lading. Best regards, Fred

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of our rates and service for shipment of 3300MT lubricants from Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body: Dear Giulia, I’m waiting for confirmation from the ship owner about your enquiry. If you have any update, please let me know. I have other space for you next Friday. They want to confirm with you this week. If you would like to book the space in advance, I can fix it for you with another charterer. Let me know if you would like to book in advance, before getting confirmation from the ship owner. Thank you. Best regards, Fred.

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote: Wood Panels Shipment
email_chain.body:
Sven,

We’re looking to ship 5,500MT of wood panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao. Please send your rate ideas along with a preliminary quote and any specific questions.

Sincerely,
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Wood Panels Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Jeremy,

Thanks for your email about our transport of wood panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao. What is the weight of the panels? If they are 1.6 cubic meters (a typical wood pallet size) with a panel thickness of about 2.5cm, that’s approximately 1,000kg/m3 with a density of 1.7. Do you have any other measurements?

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Wood Panels Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Susan,

Yes, all panels are 1.6 cubic meters and 2.5cm thick, so I can use your equation to find the weight (1,000kg/m3 * 1.6 cubic meters = 1,600kg).

How about this deal? How many cubic meters can your truck transport from Bordeaux to Bilbao? How many total trips will the vehicle make? What is the total cost for transport?

Thanks!
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Wood Panels Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Jeremy,

Thanks for your email. Our truck can transport 24 cubic meters at a time from Bordeaux to Bilbao. The total cost would be 10,000 euros. We will also cover all of your customs costs and administrative fees in the EU and at the destination.

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Wood Panels Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Susan,

I am excited to get a deal on our wood panels! I have a few more questions to ask about the transport.

Can we discuss these details in person? Maybe over the phone or via video chat? I'm free now if you are.

Thanks,
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Wood Panels Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Jeremy,

Yes, we can discuss the details in person. If it's more convenient for you, I can meet you at the cargo port in Bordeaux. The coordinates are 44.8370° N, 0.5980° W.

Is that okay with you?

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request for Palm Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Maier,

Hope you’re well. Could you please tell me what the freight idea is for a cargo of palm oil from Calabar to Santa Marta, with a mid-June laycan?

Thanks,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request for Palm Oil
email_chain.body:
Mr. Maier,

Thanks for that. You should read the other section of the email.

Thanks,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request for Palm Oil
email_chain.body:
Mr. Maier,

Thanks for the help, but that is incorrect. We are buying palm oil from Calabar, not Brazil. Please read the email again.

Once again, my valued guest and the popular ‘humorous’ founder of the humor site Fuleminess has raised a very important issue. With the growing influence of multinational business and the Internet, there is a danger of being misunderstood. Particularly when it comes to asking someone a question. With the ever-growing number of emails and phone calls being made globally every second of the day, it is important to ensure your request is heard.

When sending an email with a question, it is also very important to include a sign-off such as 'Best Regards' or 'Kind Regards.' This is because at times a person can read the email very fast and can be assumed that the person sending the email is actually sending them.

Best Regards,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request for Palm Oil
email_chain.body:

Hope you’re well. Could you please tell me what the freight idea is for a cargo of palm oil from Calabar to Santa Marta, with a mid-June laycan?

Gary

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Confirmation for Household Chemicals
email_chain.body:
Dear Betsy,

We’re expecting 6,600MT of household chemicals to leave Antwerp on Friday. If you could advise your final freight rate, we can accept it.

Thank you,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Confirmation for Household Chemicals
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

I can confirm that the rate I quoted you earlier still stands: US$2.00 per ton FOB Antwerp, plus US$10 per package in case the packages are of different dimensions.

Should you require additional details please let me know.

Best wishes,
Betsy

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Confirmation for Household Chemicals
email_chain.body:
Hi Dave,

Here we go again! This is the third request for a quote in one day, and David seems to have given a full quote in his original email. Why do I have to explain this to him every time?

What are some reasons for replying to an email twice? Paragraph 2 (this one) gives specific reasons in the writer’s first email. Your email serves to remind me that David is not as familiar with the company’s rates as I am.

Explain how this form of explanation might serve to establish greater rapport.

Best wishes,
Betsy

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Confirmation for Household Chemicals
email_chain.body:
Hi Dave,

Why don’t you just offer the rate per ton and let David accept it or suggest alternatives?

Do you remember in our training course, we learnt that the purpose of most email communications is not just to reply with ‘yes’ or ‘no’, but to help others make a decision?

David’s just a little reluctant, but he will accept it and agree to it if you can help him to make a decision by making your rate specific enough.

Best wishes,
Betsy

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Confirmation for Household Chemicals
email_chain.body:
Dave,

I wrote you an email in the last section. Please tell me how you replied.

Best wishes,
Betsy

email_chain.subject: Urgent Need for Petroleum Coke Delivery to Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Hello my old friend,

A little birdie tells me you have an urgent need to get 3,000MT of petroleum coke into Cape Town. You don’t have space on the F/A ABLYN which is at Latakia? Are you going to wait for her next stop, after a quick turnaround in Sudan? Or are you desperate?

Yours,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Need for Petroleum Coke Delivery to Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Hi again,

Here is the story. I can make you an offer you can’t refuse. Remember when I mentioned a quick turnaround in Sudan? Well, the job is not for me. It’s for my cousin. He has taken over my business. He is not as nice as me. Don’t worry, I can get your oil to South Africa.

Yours,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Special Deal on Petroleum Coke
email_chain.body:
Salam Aliki,

Remember me? I was one of those sailors you knew in Dubai. I am in Cape Town now. I have a good deal for you.

Three thousand metric tons of petroleum coke, sapphire black, stored in an oil tanker on the Black Sea.

First offer: $500,000
Second offer: $150,000 per metric ton for the whole load.

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Re: Special Deal on Petroleum Coke
email_chain.body:
Salam,

Let me know if you want the deal. The seller is asking for $150,000 per metric ton. The deal will be closed when you sign the contracts. An independent bank will transfer the funds after the transaction.

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Final Call for Petroleum Coke Deal
email_chain.body:
Salam,

The seller is still waiting. I told you not to wait too long to reply to this offer. If you don’t, someone else will. Who knows where this oil will end up?

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Confidential: Important Details on the Deal
email_chain.body:
Salam,

There is something I haven’t told you. This deal is too good to be true. But, I’m desperate. I need to make a lot of money to start a new business. It’s something I can’t refuse. I am not a sailor like you. I will deliver the oil to you. I will arrange all the details. You will only have to make the money. You will have to deposit a sum of money in my bank account. My lawyer will prepare the contracts. He will deliver them to you. I will show you my proof that the oil is real.

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Cargo Loading and Transit Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Mendoza,

We have a cargo of 2,200MT which we are hoping to load to a feeder vessel on the 15th, departing Barcelona on the 17th. The discharge is at Puerto Madryn in Argentina.

Please confirm your earliest loading date and advise on transit times.

Kind regards,
Anne Marie

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Loading and Transit Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne Marie,

The cargo you have quoted will fit comfortably on MV ACATENANGO. This ship will load here in Aviles, Spain on the 13th of March and sail the following day to Madryn, Argentina. On arrival in Madryn, the cargo will discharge in two weeks time, which should be the 26th of March. This will give you approximately two weeks transit time from here in Spain to Madryn.

I will send you the following details by e-mail:

Laycan: 13th March
Prelim D/D
Report of Findings: 12th March
First Week: 15th-22nd March
Second Week: 22nd-29th March
D/D (SPB form)
Expected discharge: 26th March
Invoice: 19th March

Please confirm the delivery to Madryn, ARG.

Kind regards,
Ms. Mendoza

email_chain.subject: Milestones Update
email_chain.body:
Milestones to be completed between 14th March and 20th March:

14.03 MM automatically notifies the principals of the completion of the 'Report of Findings'
18.03 MM automatically notifies the vessel owner of the completion of the preliminary D/D
18.03 Vessel owner should approve the D/D within 24 hours
18.03 Vessel owner is required to download the preliminary D/D and secure the vessel
20.03 The first week of the pre-laycan D/D expires

Kind regards,
Ms. Mendoza

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Multipurpose Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
Dear Sales Team,

I’d like to charter a multipurpose vessel from Fujairah to Dar es Salaam, with an approximate cargo size of 2,000MT. Can you advise on the availability and rates?

Regards,
Yanyan

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Multipurpose Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
Dear Yanyan,

We hope this message finds you well. Following our previous communication, we would like to remind you that we have provided information on the available vessel and some alternatives. However, we have not received your approval for the vessel's Subject and Particulars (S & P). The reason for this is that the vessel owner does not provide the Vessel’s P&I, and therefore, you will need to cover this cost. We can find an alternative vessel for you. Please contact us for further details and your approval.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused. Please note that the charterer may choose between TCE only or TCE+P&I, both of which can be offered to you.

Thank you for your cooperation.

With Best Regards,
Amr El-Garhy
Sales Department
Globmarine Chartering Limited

email_chain.subject: Port Dues and Fees for Cargo to Port Louis, Mauritius
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ferris, 

My name is Samuel. I’m currently the vessel broker of a Chinese bulk carrier currently in Chittagong, Bangladesh. We have 3,800MT of heavy plates to load. The destination is Port Louis, Mauritius. We have been given the following port dues and fees to be deducted from the cargo: 

* General Cargo Port Dues: USD 3,256.00 
* Coast Guard Charges: USD 164.00 
* MFAF (Mauritius Free Airport Fee): USD 112.80 
* Port Corporation: USD 159.84 
* Generator Rental: USD 0.16/Hour * 12 Hours = USD 1.92 
* Empty Tank Cleaning: USD 10.00 * 2 Tanks = USD 20.00 

Could you kindly take this into account when submitting your quote? 

Best regards, 
Samuel

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Dues and Fees for Cargo to Port Louis, Mauritius
email_chain.body:
Dear Samuel, 

Thank you for your email. Unfortunately, it is not appropriate for you to pass charges like this on to the cargo owners without their consent. If you are able to provide evidence that this is the owners’ responsibility (e.g., a bill of lading with a clause allowing the carrier to deduct port dues from the cargo), we might be able to discuss a rate increase to cover these expenses. However, if you are just making up charges to pay your agency, it is unethical, and we will not pay you. 

Thank you, 
Alain Ferris 

PS: We also need a few more details on the cargo (origin, grade, product code), which will enable us to get a more accurate quote for the freight. 

PPS: The more information you are able to provide in your emails, the faster we can give you an answer, and the less likely it is that you will have delays.

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Soybean Meal
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain X,

Could you please provide a freight quote for 30,000MT of soybean meal for September delivery from Chongqing to Dalian?

Regards,
Sulek

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybean Meal
email_chain.body:
Dear Sulek,

Our cargo agent has confirmed the rates for 30,000MT of soybean meal from Chongqing to Dalian as follows:

Blt Chongqing:
- Spot period: 10,000 USD
- September delivery: 9,750 USD
Bunkering for Chongqing: 80 USD
F.O.B Dalian:
- Spot period: 60 USD
- September delivery: 75 USD
Bunkering for Dalian: 30 USD

Our vessel is available for September delivery. As soon as you are ready, please let us know the details for your shipment, and we'll quote you accordingly.

Thanks!
Captain X
Horeb Shipping

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybean Meal
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain X,

Thank you for your prompt reply. We would like to book the cargo as mentioned in your email. The information you need is as follows:

Quantity: 30,000MT (weight)
Type: Soybean meal
Packed in 50kg jumbo bags
Packed in 1,200 bags per 40'HC container
Destination: Shantou
Port of loading: Chongqing

In the end of June this year, my company and a dealer made an agreement for selling and buying the above soybean meal at the agreed price of 1,300 USD per MT. I'm wondering if I can still make the shipment at such price even now it's September.

Thanks in advance.
Sulek

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybean Meal
email_chain.body:
Dear Sulek,

I've checked with our freight representative. I'm afraid the above rate is no longer available. It seems that after your July inquiry, the freight cost has been rising continuously. In September, the rate could be around 12,000 USD/30,000MT. It's quite expensive compared with your original contract of 1,300 USD per MT.

I'm afraid your soybean meal could be sold at a lower price now.

Regards,
Captain X

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybean Meal
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain X,

That's terrible! It seems that we can't make it. At that time we agreed the contract price was only 1,300 USD per MT. If we reduce the price further, we'll definitely lose some money. I don't know how to explain this to the client. I'd better tell him to take some other cargo. I will close this deal with the seller now.

Thanks.
Sulek

Sincerely,
Donald

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Delays in Suez Canal Passage
email_chain.body:
Hi,

I also heard about some vessels taking longer than normal to make passage through locks at the Suez Canal. How does that affect my shipments?

Sincerely,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Update on Suez Canal Situation
email_chain.body:
Dear Donald and Sarah,

1. The Suez Canal plays a crucial role in the global shipping industry, connecting the Mediterranean Sea to the Red Sea. However, recent events have caused concerns among vessel operators and shipping companies about delays and increased congestion at the canal.
2. Since the closure of the canal in March due to the Ever Given ship blocking it, operators have been expressing fears of congestion and delays. Despite the reopening of the canal in mid-April, vessels are still facing delays as the backlog of shipping containers and other cargo continues to accumulate.
3. As of May 2nd, there are 67 vessels waiting to enter the Suez Canal, while an additional 55 are waiting to exit. This has led to...

email_chain.subject: Status of Ever Given and Suez Canal Congestion
email_chain.body: Can you tell me what is the status of the Ever Given ship that got stuck in the Suez Canal in March? Is it still there? Also, I've heard about the backlog of vessels in the canal. Do you know if that might affect my shipment?

email_chain.subject: Re: Status of Ever Given and Suez Canal Congestion
email_chain.body:
Dear Donald,

I hope this message finds you well. I understand that you have some questions regarding the Ever Given ship and the backlog of vessels at the Suez Canal. Let me try to address your concerns.

Firstly, the Ever Given ship was successfully dislodged from the Suez Canal on March 29th, after being stuck for almost a week. However, it remains in the canal until it can be re-fueled and towed to another location for repairs. The process of refueling and repairing the ship is expected to take several weeks.

As for the backlog of vessels in the canal, the congestion has...

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Sulphuric Acid Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good day Ms. Kelly,

I’m inquiring about 3,400MT of sulphuric acid from Aqaba to Khor Fakkan. Could you handle a late-July laycan, and are you open to a short load window?

Best,
Aqaba

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Sulphuric Acid Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Aqaba,

I’m writing you about your question. I can handle a late July load date, but you must understand that it may take us a few weeks to secure the necessary permits. You can help speed things along by hiring a third party to find out who the permits are issued to, and to pay them for their services. Your cargo is a noxious substance that has been denied to others in the past, so this must be done delicately. The load window can be as short as 3-4 days, but we’ll have to include that in the permits, too.

Yours,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Rye Miley (a garbage company) request
email_chain.body: We’re scheduling a 3000MT cargo of garbage from New York to Venice. Can you quote a vessel with laycan after the 16th? Regards, Ashley

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) request
email_chain.body: Ashley, Sorry to hear about your garbage problem! We can accommodate a shipment of 3000MT of garbage, but I'm concerned by your use of a boxship. Sure, it'll transport the garbage, but you're going to have to pay out the wazoo to get one. My advice is to go the less expensive route and use your neighbor's trash cans for the operation. Those are typically made of cheap plastic that is easy to transport by land. I wish you the best of luck! James

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) request
email_chain.body: Ashley, Well I can tell you that the best of the best of the best is definitely on board! We'd be happy to take on your job! We're going to need to know a few things before we can proceed though: What is your trade? How far do you need to go? What are you going to do with all of that garbage in the end? (toxic waste? Trash that will just be dumped into the ocean somewhere?) This is actually the largest cargo ship in the world. But yes, I guess you could consider it a 'boxship.' Oh but don't worry! We'll make sure to go easy on the plastic that way it won't weigh so much and we won't use up too much fuel. James

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) request
email_chain.body: James, Don't worry we're not going to dispose of the garbage into the sea! We'll ship it to Lome! We will make the arrangements for all the paperwork. The ship can have the laycan from 19 May to 23 May. What is the total cost to ship 3000MT to Lome? Thanks, Ashley

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) request
email_chain.body: What? No way are we going to Lome! We are a humanitarian charity and we are only allowed to go to certain ports like Belgium, Austria, and Switzerland! What is Lome?

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) request
email_chain.body: I'm getting confused. Are you in the garbage business or do you want me to help you dispose of some trash? I'm sure you understand that we aren't equipped to deal with anything related to dumping garbage in the ocean, but you sound very interested in that which I can't understand.

Have a great week! My team and I are in Las Vegas this week for the NFPA Convention, but we'll be back on Monday. If you can please send us the routing information for your 5,500MT MGO shipment, we'll arrange for a broker to pick it up and make our arrangements to ship to Pusan.

email_chain.subject: Interesting Projects and News
email_chain.body:
Hey All,

Because I’m out of the office this week, I’m sending you some interesting projects and news to check out while I’m away! Here are a few highlights:

* Click here to learn about the Fertilizer Institute’s new Code of Conduct, which includes nine guiding principles for good behavior, including the encouragement of a culture of safety and compliance with the law. 'Anyone who works with anhydrous ammonia or other fertilizers must read this, and they must share it with their teams,' says Director of Regulatory Affairs Brian Jennings.

* When a group of California manufacturers and distributors went before the California Air Resources Board (CARB) to discuss the 2013 Renewable Fuel Standard (RFS) proposed by the U.S. EPA, they did not leave empty-handed. A bill was introduced in the state legislature that would provide a tax incentive to encourage renewable fuel blending.

Best,
Admin

email_chain.subject: Warehouse Update
email_chain.body:
It’s been busy around the warehouses. We are in the process of getting our Fall products ready. We have had some order cancellations, so we will have a few spots open. We are reevaluating our shipping schedules as we are now shipping later than we did last year. It appears that the weather is not cooperating. We will keep you informed as we get better weather conditions. Some 20-inch rocks have not made it to the Southeastern states due to weather conditions, and we are not sure when we will get them in.

Best,
Warehouse Team

email_chain.subject: Quote for Drywall Finishing Equipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Scott,

My name is Stewart and I’m reaching out from Reznor, one of the main vendors of equipment and services for drywall finishing. We’ve just discovered the worksite of the Sillington project on constructionobserver.com, and since this is right in our backyard, I’d love to get a quote for your finishing needs.

Can you please send me an estimate for your next order of metal lath so we can stay on your radar for next time? Let me know if you have any other questions about our process and we’ll be happy to walk you through it.

Thanks in advance for your time, and I look forward to speaking with you.

Best regards,
Stewart Vanderbloemen
Reznor, LLC.
(410) 455-2060

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote for Drywall Finishing Equipment
email_chain.body:

This email is to let you know the company would like to move on with other bidding processes. As always, thank you for your interest in my business.

Best regards,
Scott Sillington

email_chain.subject: RE: Metal Lath Purchase
email_chain.body:
Hey Todd,

Just to follow up, did you ever receive a quote for your metal lath? I know you said you’d go with another vendor, but I wanted to get this completed for our records.

Thanks!

Stewart

email_chain.subject: RE: Metal Lath Purchase
email_chain.body: It’s been a while since I’ve been on Construction Observer. Do I have to be a subscriber to view pricing for the services? Thanks.

email_chain.subject: RE: Metal Lath Purchase
email_chain.body:
I love that you and everyone else on the website have no idea what it takes to run a successful business. You think it’s as easy as going on Construction Observer and asking for bids. Just how much it costs for a quote and if there is a minimum number of products you have to buy.

I’d say it’s an education. Like how the Navy discovered it would lose too many crewmen if they started a major war without undergoing combat training first, so they decided to create such training so that every year they would lose fewer and fewer crews. Combat training also provided the Navy with the opportunity to evaluate newly created equipment and armaments.

In short, anyone can be an entrepreneur. You don’t need to be the richest.

I inform you that we are a ship agency company in China. We charge a flat rate service to all seafarers in China at the same price per month or per year, regardless of the nationality of the seafarers. Our service fees are $180 per month or per year.

If you are interested in our service, please send us the booking form as follows. Thank you.

Anjum

Bharos,
John Cowie.

email_chain.subject: Storage and Delivery Services
email_chain.body:
Hi Basil,

Could you handle 5,400MT of vegetable oil from Aqaba to Mombasa, with full documentation? And how much is your storage fee?

Regards,
Sina

email_chain.subject: RE: Storage
email_chain.body:
How much is your storage fee?

And who will deliver this quantity to our factory?

So, there was this corporation who asked about our storage and delivery cost. The first question they asked was about storage cost. I made sure to talk about all different prices based on different quantities and then I explained the storage conditions. I never mentioned that in my price I included free delivery to the factory, in my opinion it is better to ask all questions before talking about details. You do not know what questions they can ask.

When I received the email below, I was a bit shocked about the question. However I managed to answer it quickly as follows:

Sina

email_chain.subject: RE: Storage and Delivery Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Sina,

Thank you for your email. We can handle your storage in Mombasa. The price is $1.2/MT per month for a total quantity of 5,400MT. We can deliver the cargo by truck directly to your factory. However, the price depends on the distance.

For example, from Mombasa port to Machakos (70 Km), the price is $40/MT. From Mombasa to Athi River (50 Km), the price is $30/MT.

Regards,
Basil

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Quote
email_chain.body:

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to request a freight quote for a shipment of coal from Newcastle to Shanghai. Please provide the best available rates and any additional details that might be relevant.

Best regards,
Alice Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

Thank you for your email. I am pleased to provide you with a freight quote for the shipment of coal from Newcastle to Shanghai. Please find the details below:

- Vessel: MV Ocean Star
- DWT: 80,000 MT
- LOA: 220m
- Freight Quote: USD 25 per MT
- Laytime: 3 days

Please let me know if you need any further information or if there are any specific requirements for this shipment.

Best regards,
Bob Jones

email_chain.subject: Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Becky,

Please consider these details. We’d like to ship 2,100MT of soya beans. Our requirement is 15,000 bags for 6 months.

Kind regards,
Joanna

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your email. I’ve spoken to my superiors and we are willing to ship to your specified destination if we can get the same price as we are getting for another destination.

Are you happy with the price we discussed? I have a client who is willing to pay more but he can’t cover the cost of freight.

Hope to hear from you soon.

Regards,
Becky

email_chain.subject: Price Matching
email_chain.body:
Hi Jon,

Have you spoken to your sales manager about us? I’d like to know if you can match the price we quoted for another destination.

Kind regards,
Becky

email_chain.subject: Re: Price Matching
email_chain.body:
I have spoken to our sales manager but he is not willing to reduce the price for your shipment. We can sell at our current price but we are not going to reduce it for your shipment.

Please let us know if you are willing to accept the current price we are offering.

email_chain.subject: Acceptance of Current Price
email_chain.body:
We are willing to pay the current price for the shipment. Can you help me with the terms and conditions of the contract?

Thanks,
Jon

email_chain.subject: Re: Acceptance of Current Price
email_chain.body:
We can provide all the terms you need. Please let us know if you need our sample.

Kind regards,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Terms and Conditions Request
email_chain.body:
I am new here. Can I see your terms and conditions for our contract?

Thanks,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Terms and Conditions Request
email_chain.body:
We are happy to share our terms and conditions with you. Can I please get your contact details?

Kind regards,
Matt

email_chain.body:

There's a second product in this shipment, made of paper, that's heavier, about 30 kilos. In total, the shipment is about 2 x 1m long. I'd like to quote for air freight, and

Here is a website where you can see a sample of the product: [link]. It's a plastic that looks like paper, but that's not recycled.

email_chain.subject: Wheat Flour Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Vasquez,

We’d like to load 3,000MT of wheat flour from Mersin to Panamá City, and freight pre-paid on FOB basis. Would you be able to give us your best idea for this shipment?

With kindest regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Flour Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

I can confirm the cargo arrived today from Mersin. Please let me know if you need further details.

Kind regards,
Richard

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Flour Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good morning Richard,

Just a quick question, was it stored under our nominated agent?

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Flour Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

Yes. However, it arrived earlier today at another warehouse in a different part of town. Can I call you now or would you prefer to come in later?

Kind regards,
Richard

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Flour Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Richard,

Are there any risks of the shipment getting stranded at customs?

Kind regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Flour Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

I’m afraid you’re out of luck. It’s very likely that it will be stranded at customs. I’ve forwarded your details to a colleague who will give you an update once the status of the shipment has changed.

Apologies for the inconvenience.

Kind regards,
Richard

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Flour Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Richard,

Great news. Thanks for following up.

Kind regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Availability and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Ms. Ambrose,

We are looking at shipping 50,000MT of grain from Vancouver to Bordeaux. Could you provide us with an empty vessel that will be available in May and your latest demurrage rates?

Regards,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Availability and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Adam,

Empty vessels for departure in May 2023 will be limited. However, we are still expecting some availability, particularly in mid-May. Please advise your preferred vessels and any other vessels you are willing to consider. Some of our available vessels may have several weeks of demurrage, even though we are aware of your usual demurrage rates.

If you have any questions, please contact the Chartering department.

I would also recommend following the Baltic Dry Index (BDI), which is currently at a 9-month high and rising fast.

Thank you,
Ms. Ambrose

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Caustic Soda Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi,

It is good that we know each other. I am Steve and I will be responsible for the shipment from Selangor to Port Dickson.

A couple of days ago we received an inquiry for the shipment from Port Klang to Port Dickson and I want to know if you can still do this shipment.

Please find the details below:
Loading:
	Vessel's name: Da Shan (15,000dwt)
	Port of loading: Selangor
	Cargo: Caustic soda
	Quantity: 8000mt
	Delivery: July 1st, 2009
	Price: USD 2.6 - 2.8/mt fob
	Condition: CIF

If you are able to do this shipment and if you are interested, please respond to me ASAP.

Thank you very much.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Caustic Soda Shipment

It is good to hear from you.

Our vessel can be loaded at Selangor on July 1st for 8000mt of caustic soda.

Please quote your actual fob price for this vessel.

We will gladly accept it if your price is better than our other agent's.

Thank you very much.

Best regards,
Mr. Wu

Steve

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Caustic Soda Shipment

email_chain.body:

Let’s do business.
It’s easy.
Get rich.
Act now or be left behind.

Yours,
[X]

How do you think that would look? (You can change the last line to whatever you want.)

Try it with your email address in place of [X]. Now see what happens…

I look forward to reading your emails…

-[Y]

P.S. Be sure to respond to this message so you don’t miss any further emails like this.

email_chain.subject: Exclusive Offer
email_chain.body:
Mr. Dorsey,

Here’s an idea for you: write something like this…

"If you send money today, you can get a luxurious gift."

Click here to get started…

Be sure to send a message in reply so you don’t miss the next email!

All the best,
[X]

P.S. This is an automatically generated email. Please do not respond directly as you may not receive a response.

email_chain.subject: Exciting Opportunity
email_chain.body:
Dear sir,

I am writing to you about something I think you would be interested in. This email is not spam, and I promise it won’t contain any links to adult websites. In fact, I don’t even know what your interests are!

However, I do know that you’re a high-earner and that you love money. That’s why I’m writing to you about this.

email_chain.subject: Important Message
email_chain.body:
Dear sir,

I just wanted to reach out to you. I have a feeling that I know what you are looking for, and I think you would be interested in what I have to say. What I have to say, in fact, is that your wife is being unfaithful. This is not a trick, nor is it a test. I am not your enemy. I am a trusted friend. So please read on.

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for Ground Nuts
email_chain.body:

Regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Ground Nuts
email_chain.body:
Hi Bobby,

Bonny is fine for loading immediately. However, there is berthing congestion currently at Monrovia. We’ll have to leave by Monday next week for handling. In total, the cost would be as follows:
- R/T cargo handling fee: $480/mt
- Storage and demurrage: $4,500
- Handling for Monrovia: $100/mt

Total: $8,580

If you like, I can prepare the documents and send them to you.

Regards,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Ground Nuts

Thank you for your prompt reply. We’d like you to prepare the documents for our approval.

Regards,
Bobby

We have approved the documents. Could you send us your bank account details so that we can make the payments?

Bobby

email_chain.body:
There are reasons why they could be having difficulty in getting through to their target. This happens frequently when it comes to end-user targets in emerging markets.

I always leave two days in my inbox to send another follow-up email after the first one is sent and then at the end of the day send another one. This seems to work better than the more traditional 3-day/3-email rule.

While we see high open rates, it’s possible that the real target isn’t looking for the product at this time and may not have read the email. You don’t really know for sure unless you get a reply from the target.

email_chain.subject: Maritime Transportation Costs
email_chain.body:
Mr. McDonough,

I think your data show that the cost of maritime transportation has dropped significantly over the past three years, although the bunker prices have climbed.

Could you please compare two particular time periods?

Thanks.

Best Regards,
Heather

email_chain.subject: Re: Maritime Transportation Costs
email_chain.body:
It is not typical. Any crew that is leaving the bridge for more than a few minutes will usually assign a watchkeeper and/or specify exactly where the wheel is. If the owner insists on an automatic pilot watchkeeper, it is up to the captain to comply. But that would not be my recommendation.

If the vessel is in or near a harbor or channel where there are many vessels and navigating is a challenge, why do the ships leave the bridge and let the ship just drift out of control? Would not knowing exactly where the wheel is be a problem? I am talking about not having a person at the helm ready.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Spot Cargo Rates
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McDonough,

I am studying for my Mates Certificate and trying to learn more about maritime business. It seems to me that the 'spot cargo' rates are too low to operate and make money. How do you deal with the low rates?

Thanks!
Brendan

email_chain.body:

OK. Thank you.

Elly

Please accept the following information. This oil is transported from the African port of Matadi to the South American port of San Juan de Marcona. The chartering of the vessel

Elliot

Taiwan Telecom, Co., LTD
GPO Box 154
Longkan City, Taiwan
Email: telecom@mail.com

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Details and Payment Inquiry

Mr. Han

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote: Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
To all Freight Forwarders,

Can you send me a quote for 3,000MT of coal from Jeddah to Kaohsiung for shipment in early July?

Thank you!

Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jason,

Thank you for your email and for the opportunity to quote for this shipment of coal. Our quotation is USD260/MT CIF Kaohsiung.

Can you please confirm that this price is acceptable to you?

Kind regards,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jason,

Unfortunately, my offer is not accepted by my client. My client offers to you an FOB Jeddah price of USD210/MT and the rest USD20/MT will be added as demurrage charge at terminal.

Please let me know if this offer is acceptable to you or if you wish to negotiate further.

Kind regards,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Greg,

Thank you for your email.

It is acceptable for our side to receive the cargo under such conditions.

Thanks for your effort and cooperation, I look forward to receiving the detail.

Kind regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your offer but I’m afraid our client cannot accept the terms at this moment, as there are some issues on the customer side, and they will be receiving other cargo later in the week so it will be impossible to give me clear instructions before Friday.

Please stay in touch, so I will keep in touch with you regarding the final confirmation.

Thank you and take care.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jason,

I’m not available during the weekend but my client has given me a positive response. However, my client can confirm your offer only for 2500MT, not 3000MT.

In that case, my FOB price remains USD210/MT and demurrage charge is USD20/MT. Please confirm this offer by the end of today.

Kind regards,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Career in Computer Engineering
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Guest,

I am writing to you because I am highly interested in computer engineering and designing advanced technology. I would like to know the steps I can take to reach my goal and understand the work and learning opportunities available in this field.

I have taken a number of classes and learned about the core material needed for computer engineering. However, I am unsure about the next steps to take to become successful in this field. I would appreciate more information about your experiences in computer engineering and the steps you took to get to where you are now.

Additionally, I would like to know which classes I should take and which organizations I should join to further my career in computer engineering.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,
Student

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up Questions on Computer Engineering Career
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Guest,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to follow up on my previous email regarding my interest in computer engineering. I have done extensive research on the field, but I am still unsure about the next steps I should take to achieve success.

I would appreciate more information about your experiences in the field and the steps you took to reach your current position. Additionally, I would like to know which classes and organizations would be beneficial for my career.

Thank you for your time and guidance.

Best regards,
Student

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Career in Psychology
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Psych,

My name is Student. I am writing to you with a few questions regarding a career in psychology. I have heard many stories about different paths to success in this field, and I am wondering which one to follow.

I am interested in psychology as a career and have been looking into the steps needed to achieve my goals. I understand that I need to major in psychology and complete the necessary requirements. Additionally, I am aware of other requirements such as internships and additional classes.

I would appreciate knowing your experiences in the field and the steps you took to get to where you are now. Your insights would be invaluable in helping me plan my next steps.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,
Student

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Steel Shipment from Rotterdam to Long Beach
email_chain.body:

I’m looking for a 7,000 MT shipment of steel products from Rotterdam to Long Beach. Could you confirm you have an open vessel, and tell me your standard demurrage rate?

Thanks,
Sue

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Steel Shipment from Rotterdam to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Yes, I found a vessel in Rotterdam, but I can only load 5,000 MT. That is the maximum capacity available. Can I charter this vessel?

Yes, you can confirm the vessel. Our confirmation will be valid for 48 hours. We need to have a week’s notice before loading. Demurrage: US$250 per container, per day, both for loading and discharging. Loading: 30% extra to the standard rate.

Can you send your complete instructions?

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Hi Jason,

We would like to charter this vessel C3 from Rotterdam to Long Beach. We will load 5,000 MT in Rotterdam. The deadline is 30th June. We need 60 days of free time for discharge in Long Beach. If you have any questions, please let me know.

Regards,
John Z.

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Please send your charter party to me. Thank you.

Regards,
John Z.

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
John,

Thanks for the 60 days notice. I've prepared the charter party which will give you 20 days free time for discharge. Could you send us your details of insurance?

Best Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the insurance details. I have made the charter party which gives you the free time you wanted. Please confirm and send a signed copy.

Best Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the charter party. I've signed the charter party and will send it to you. If you have any questions, please let me know.

Regards,
John Z.

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Hi Jason,

I have just sent you my signed charter party via mail. Thanks.

Regards,
John Z.

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Jason,

I have received your charter party. Could you please send it to my email?

Regards,
John Z.

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Thank you. Now the vessel is chartered. I will send you our bank details for payment.

Best Regards,
Jason

Hi Gwen,

Commodity: Maize
Purchase Price: USD 118 per MT (CIF MYR 4,410.00 per MT)
Freight Cost: MYR 1.75 per 1,000 KGS (MYR 17,500.00 per 10,000 MT)
Total: MYR 4,427.50 per MT

Transporting Vessel: MV Ming Sheng Hai (Cruise 0301), 2005 Built, IMO 9301712

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request for Carbon Black Shipment
email_chain.body: We are a trading company based in China, located in Shenzhen and specializing in exporting Carbon Black. We currently have 2 containers of Carbon Black (FCC, N-330) for loading at the TSCA Port in Thailand, from our manufacturer of the same origin. We would like to ask for a freight quote to load our container at the TSCA port in Thailand to a port of our choice in China (Dalian, Tianjin, Qingdao, Shanghai, Wuhan). The final destination of the Carbon Black will be in China. If possible, please include all costs and any other information you feel is relevant in your quote. Sincerely, Li Wei

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Purchase and Shipping of Carbon Black
email_chain.body: We are a trading company based in Hong Kong and specializing in export. We are interested in purchasing 50 metric tons of Carbon Black from Thailand and would like to have it shipped directly to Hong Kong. If you are able to provide me with the following information, I will purchase based on your prices and shipping quote: 1. Price of Carbon Black by metric ton 2. Packing 3. Marking 4. How much does your company charge for the shipping cost to Hong Kong, by volume of order? 5. How much does your company charge for Port Charges in Thailand and Hong Kong, by volume of order? 6. How much does your company charge for International Trade Licenses, Bank Guarantee, Bank Insurance, Warehouse storage, etc? 7. What other miscellaneous costs will be involved? 8. How long will the shipping take? Sincerely, Chen Hong

email_chain.subject: Request for Carbon Black Shipment to Hong Kong
email_chain.body: We are a trading company based in Thailand and exporting Carbon Black to China. We are interested in purchasing 50 metric tons of Carbon Black from Thailand and would like to have it shipped directly to Hong Kong. If you are able to provide me with the following information, I will purchase based on your prices and shipping quote: 1. Price of Carbon Black by metric ton 2. Packing 3. Marking 4. How much does your company charge for International Trade Licenses, Bank Guarantee, Bank Insurance, Warehouse storage, etc? 7. What other miscellaneous costs will be involved? 8. How long will the shipping take? Sincerely, Lee Chang

email_chain.subject: Quote Request for Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good evening Mr. Menéndez,

We’ll need a calculation for 3,000MT of diesel from Rotterdam to the 13 docks at Aarhus. Does the 24/7 service you provide include all seasonal holidays?

Kind regards,
Abbie Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Request for Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Thanks, Abbie,

Here are some details for your request:

Please do your calculations assuming a spread of 5 to 15 days for loading. If you use 10 days, please note that it will make your calculation more conservative.

These are some other terms you need to consider:

- Guaranteed loading window: 5 days (as a rule, we do 10% out of this time if the barge is ready at the quay or 10% per day extra from our client’s terminal if the barge is not ready at the quay).
- Rotation time: 24 hours maximum
- Unloading time: 24 hours maximum
- Total transit time: 48 hours
- All statutory holidays are considered normal workdays for shippers.
- Routing: Oslo-Fredericia-Middelfart-Harsholm-Portland-Jakobsen

Kind regards,
Juan Menéndez

email_chain.subject: Jet Fuel Shipping Price from Kaohsiung to Daesan
email_chain.body:
Dear Eddie,

Our provider M&N has quoted us a price of 16.74 USD/MT to ship jet fuel from Kaohsiung to Daesan via vessel. Do you think this price is acceptable?

Thank you,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Jet Fuel Shipping Price from Kaohsiung to Daesan
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

We need to consider the cost of bunker fuel for the shipowners, which is more expensive than selling bunker, since our agent will pay for all bunker in VETSA trades. Also, please note that our ship will be selling product from Daesan to India before loading jet fuel to Daesan. Therefore, the cost will be 16.74 USD/MT with bunker at VETSA trades.

Hope this helps.

Let me know what you think.

Best regards,
Eddie

email_chain.subject: Re: Jet Fuel Shipping Price from Kaohsiung to Daesan
email_chain.body:
Hi Eddie,

If I understand correctly, you need to estimate at the load port (in this case, Daesan) how much bunker will be consumed until the vessel arrives at the discharge port. However, most of the bunker will be consumed as the vessel travels from the load port to the discharge port. You should pay for the bunker consumed only from the discharge port to the load port. In this case, as we see from the...

email_chain.subject: Calculations for Surface Tanker Jet Fuel Route
email_chain.body:
Dave,

Look at the surface tanker jet fuel route chart on the www and do the calculations. The distance is only 275 miles and if you cut through the shallows then it's maybe only 250 miles. With the shallowest part 43 feet, a 35,000 ton tanker would only use about 16' of water to float. If a tanker could travel through the route, I'm sure that the insurance premiums wouldn't be a major problem.

I could not find any such tanker out there right now so it's not a matter of just connecting the dots. The insurance companies would calculate that if there is a loss, there is no place for the ship to refuel on the route, so the insurance rates might be higher.

Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Hi Xingxiao,

We’re planning to ship a product of 15,000MT from China to US ports in two loads for a total of 30,000MT. I’ve attached the commodity profiles for your reference. Can you please provide the following information?

a. Available delivery dates for each of the two loads, allowing 15 days for ship procurement
b. Vessel sizes and speed
c. Estimated price per metric ton, rate schedule, and bunkering options
d. Estimated transit time from load port to discharge port
e. Maximum permitted soil/soil contamination

Thanks,
Alexander

email_chain.subject: Re: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Xingxiao,

Great news, we are fully booked from load port until 2022 for both 15,000MT loads. We’ve secured the vessel, and we’d like to offer you the low end of the range for the bunkering price.

Could you please provide the revised cost?

Thanks,
Alexander

email_chain.subject: Re: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Hi Alexander,

Unfortunately, this load is booked to August 2022. We can offer the following rate schedule:

$7.4 per metric ton on stevedore fees
+ 4% over base rate from bunkers
+ 3% load/discharge port fees

We can send the commercial invoice in two weeks.

Thank you,
Xingxiao

email_chain.subject: Re: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Xingxiao,

Great! We’ll go with the $7.4 flat rate.

Thanks,
Alexander

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body: Hey David, We have 6,300MT of coal to move from Hoboken to Zeebrugge. Do you have a vessel in the area next week? Sincerely, Kent

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body: Hi Kent, Our vessel has a 27,000MT volume capacity. However, we cannot move the coal at your quoted price.

email_chain.subject: Price Negotiation for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body: Are you willing to move the 6,300MT from Hoboken to Zeebrugge at $10 USD per MT?

email_chain.subject: Re: Price Negotiation for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body: $10 USD per MT is way too low. We normally move coal for $25 USD per MT. $10 USD is below market value.

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Price Agreement
email_chain.body: The customer agrees to pay $25 USD per MT.

email_chain.subject: Alternative Chartering Agent
email_chain.body: Kent, I have found another chartering agent who is willing to move the coal for you. However, they are a bit cheaper. Can you pay the extra $10 USD per MT to make it $15 USD per MT?

email_chain.subject: Re: Alternative Chartering Agent
email_chain.body: Of course, we just want to move the coal to Zeebrugge.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Merger Rumors
email_chain.body:
Rob,

Heard rumors that you are in talks to merge with Brooker Inc. Is this true? We at our company are very interested in acquiring a broker. We have been following your success for a while now, and we find that you can be an excellent part of our organization.

Best regards,
Jorge

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Merger Rumors
email_chain.body:
Rob,

Thanks for responding. This is exciting. Your service and business look good, and I think that I have seen your name in enough magazines that I could feel comfortable with a decision to go with you.

What can you tell me about moving from my existing brokerage firm? Can you send me an application?

Best regards,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Merger Rumors
email_chain.body:
Bob,

I will complete the brokerage agreement tomorrow and will send it to you in the next 3 days. We have not discussed compensation, but I am sure we will be able to find one that works for both parties.

Thanks for the fast reply.

Sent from my iPad

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Merger Rumors
email_chain.body:
Rob,

How much do you know about the local market in my area? We are looking at doing some investments, but we have heard that there is a potential of a huge correction in the near future.

Best regards,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Merger Rumors
email_chain.body:
Jorge,

The amount of my compensation has not been discussed yet. Feel free to talk about it. Can you give me an idea of what kind of fee would be reasonable? I hope that we can work out a mutually acceptable deal.

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Merger Rumors
email_chain.body:
Rob,

Thanks for taking a second look at the numbers. I can also take a second look at them, but I still feel that the numbers are not as good as they should be. I still want you to do the deal, but if you want, I can be a silent partner until things get going, and I can purchase you out later.

I want to see a mutual benefit, not just an increase in the sales. Can you give me some more numbers, so we can do our first evaluation?

Thanks again,
George

email_chain.subject: Freight Advisory Request
email_chain.body:

8,000MT of HFO from Dili to Sekondi, payable against B/L (FIO)
7,500MT of Gasoil from Nosy Be to Tema, payable against B/L (FIO)

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Advisory Request
email_chain.body:
George,

1 x CIF, or if direct berthing at the second port, 2 x CIF
2 x FIO, no guarantee (C/P may be a good way to go?)

Have a good evening.
Larry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Advisory Request
email_chain.body:
George,

Geary Tankers B.V. does not have experience with HFO cargoes, but for comparison and reference, take a look at the following:

Malange - Pointe Noire:
1,500 tons HFO from Malange, Angola to Pointe Noire, Congo: CIF, double nomination in Porto Amboim. Earn $34,000, time charter at $22,000.

If you want to book cargo at Rotterdam, I have several suggestions:
HFO Rotterdam 9/24/2012 - 7,000 tons cargo, USD 33.75/MT, delivery Rotterdam.
1,200 mt HFO, ex-shore Rotterdam, vessel at anchor, USD 34/mt, delivery Rotterdam.
HFO Rotterdam 9/20/2012 - 4,000 mt HFO

Larry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Advisory Request
email_chain.body:
George,

Geary Tankers B.V. only had two oil contract cases in the past, one was for delivery of oil from Curacao to Pointe-a-Pitre in Guadeloupe. The other was for sale of oil from Fort-de-France in Martinique to Pointe-a-Pitre. According to our records, the former was for the sale of 2,000 mt HFO to the M/S Mayflower Bayside owned by Epsilon Tankers Corporation, T/A Mayflower Shipping Ltd. under terms CIF (with additional provisos, and legal issues) for delivery to a named port of discharge (Port Louis in Guadeloupe), with a named buyer (Epsilon Tankers Corporation). This sale, because of legal and other issues, was apparently not delivered by the vessel's Master (who was not named, but who sailed from Rotterdam on 9

Larry

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Terms and Conditions
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Dhiraj,

I will be pleased to send you the terms and conditions on the official letterhead.

I can't imagine a single lawyer who will advise you that you should give another company this kind of access to your organization.

If they were doing something really shady, they would do so over the phone, in-person, or use email that deletes automatically, not just some part of the text, but the entire message thread.

This whole "email asking for one bit of info" is nothing more than a trick and bad practice.

Because you give them everything in the first message, you will never get a response again.

Hello, please write your email ID to be contacted. I will send my quotation.

Thank you for your email. We can be reached on +91891200022 if you have any further questions.

Regards

email_chain.subject: Re: Terms and Conditions
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

There is only one.

Email 5:

Dear Sir, as per the above details, please send the TC and RFQ details so that we can proceed further. Thank you.

Regards,
Dhiraj

email_chain.body:

Susanna

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipping from Virginia to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Dear Susanna,

Our liners operate out of Virginia, Houston, and Long Beach to Istanbul, İzmir, Kütahya, and Antalya. We also have a weekly direct service to İzmir from Savannah. It’s a fast service, taking about 14 days from loading in the US to discharging in Turkey. If you’re interested in shipping from Houston, it’s an 11-day trip to Antalya. All of these routes can be served from one of our 3 weekly services. For a monthly schedule, please visit our website. We don’t accept individual bookings, so you would need to find a freight forwarder or consolidator to place your booking.

Best regards,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Shipping Request from Port Botany to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hello Owen,

Our Australian customer wants to ship some powdered milk from Port Botany in Sydney to Tokyo. The contract says 2,500MT, but they might also require 1,500MT of grain. This order will leave in the first week of July. We need your help.

How much would shipping 4,000MT of both goods together cost, and do you see any risk of port congestion?

Many thanks,
Ivy

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request from Port Botany to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Ivy,

Good morning.

The order for 2,500MT of powdered milk should be easy to manage. Regarding the order for 1,500MT of grain, unfortunately, we do not see any vessel available to fit both cargoes in the same vessel. As we are still in June, there are still some free slots available in July, but as the order size is so big, we have limited choices.

That being said, we can manage to fit 1,000MT of milk powder and 1,500MT of grain in the same vessel with the owner of a 10,000dwt M/V which is due to discharge the previous cargo in July. All details about the vessel are as follows:

M/V T1
Type: General Cargo
Flag: Liberia
Call: MOYO
Deadweight: 8,600MT
Built: 1996

Regards,
Owen

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request from Port Botany to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Regarding the risk of port congestion in Australia, I'm afraid the situation is getting worse and that it may be difficult to find a slot for such a big order. Also, the railway terminals are overloaded as well.

I know the situation seems very bad. I can only offer you the best available. If you are willing to wait till October, I can offer you a better slot with more space. This way, you will be able to fit more products, or reduce the price.

What do you think?

Regards,
Owen

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request from Port Botany to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your help. The information you provided is very useful to us.

We want to ship the 4,000MT cargo in early July. We do not have enough storage capacity, so if we delay the delivery, it may lead to the depreciation of our goods, so I'm afraid we can only choose the original plan.

Also, we will have more orders to deliver in July. Can you please help us?

Waiting for your reply!

Regards,
Ivy

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request from Port Botany to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Ivy,

I understand that you have to deliver the order at the earliest opportunity, and that you can't wait till October. I'll look for a slot in September for you.

Please find attached a quotation for 3,000MT and 4,000MT. We can ship 1,000MT in July and 2,000MT or 3,000MT in August. I can fit 2,000MT on a 6,000dwt M/V which is due to discharge in September and 3,000MT on a 6,500dwt M/V which is due to discharge in September as well.

Do you have a choice of milk powder or grain as the cargo to be shipped in August?

Thank you.

Regards,
Owen

email_chain.subject: Question about Email Response
email_chain.body:
Hi Nastya,

One of my workmates asked me how to answer your email. I am not sure myself. I've answered questions like these before, but they were much easier:

1) Say good night to Mommy!
2) Well, take your time!
3) Of course I'll help you. When and where?
4) That sounds great! I'll bring the umbrella.
5) I know. It is not important.

What is the correct way to answer your email?

There is a pattern for this type of 2-part email that I've observed in some specific contexts:

1. The first part is like a sign-off: "Sincerely, Nastya".
2. The second part is the body of the email.

Here is a blog post on this, which cites a data-driven analysis from a company called Radian6:

https://hbr.org/2013/01/the-secret-language-of-email

If we take that at face value, then one possible answer to your email is:

[EMAIL 8]
Please let me know if you're free or if you want to meet elsewhere.

[EMAIL 9]
I look forward to meeting with you.

Best regards,
[Workmate's Name]

Cape Shipping Ltd.

COAL BUNKER
-----------------------------
-----------------------------
BERTH LOAD CARPET

------------------------------
-------------------------------

email_chain.subject: Port Details for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Jeremy,

Thank you for the detailed information. The Port of Elizabeth is basically a bit “rustic”. Most of the coal is stored at berths which are up the hill or out of the water in a kind of side-loading facility. The coal berths are essentially ash ponds that are filled from barges, loaded from stockpiles, or loaded by rail. In any case, the coal must be transported in some way and the loading will depend on the coal berth. The average loading rate is between 600-800 mt/h, and with no draft restrictions or berthing limitations, we are expected to load at an average rate of 1500 mt/h. We can also do up to 2,000 mt/h if the coal can be delivered to the berth quickly and easily.

Be advised that in March, the water in the port will be very low.

Regards,
Brian

email_chain.subject: Crane Capacity and Service Time
email_chain.body: Dear Ms. Bennett, As a stevedore, you have access to ample cranes and loading equipment, but most shipping companies prefer to hire their own personnel for discharge. For example, we have a reputation for working fast at berthing and cargo operations, ensuring both your berthing rights and a successful shipment. What’s your experience with crane capacity at your ports, and can you give an estimate on service time for ships 2,600 meters and 6,500m³ cargo capacity? Thank you, Edward

email_chain.subject: Length and Capacity
email_chain.body: Dear Ms. Bennett, Thanks for your reply. It looks like neither your terminal nor mine has cranes strong enough to handle such large ships. But we do have a lot of common interests with the island of Grande Comore. For example, we can both benefit from using a reputable port with quality equipment and speedy service, as well as avoiding overloading. The solution is to find a company that can efficiently load the cargo. Most shipping companies prefer to hire their own personnel for discharge because their ships require a high level of attention. The only problem is that many stevedoring companies are not experienced in unloading large ships. And that’s why we need your help. Would you be interested in becoming a member of our team and working with us on this? Best regards, Edward

email_chain.subject: Re: Length and Capacity
email_chain.body: Hi Edward, What about using a multi-purpose dock, such as Port Natal? They have the most advanced docking equipment and their crews are very experienced. They are also one of the fastest ports in the world and have an average unloading time of 15 minutes per ship. Another option is to go for a third-party port. I know a company called 'Aloha Stevedoring' who can handle your requirements. It is one of the best ports in the world, with excellent ships and docks. All the best, Cory Bennett

email_chain.subject: Re: [Port of Bicheno] Third-party option
email_chain.body: Hi Cory, I have been discussing this matter with a friend who lives near our terminal. They have just opened a new terminal that can handle 2,600 meters and 6,500m³ cargo capacity. They are looking to expand, so they are trying to get some quality help. I think they would be interested in doing some work for you. The only problem is that their terminal is in the Philippines. If you would like to speak to them directly, then just let me know. Best regards, Edward

email_chain.subject: Re: [Port of Bicheno] New Terminal in the Philippines
email_chain.body: Hi Edward, I’m in the Philippines. I’m glad to know that you’re looking into options here. I can help you with our loading services. My company can handle all your cargo and provide the best rates and service. We are waiting for your reply. Best regards, Cory Bennett

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about shipping palm kernel oil
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

I am looking to move 5,800 metric tons of palm kernel oil from Port Klang to Male. Can you advise on how the refrigeration is done in the holds?

Cheers,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about shipping palm kernel oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

The refrigeration is done by ventilation - the holds are ventilated by a system that draws air through ice-cold seawater. The air is then used to keep the goods at the right temperature. There is no refrigeration in the holds of our ships. In between, there are rooms for packages of bulk goods.

We could load the palm kernel oil in these rooms. It should fit in one or two such rooms. The loading rate would be 7-8 tons per hour.

The max weight per package is 1,500kg. The container could not handle heavier packages.

To prevent damage of the palm kernel oil during loading, we have made special arrangements for the loading. The shell of the palm kernel oil must be closed after being loaded and we suggest using special sealing material for this purpose. A sample of this material can be sent if you wish.

Should you have any further questions, please let me know.

Best regards,
James Kleine
Managing Director, Kleine Business Consultancy
Maritima Massey Building
41 Massey Road
Sandton
2196
Johannesburg
+27 (11) 684-3387
+27 (83) 322-5294 (mobile)
kleine@net

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about shipping palm kernel oil
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

That sounds good. I can arrange the product to arrive in 20 ft containers. The dimensions are as follows:

The biggest one is 140cm x 75cm x 37cm and the heaviest is 1,270kgs. We need 5 containers.

I can arrange the sealing material, do you have the dimensions of the rooms you have in mind?

Thanks again.
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about shipping palm kernel oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

The rooms are about 8.5m by 2.9m, 2.8m high. That should be sufficient. A container is the best to move it. We have also made arrangements for transporting the palm kernel oil in ISO containers.

If you have difficulties doing so, we could also load the goods at our port in Port Klang, moving the goods in our own trucks from there.

Should you have further questions, please let me know.

Best regards,

However, he requires your assistance in obtaining a full text copy of a specific chapter in the handbook of advanced methods in financial econometrics.
