email_chain.subject: Voyage Request for October 25th to 28th
email_chain.body: We are looking for a voyage from October 25th to 28th for 26,000MT. Best regards, Gavin

email_chain.subject: Voyage Request for October 25th to 28th
email_chain.body: We are looking for a voyage from October 25th to 28th for 26,000MT. Best regards, Gavin

email_chain.subject: Re: Voyage Request for October 25th to 28th
email_chain.body: Dear Madame/Sir, We are looking for a voyage from October 25th to 28th for 26,000MT. To be looking for a voyage means that they need someone to buy their product. One must use the passive for this sentence. We have the object in the sentence - voyage. This can be changed to object of the preposition for - voyage for. This change turns the whole sentence into the passive sentence. The subject will be the preposition. We know this because the preposition for comes before the subject. We can make it a voyage. We are looking for a voyage.

email_chain.subject: Re: Voyage Request for October 25th to 28th
email_chain.body: Who are looking for a voyage? Answer: They are looking for a voyage. Common mistake in student papers: 1. Using the active form for these sentences. We do not use the active form when there is a preposition after the subject. It should be He is looking for a house. We have the active form He is looking, but for comes after it. We change the active form to the passive form, thus creating the passive form. There is looking for a house. 2. Removing the article. The article a is required to make the sentence active. He is looking for a house. If you remove a, you have created a passive sentence. Who is looking?

Mr. Williams has a question about your quote to move his cargo from Latrobe to Los Angeles via transshipment to Houston and Long Beach. 

Can you please confirm the following information is accurate?
Amount: 9,700MT
Delivery Date: March 25
Bill of Lading No.: 0556591
Cargo Type: base oils
Price per MT: $38.67
Shipping Time: 38 days
Total Cost: $377,801.66

Also, can you provide us with details of your freight forwarders’ experience in the US market?

If there are any other questions you’d like to ask, please call (617) 555-1234 or email melinda@jones.com.

Thank you,
Melissa

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Quote for Cargo Movement
email_chain.body:
Dear Melissa, 

Thank you for your recent email regarding our quote. 

I have checked with our customer service department and all of the information is correct. Please find attached the following documents that you requested:
* Freight Forwarders’ Experience with US Market in 2015-2016
* List of Clients We Have Had in the US
* A Sample Contract for Shipping Oil

If you have any questions regarding the attached documents, please contact me directly. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Jerry

email_chain.subject: Order Update: Delay in Vessel Loading
email_chain.body:
Greetings,

For the order referenced above, we were unable to get your vessel loaded on time due to unexpected delays at the pier. Once we do get your vessel loaded, we will send you an update. Please let us know if you have any questions.

Thank you,
Jason Moore

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Update: Delay in Vessel Loading
email_chain.body:
Greetings,

At the pier, your vessel was discharged on time. However, we just got an update that we were unable to load your vessel as quickly as we had anticipated. We will send you an update once we get your vessel loaded.

Thank you,
Jason Moore

email_chain.subject: Steel Shipment from Bremerhaven to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Plass,

We plan to ship 8,000MT of steel products from Bremerhaven to Xiamen. Could you please confirm your bunker strategy, and do you anticipate any additional bunker surcharge?

Best regards,
Ana

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Bremerhaven to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email. I think we have corresponded regarding this shipment on two prior occasions and I am wondering what new information you have which needs to be verified. It is important to advise us as soon as possible of any changes, but we do not need this information repeated for every single email. Please do not take this as anything more than a reminder to help us to keep our emails as efficient as possible.

Regards,
Angie

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Bremerhaven to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email. I have checked the files you shared and I think it is important for you to realize that it is vital that your email be addressed to me personally. In this way I can verify what was said to who and how we agreed to proceed. Our supply chain works extremely hard to ensure that we do not make mistakes when communicating with our suppliers. It is important that you communicate with me and we have plenty of time to revise and respond. Please do not send incomplete information with vague suggestions as to who it is meant for and ask us to complete it in the future.

Regards,
Angie

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Bremerhaven to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email. Please reply to me personally with the same courtesy and professionalism. This information is incorrect. I hope that it does not reflect on the company for which you work. You do not answer our emails in a professional way. Your email is too vague. You need to include additional information and there are many things that you have omitted. Please do not think that we will make assumptions for you. You have included only one forwarder. We would be happy to discuss all details of your inquiry in a more personal way with you. We are excited about working with you, but you need to make the first step.

Regards,
Angie

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Bremerhaven to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Angie,

I deeply apologize for any misunderstanding and have attached the revised version of my message. Please feel free to contact me for further clarification.

Yours sincerely,
Zhang

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Bremerhaven to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Zhang,

Thank you for your email. I received your files. I hope you understand that we require more information from you. Your files do not contain important information for our operation. We want to provide you with our best service. We will respond once we have more information.

Regards,
Angie

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Bremerhaven to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Angie,

We are very grateful for your email and want to apologize for any misunderstandings. We have corrected our email and we look forward to working with you.

Yours sincerely,
Zhang

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Shipment from Bremerhaven to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Angie,

We are very grateful for your email. Unfortunately, we do not know what you mean. We are a young company.

Yours sincerely,
Zhang

email_chain.subject: Shipment Quote Request for Cereals
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Jenks,

Could you transport a 4,500MT shipment of cereals from New Orleans to Istanbul by 30 May? Please provide a quote based on our target $80 per mt freight rate. Also, could you advise if your operation has insurance?

Regards,
Dan

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Quote Request for Cereals
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Jenks,

Thank you for your enquiry. A reply will be sent to you this evening.

Best regards,
Annette

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Quote Request for Cereals
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Jenks,

We understand that you require shipping a 4,500MT shipment of cereals from New Orleans to Istanbul by 30 May. Please accept our quotation for this service at $115 per mt FOB New Orleans.

This includes our $35 per mt fuel surcharge and a $10 per mt surcharge for loading at New Orleans. Also please note that your shipment will require the following insurance cover:
    - General Average
    - Warranties
    - Freight Risk
    - War Risks

You should confirm with your insurers that the vessels you will use have the appropriate cover.

We will happily provide you with the relevant documentation for your shipment and look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Annette

email_chain.body: A quick update, Becky Short is our associate from Ag-West. We have known the company for several years. I have attached a letter of reference that Ag-West sent me. The company is located at 3165 Mariana Street, Regina, SK, Canada S4S 5H1, phone: 306-352-1901, fax: 306-347-5260. Let me know if you have any further questions. Regards, Darryl

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Quotation Request for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sheila, I've sent you a message about the Russian coal, but this one I want to make sure that it has been read by you. It is very urgent matter. I have heard from a local company that they have some cargo to ship from Novorossiysk to Beihai. It is 40,000MT of iron ore. They are interested in knowing more about the freight rates and I suggested to ask you for the rates. The ETA of the cargo is the last week of August. Please provide me with a quotation and the details of the parties involved in the contract. Thanks a lot for your consideration in this matter. Kind regards, Darryl

email_chain.subject: Re: Russian coal
email_chain.body: Dear Darryl, We will be able to offer the following service: ODS WAVE WESTBOUND WITH RAIL CARRIAGE Port of loading: Vladivostok Port of discharge: Ulsan Delivery period: 27-Aug-07 Cargoes: Coal Quantity: 15,000 MT SAILING DATE: Port of discharge: KUMISHI 22/08/07 M/V: TRAMP SHIP VESSELS Arrives at: 09/08/07 ETA: 14/08/07 PMT/TMM: USD 10.50/MT 100% B/L preparation fee: USD 500.00 Port charges: USD 1750.00 Handling cost: USD

email_chain.subject: Charter Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

I was wondering if your charter is open for 1,500MT of fertilizer from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur.

Best regards,
Bryan

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Charter Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

I'm sorry but I do not think my email went through. I have a buyer for your cargoes and the prices they offered are too good to pass up. Please let me know if your charter is still open for the 1,500MT of fertilizer going from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur.

Best regards,
Bryan

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Charter Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Bryan,

The charter is not open yet, so I think the email went through. However, I would still like to find out more about the buyer so that we can determine if he's legit. Could you please tell me more about him?

Best regards,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Status
email_chain.body:
Hi Bryan,

Well, yes, I'm sorry I won't be considering your offer. That doesn't mean you can't have the charter though. I just need to check a few things out first. I think you mentioned something about the buyer.

Best regards,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Charter
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

Is everything ok? I can't seem to get ahold of you. Would you mind calling me so we can clear this up?

Best regards,
Bryan

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Charter Status
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

How did everything turn out? I haven't heard from you in a few days and I'm getting worried that there's a problem.

Best regards,
Bryan

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Cargo Space and Berth Dues
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

My colleague and I have just arranged the transportation of the owners of 3 steel vessels from Guangzhou to Ulsan. Can you confirm the cargo space availability and whether the berth dues have already been paid?

Cheers,

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Cargo Volume and Vessel Rating
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Carter,

I am confused about the sea cargo volume of my vessel. The agreement stated 3,000 tons of Liquefied Petroleum Gas, with a total of 5,000 tons of oil. However, I'm looking at the cargo space of the GDDT-101 vessel, which is rated for 7,800 tons. How come you've shipped so much cargo? The remaining space should have been filled with some rice, but I see none in the photos you sent.

Please weigh the hull and contact me right away. Do you have any idea what your vessel will be rated? Do you want to remove some of the oil? Your vessel is large; the last time I was in an all-oil ship was in 2003.

Best regards,
Camille

email_chain.subject: Fertiliser Shipment from Charleston to San Francisco
email_chain.body:

We have 5,000MT of fertiliser to be shipped from Charleston to San Francisco. Could you please let me know if you have a vessel available in the next week and what your standard demurrage rate is?

Kind regards,
Peter Johnson

email_chain.subject: Re: Fertiliser Shipment from Charleston to San Francisco
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

I am pleased to confirm that we have a vessel available for the time you requested to ship 5,000MT of fertiliser. Our current standard demurrage rate is $200 per day for no more than 7 days, or $5,000 per month. Is this acceptable?

Kind regards,
Jessica Davis

email_chain.subject: Methanol Transportation Inquiry
email_chain.body:

Suraj

email_chain.subject: Shortest Demurrage Inquiry
email_chain.body:

What was the shortest demurrage encountered by your vessel between 20 January - 3 February 2018?

Best regards,
Suraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Transportation Inquiry and Demurrage Details
email_chain.body:
Hello Suraj,

There is no documented 'lowest demurrage'. However, we had a may tanker transport 3,700 MT of methanol from Mumbai on 20 January 2018. The vessel sailed from Sharjah on 23 January 2018 at 7:30 hours and encountered approximately 5 hours of demurrage in Dubai: http://goo.gl/maps/PgmWT

Demurrage will be minimal and all as per the Master Services Agreement.

Best regards,
Mr. Yamaguchi

email_chain.subject: Accounts Receivable
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jones,

The reason for this email is to clarify a credit note that I have raised for you for 1234567 (STG 456.78).

The credit note is for one of your jobs to Red Star Logistics in January 2013. As you will see from my attached email, you did not pay the correct amount at the time, although you have now completed payment.

The reason that I have raised the credit note is that I was unable to obtain full payment of the correct amount from your company at the time. The customer service representatives for your company at the time have not been able to offer a full explanation as to why this was so.

In my personal view, a credit note would have been acceptable at the time, but our

Best regards,
Chris

Many thanks,
Mark

The rest can be filled at the time of delivery.

Best Regards,
Rami

email_chain.subject: Interesting Research on Post-9/11 Censorship
email_chain.body:
I didn't change this, or delete anything, and I'm sure you didn't either. This stuff is interesting for people researching email about 1 month before Halloween in 2013. Read more at:

https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2013/11/post-9-11-censorship-post-9-11-censorship-and-right-know

See our other archives here:

https://www.eff.org/overview

Reposted from:

https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2013/11/post-9-11-censorship-post-9-11-censorship-and-right-know

**COPP.COM**

The main site for this document is the National COPP.COM Defense Fund

http://copp.com

If you have an interest in law enforcement or the technical side of investigations, please take a look.

email_chain.subject: Re: Interesting Research on Post-9/11 Censorship
email_chain.body: When I was at the front lines of the Web, we got to see this first hand from reporters who talked to people like us about the issues.

email_chain.subject: Updated Cargo Manifest Request for Container No. 07123
email_chain.body:
Good Morning,

Please send an updated cargo manifest for our container No. 07123. It has a cargo description for 'Coal', but we need to know exactly what kind.

Yours Sincerely,
Yve Morgan

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated Cargo Manifest Request for Container No. 07123
email_chain.body: Your request was received and I have updated the cargo manifest as you requested. I am forwarding a copy of it, along with our proposal for the 100 car shipment of coal, to both our export contacts in Quesling, and to your destination contacts in Pyongyang. Please check it over and let me know if you have any questions or concerns. The original e-mail to follow as an attachment.

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated Cargo Manifest Request for Container No. 07123
email_chain.body:
It appears that there is an error in your cargo manifest. Please take a moment to re-check it before we deliver the cargo. The cargo manifest indicates that you are to receive an unknown quantity of coal, but the container number has been deleted from the manifest. I will need that number before we can begin to move this cargo. Please let me know the container number as soon as possible.

Yours Sincerely,
Marc Churchill

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated Cargo Manifest Request for Container No. 07123
email_chain.body: Thank you for your concern. The item in question is a drug, not coal. The description was a mistake, I apologize. It will take some time to rectify, as the program is not flexible. We are working on it. I have noticed that the cargo manifest lists a number of containers and cargoes. Would it be too much trouble to have your engineering team create a list of the contents of each container?

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated Cargo Manifest Request for Container No. 07123
email_chain.body:
The container number is not a mistake. It has been deleted from the manifest. Do you understand this?

No, I do not understand. Why has it been deleted?

I thought I said that I would not use a loaded container to transport coal, because it would not be able to fit everything that was needed to be transported. So I asked for a container with nothing in it, to be used for coal. The cargo manifest is a copy of the order. I do not need a container number, just the description of what is in the cargo.

The cargo manifest lists cargoes that are not in the containers you have sent. You must supply the correct containers.

How can you ask for cargoes if they have already been sent? I will check the numbers, but the cargo manifest has not been updated since you received it.

The cargo manifest has been updated. Please

Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Offer: 18,000MT Crude from Cyprus to Piraeus
email_chain.body:
Hi again, Bob!

How about letting us know about the conditions? I’m interested in the cargo you’re offering, especially if it arrives in Piraeus in about 20 days.

Kind regards,
Bob Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Offer: 18,000MT Crude from Cyprus to Piraeus
email_chain.body:
Dear Bob,

The offer from Greece is the following:

Delivery: in 20 days after loading (it is sea delivery).
Payment: the price we are asking for is 220 dollars for each tonne.
I have to inform you that my boss says that this price is final, so there can be no haggling on this point.

I have to ask you what you think about this offer.

With best regards,
Thomas Jacobs

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Offer: 18,000MT Crude from Cyprus to Piraeus
email_chain.body:
Dear Thomas,

I can tell you that this offer is not acceptable to us. We will think of another offer.

We have a shipment of 11,000MT of diesel. We have some ships available and are wondering if they would be suitable for our project. Are you interested in discussing this in more detail?

Thanks,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Re: Discussion on Shipment of Diesel
email_chain.body:
Hi Patrick,

We are open to discussing the possibility of working with your ship as long as it meets our specifications. You should include the ship name, owner's name, ship classification society, etc., so we can verify this information and move forward with further negotiations.

Kind regards,
Mohamed

email_chain.subject: Re: Discussion on Shipment of Diesel
email_chain.body:
Hi Mohamed,

Attached is a brief summary of the ship's details. Do you have time for a quick call to discuss further?

Thanks,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Re: Discussion on Shipment of Diesel
email_chain.body:
Hi Patrick,

That sounds great. We can schedule a call on the following day at 4:30 PM GMT.

Kind regards,
Mohamed

email_chain.subject: Re: Discussion on Shipment of Diesel
email_chain.body:
Hi Mohamed,

We are unavailable at that time. Could we reschedule for 7:00 PM GMT instead?

Regards,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Request for Timecharter Options
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lopez,

Can you please provide the latest details for your available timecharter options for 3,500MT from San Juan to Guayaquil?

Regards,
Kadir

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Timecharter Options
email_chain.body:
Hi Kadir,

Thanks for your email. The details for our timecharter option are as follows:

- 5000mt open hatch up to 7,000mts
- 1 month spot charter
- 15 days delivery between 23rd and 30th of October, latest
- Cargo: bulk or container
- Charter party: BIMCO
- Redelivery: 1 month period, 28th November – 28th December

Please find our latest availabilities below:

Oct: 23, 24, 25, 26, 28, 29, 30
Nov: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13, 14

Regards,
John Lopez

email_chain.subject: Shipment Arrival and Cost Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Barnhill,

We are delighted to inform you that your shipment of sugar from San Francisco has been unloaded and is ready for pick-up at our warehouse in Cologne. We have calculated that the actual cost was $46,000 less than we expected.

Kind regards,
Xavier Cortez

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Arrival and Cost Update
email_chain.body:
Xavier,

Many thanks for the receipt of our shipment. It is much appreciated.

Lilla

Lilla Barnhill

email_chain.subject: Shipment Loading Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Xavier,

I am pleased to inform you that the shipment that arrived last week is ready to be loaded on a boat in Germany. Please confirm that the process will begin in the next 24 hours.

Lilla

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Loading Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Lilla,

Yes, that is what we were planning on doing. Xavier is supposed to call me today to give me an update. He seems to be on top of it, so I have faith it will go according to plan. Also, I’m getting ready to receive another shipment, but from Alabama. Thanks again.

Lilla Barnhill

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Loading Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Xavier,

You are on top of things, sir.

email_chain.subject: Far East Loading Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Far East Loading Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Far East Loading Inquiry

Hi,

email_chain.subject: Re: Far East Loading Inquiry

Our next Far East import is on Monday. Is it for you?

We will not take any Far East imports for 6 weeks due to the closure. We are preparing for the Eid break next week.

Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Far East Loading Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Far East Loading Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Far East Loading Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Far East Loading Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Far East Loading Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Far East Loading Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Demurrage Rate for Sugar Shipment from Durban to Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hutchinson,

We’re looking at sugar from Durban to Jakarta. Could you confirm your demurrage rate?

Warm regards,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Alternative Seller for Jakarta
email_chain.body:
For another seller we're considering for Jakarta, they have a bigger bag size (see attached). The quality looks the same though. Is this all right for the end customer?

All the best,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Further Questions
email_chain.body:
Thanks for confirming the demurrage rate.

Some further questions for you:

Are you planning to deliver to ports in South Sumatra as well? What would the cost be for trucks into Palembang?

And do you know who is currently running the factory on the Kertosono Estate? If it's restarted, would it have a competitive price?

Thanks,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Demurrage Rates for Indonesian Ports
email_chain.body:
We have a few large transactions on the agenda for Indonesia and need to find out the demurrage rates for the ports we are considering for delivery. They are:

* Pelabuhan Umum Tanjung Priok
* Pelabuhan International
* Batamindo Batu Besi Port (near Batam Airport)
* Pelabuhan Internasional Tanjung Priok, Teluk Gadung, Bekasi

For these ports, please could you confirm the following information for each:

* Current monthly demurrage rate per twenty foot container
* Average waiting time at each port (how long is the waiting queue? If there are waiting lists, do we need to be on it to secure our port slot?)
* Trucks into Palembang or Jambi - distance / cost

Thank you,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Rates for Indonesian Ports
email_chain.body:
Thanks so much for your fast response. That's very helpful.

Holly

email_chain.subject: Bitumen Enquiry from Durban Buyer
email_chain.body:
Hi Alya,

I just had a bitumen enquiry from a buyer in Durban. They are looking to buy 12,000MT for delivery in Q4. Could you please quote me on the best freight and advise the ETA?

Thanks,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry from Durban Buyer
email_chain.body:
Dear Giselle,

Hope all is well. Could you please clarify your product requirements with us? We shall be able to provide you with the quotation only then.

Thank you,
Alya

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry from Durban Buyer
email_chain.body:
Hi Alya,

The buyer wants 12,000MT of bitumen and CIF Durban Q4 2022. We are currently unable to make a firm commitment at this stage as we do not have product on hand. We would be able to provide you with a firm offer once we know which product the buyer will take. I'll email our product manager and have him provide you with the quotation. I will email you once I have this.

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry from Durban Buyer
email_chain.body:
That would be most helpful. Thank you Giselle,
Alya

email_chain.subject: Quote for Bitumen
email_chain.body:
Dear Alya,

Please find attached our quote for 12,000MT of bitumen. Kindly review and revert to me.

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Quote and Contract
email_chain.body:
Dear Alya,

Thank you for the quote and contract. I would like to kindly request that you review and confirm whether this is what the customer requires for his end client.

I can confirm that this has been passed onto our client for his feedback. If we receive confirmation and are able to complete a firm offer within 2 working days, we will do our best to make sure that you are informed before the end of the day.

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Quote and Contract
email_chain.body:
Please review and revert to me on the term of payment.
Alya

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Quote and Contract
email_chain.body:
We have the above in both CIF and CFR terms. Please review and revert to me. We will not be able to process your offer until we receive feedback from the customer. We look forward to your response.

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Quote and Contract
email_chain.body:
The client wants the terms in the quote as well as the bank details. We will revert on the product and confirmation once we get feedback. We look forward to your response.
Alya

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Quotation Details
email_chain.body:
Could you please confirm that your product manager will provide the quotation with the below details:

20,000MT bitumen for CIF delivery to Durban
Transportation by clean tanker
Insurance on board
Seller has marine cargo insurance that covers up to and including Durban
Letter of credit that has been negotiated in the amount of USD, (FOB amount) in addition to the CIF amount plus 5% for the buyers commission, and is valid from 1 January

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel to Move Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hello Juan,

We're moving 6,000 tons of sulfuric acid from Rotterdam to Venice in mid-December. Do you have a vessel available and will you charge for in-port fees?

Best regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel to Move Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

We have nothing in Rotterdam at the moment and don't expect anything before the end of the month.

Kind regards,
Kees

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Vessel Request
email_chain.body:
Juan,

Did you get my email? I asked you about a vessel for sulfuric acid.

Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Vessel Request
email_chain.body:
Hello Alex,

Yes, I received your email and have shown it to our chartering department. They will be in touch.

Kind regards,
Juan

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel to Move Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Alex,

Yes, we have a vessel which will be free by the end of the month. She is 5,000 tons capacity. We will charge for in-port fees of course.

Kind regards,
Kees

2) Milled Raw
3) Milled Parboiled

Need to buy rice in FCO bags. Mostly I buy from Cambodia and Laos, now need to know prices from Vietnam to Iran for Indian 1121, 1121 fragrant and white rice of other brands. Need from 5,000 to 20,000 MT per month.

email_chain.body:
Subject: FW: [SURABAYA] to LAO: 18,000 MT of Milled Rice

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote: Steel Plates Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

We are looking for a space for 500MT of steel plates from Ulsan to Pusan on the 30th of August. If you have an open slot, please send me a quote.

Many thanks,
Irina

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Steel Plates Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Irina,

Thank you for your prompt response.
As mentioned in my email, the 500MT of steel plates from Ulsan to Pusan would be ready for shipment on the 30th of August. Can you please confirm the following details of your company:
* Your name and telephone number
* I'm interested in receiving a quote, could you please quote for 500MT of steel plates on the 30th of August?
* How often do you sail from Ulsan to Pusan?
* Do you have an open slot?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon,
Marcus

email_chain.subject: How's business?
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Thompson,

Please advise how your business has been going so far in 2020. I know it has been a tough year for many, and would like to know how it has affected your export to Japan.

Many thanks in advance,
William Wilson

email_chain.subject: Re: How's business?
email_chain.body:
Good day again Mr. Smith,

It was good to have heard from you again.
It has been difficult, and I have a lot of inventory left from last year that I was not able to ship. However, I have already secured a few orders for 2021.

Many thanks,
William Wilson

email_chain.subject: Question about email attachments
email_chain.body:
Good day sir,

I have a question for you. Do you often send emails with attachments?

Kind regards,
William Wilson

email_chain.subject: Purchase Inquiry: English-Portuguese Dictionary
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Please, I want to purchase some of your English-Portuguese dictionary. I've tried going through your website, but I can't find it there. Can you please tell me where to go?

I would appreciate if you could send me the link to the webpage where I can find this dictionary.

Sincerely,
William Wilson

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Purchase Order
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Semeta,

This letter is to confirm that I have received your purchase order dated March 12, 2013, for the goods listed in your purchase order. I am writing this letter in order to confirm receipt of your purchase order and in compliance with the Nairobi City County Supply Chain Policy 2013.

The terms of the purchase order are agreed upon by all parties and any subsequent request for changes will have to be confirmed in writing by all parties in accordance with the Nairobi City County Supply Chain Policy 2013.

The delivery address and contact details of the purchaser can be found in the purchase order.

The Purchaser is to make all payments in accordance with the Nairobi City County Finance Policy 2013.

Please confirm this acknowledgement.

Best regards,
Mr. Gari

email_chain.subject: RE: PURCHASE ORDER
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Namuhani,

Please find the confirmation of the purchase order as per the email from Mr. Gari.

Best regards,
Mr. Semeta

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Purchase Order
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Gari and Ms. Kagot,

Please be advised that Ms. Namuhani has been informed of the purchase order confirmation.

Best regards,
Mr. Semeta

email_chain.subject: Urea Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Keshav,

Can you handle the shipment of 2,800MT of urea from New Orleans to Porto Alegre? Is the voyage guaranteed?

Best regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Shipping 3000MT Urea from Houston to South Brazil
email_chain.body:
Hi Anthony,

I have a cargo of 3000MT of urea in tanks that needs to be moved from Houston to a final destination in South Brazil. The clients are going through restructuring and will need a reliable shipping company to help with the shipping of the products.

I would appreciate it if you could send me an FOB quote including the freight and all logistic costs involved. All these services can be consolidated into the quote if needed.

Would appreciate if you could let me know your next departure for Brazil.

Best regards,
Patrick Arnold

email_chain.subject: Update
email_chain.body: Update on the current situation.

email_chain.subject: Tanker Required for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi, my name is Paul and I’m looking for a tanker for 18,000MT of crude oil from Miami to Tokyo. Would you be able to assist in finding a suitable vessel with an ETD within 2 weeks? Regards, Paul

email_chain.subject: Charter Rates for Palm Kernel Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hello, Could you give me a range of Charter Rates for a UBC Tanker, Deadweight up to 50,000DWT, for a Cargo of Palm Kernel Oil from Rotterdam to Houston with ETA within 4 weeks. Best Regards, Chris

email_chain.subject: Vessel Drying Requirements
email_chain.body: Dear Chartering Team, My company wishes to dry a vessel 25,000 DWT with the following specifications: Max. Cargo = 27,000 Mtons, Feeder Draft 15 meters, Flashpoint 32 C, CLEO 4” lines with 180” NPSH, 5” lines with 160” NPSH. An S.R.L. of 1.3 is desired, so please advise if your vessel has a Ballast Water Sulphur Limit of 1.8%. If the charter rate is acceptable, we look forward to your response. Best Regards, Bob

email_chain.subject: Help Needed with Orthopedic Shoes Durability
email_chain.body:
I’m looking for some help, and I was hoping you could point me in the right direction.

I work for a company that produces orthopedic shoes, and we’ve been getting a lot of complaints about our shoes falling apart. It seems to happen whenever a patient uses our shoes to do a heavy activity, like basketball or soccer.

Our shoes are made with the same materials as the other brands that are out there, so I don’t understand why our shoes would be falling apart faster. I’m wondering if there’s something wrong with our manufacturing process, or if there’s some other reason that our shoes would be breaking more easily.

Can you help me out?

Many thanks,
Jim

email_chain.subject: Cost and Departure Date for Timber Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Tom,
How much does it cost to transport 20,000MT of timber from Skopje to Suez, and what is your earliest possible departure date?
Thanks,
Farouk

email_chain.subject: Re: Cost and Departure Date for Timber Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Farouk,
Thank you for your query. The cost to transport the timber from Skopje to Suez is approximately €3,040, with an estimated arrival date of April 5th. Please note that these figures are based on market conditions and are subject to change. We appreciate your interest in our services, and we look forward to hearing from you.
Sincerely,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Cost and Departure Date for Timber Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,
I'm delighted to hear about the shipping costs and estimated arrival date. Could you please send me a detailed contract that outlines the terms of the shipment? Also, I'm interested in knowing the name of the ship that will be used, its ETA, and any necessary paperwork. Is there a specific port in Suez that the shipment will arrive at?
Thank you,
Farouk

email_chain.subject: Re: Cost and Departure Date for Timber Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Farouk,
Thank you for your interest in our services. Attached is a detailed contract that outlines the terms of the shipment. The name of the ship is "Star of India," and its ETA is expected to be April 3rd. The shipment will arrive at the Port of Suez. Please find attached the necessary paperwork for clearance.
We appreciate your interest in our services and look forward to hearing from you.
Sincerely,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Sugar Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
How about 6,800MT of sugar from Montevideo to Ijmuiden?

Best regards,
Alaric

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
The seller has given me details of 6,800MT of sugar. Unfortunately, however, they also sent me three pictures of the product. I’m sorry, but these pictures are awful! They’re 60 years old and look like they were taken with a pinhole camera. My boss is very particular and won’t let me buy anything without quality photos, and I think he’s right. Could you ask the seller for a new set of photos that make the sugar look really good?

Here are some photos for inspiration:

Thanks! Keep me posted.

email_chain.subject: Chloroform Swap
email_chain.body:
Hi Dominic,

Are you carrying 5,000 MT of solvents from Lagos to Jebel Ali, and would you be able to carry 7,500 MT instead? We’ve got a short availability gap and would like to start on Wednesday this week.

Thanks,
Amber

email_chain.subject: Re: Chloroform Swap
email_chain.body:
Hi Amber,

I can arrange for 7,500 MT on Wednesday, but we will send the shipment to Salalah first.

Regards,
Dominic

email_chain.subject: Re: Chloroform Swap
email_chain.body:
Hey Dominic,

What price for the 7,500 MT load from Lagos to Salalah on Wednesday?

Amber

email_chain.subject: Re: Chloroform Swap
email_chain.body:
Hey Dominic,

BLS are asking US$34,000 for 5,000 MT to take away from here, and $30,000 for 7,500 MT from Jebel Ali. I have other customers who want 3,750 MT for the West Coast US, and 1,250 MT for Hong Kong, to fill in the rest of the space on the M/T Baltic Summit and M/T Intrepid.

Would $29,000/MT FOB be acceptable?

Thanks,
Amber

email_chain.subject: Re: Chloroform Swap
email_chain.body:
Hi Amber,

I can take the full load at $32,500/MT FOB Singapore, and we are ready to deliver.

Regards,
Dominic

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Cargo Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
Hi Stella,

We are looking to charter a 2,500MT cargo vessel for 45 days. Please send us your availabilities, all-in costs, terms and conditions.

Thanks,
Enzo

email_chain.subject: Vessel Survey Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Dear Stella,

I have arranged for the vessel in question, ORIFLAMM, to make a call at Bimini next week so that you may arrange a survey of the vessel.

Her current schedule is as follows:
Week 1: Load cargo in Houston, load fuel in New Orleans, voyage to Cuxhaven.
Week 2: Load cargo in Cuxhaven, voyage to Halifax, load more cargo in Halifax, voyage to Boston, offload cargo in Boston.
She will then proceed to Bimini where the survey may be arranged.

I'll be in contact with you soon to arrange the survey.

Sincerely,
Enzo

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Survey Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Dear Enzo,

Just a quick note to say thanks for the logistics of arranging the survey in Bimini. We have a flight to Bimini on Thursday and will be staying at the Grand Isle Bimini Bay Resort. We'll be ready to meet the vessel at the survey dock on Friday.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: ORIFLAMM Survey Report
email_chain.body:
Dear Enzo,

As promised, I have prepared a comprehensive analysis of the ORIFLAMM survey data, along with a list of repairs, ratings, and observations. You may review this document and advise us whether we should proceed to purchase the vessel or not.

There are a few issues with the vessel that are a cause for concern, however it should be possible to address these issues without significantly compromising vessel integrity.

The main concerns are a cracked main engine bearing housing and the state of some of the steering equipment. I will recommend that the buyer have these issues looked at by a professional marine surveyor at the earliest convenience.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Drybulk Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Adam,

We are looking for a drybulk vessel on the US Gulf to Marmara, and I was wondering if you could advise on your next open laycan?

Best regards,
Jhovany

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Drybulk Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Jhovany,

I would like to let you know that I have a general cargo vessel for sale. The vessel is 2014 built, 8,639 DWT, 8,412 GT, 5,690 NT. Built by United Engineering Corp., Korea. Her cargo gear is 2 x fixed 120T at 19m reach. Her total cargo capacity is 12,750 m3. For more details, please find the ship's main particulars below:

LOA: 138.00 m
Date of Build: 05/2014
BW: 12,013 m3
Total Fittings: 12,750 m3
SWL of gear: 120 t, 20 m
LPP: 130.00 m

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Drybulk Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Adam,

I am inquiring regarding my vessel's next laycan, that is what is her planned availability in August?

Regards,
Jhovany

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Drybulk Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Jhovany,

I have the vessel not available in August. It is my pleasure to inform you that I have the vessel available from mid-August onwards. Please let me know if you need more information.

Kind Regards,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Meru,

Do you have a suitable vessel for 5,000MT of DAP fertilizer from Karachi to Jeddah next week?

email_chain.subject: Commission Business Opportunity
email_chain.body:
Hey Paul,

I got an offer from someone who wants us to run a commission business between Pakistan and Jeddah. According to him, this person in Pakistan can source any commodities directly from factories and ship them to the Middle East. My question is, how safe is it for us to run a commission business since we don't know this person from Pakistan?

You are more experienced than I am in this area. I guess as long as we sign an agreement with the seller, we are covered. Can you advise me on that, please?

Additionally, can you put me in touch with him so I can get to know him better? He mentioned they can ship fresh fruits, vegetables, meat, and dairy products.

Thank you,
Fardos

email_chain.subject: Re: Commission Business Opportunity
email_chain.body:
Hi Fardos,

The person working with Mohammed is very professional. They can put you in touch with the contact from Pakistan so you can come to terms with them and see if it's worth it.

Basically, they are looking to bring fresh produce from Pakistan to Jeddah and pay the charges to us. They need it at a particular time of the year when Pakistan can supply the crops that are in season. The peak months would be April to September or so. As you are in the meat business, you may be able to get them deals and bring them in cheaply. The market is big there. I will contact you through Facebook as it will be better and you can find them in my friends list.

Do you have a suitable vessel for 5,000MT of DAP fertilizer from Karachi to Jeddah next week?

Best regards,
Paul

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Recent News About Mr. Abraham
email_chain.body:
Dear Friends,

First of all, I would like to thank everyone who has expressed their concern with the recent news that appeared in the press on 6th July regarding Mr. Abraham. The news does not correspond to the reality and we have informed Mr. Abraham's lawyer about the necessary steps that should be taken to correct it.

The court in New York has issued an interim order prohibiting the publisher from writing any further articles about Mr. Abraham in any newspapers, magazines, or any other form of publication.

Finally, I wish to thank you all again and to wish you all the best for your holiday.

Yours faithfully,
Mr. Edmund Taylor

email_chain.subject: Misrepresentation in Article About Mr. Maurice Abraham
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

A recent article in the Irish Examiner by Mr. Eoghan Rice misrepresents the facts about the case of Mr. Maurice Abraham, who has been serving time in a U.S. federal prison for the last 5 years.

On the 6th July, an article appeared in the Irish Examiner, which was written by Mr. Eoghan Rice and had the title, 'Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release.' The article claims that a person going by the name 'H' and the name 'O'Toole' wrote to 'The Irish Independent' two weeks before the murder of Stephen Trew in 1998, which were the last two letters received from Mr. Abraham.

The writer of this article further stated that 'It is believed that the Prison Authorities removed Abraham's ability to write when it was discovered that he was planning on writing an article regarding tax fraud.'

email_chain.subject: Incorrect Information in Mr. Eoghan Rice's Article
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I would like to point out that some of the information that was published in the Irish Examiner by Mr. Eoghan Rice regarding the case of Mr. Abraham has not been fully investigated and is incorrect and misleading.

On the 6th July, an article appeared in the Irish Examiner, which was written by Mr. Eoghan Rice and had the title, 'Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release.' The article claims that a person going by the name 'H' and the name 'O'Toole' wrote to 'The Irish Independent' two weeks before the murder of Stephen Trew in 1998, which were the last two letters received from Mr. Abraham.

The writer of this article further stated that 'It is believed that the Prison Authorities removed Abraham's ability to write when it was discovered that he was planning on writing an article regarding tax fraud.'

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:

We have a cargo requirement of ____________MT of ________________ from _________________ to ________________. Could you please provide your best freight estimate for this shipment?

Will you charge any additional fees if we miss the narrow laycan?

Kind regards,
____________________________

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Hello _____________,

Unfortunately, we cannot honor your request as we were not provided with the necessary documents when the cargo arrived.

With this information, we would like to inform you that:
- We are releasing the container (will provide you with the B/L number and copy of the B/L) in 5 business days.
- After this period, the cargo will be re-shipped and it will be handled as a new cargo.
- The new ETA will be on October ____, 2023.
- We will send a re-booking agent to inspect and release the cargo.
- Since there is no ETA for your carrier to pick up the cargo, we request your carrier to wait in station until the latest expected date for cargo arrival.
- If your carrier does not want to wait for the cargo arrival, we can arrange for storage for the cargo until the cargo arrival.

Kind regards,
Broker

email_chain.subject: Charter Request for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. García,

Our customer is interested in chartering a medium-sized vessel to ship 6,000MT of rice from Manila to Lagos. Could you provide a sample contract with your typical terms and conditions?

Thank you,
Hector

email_chain.subject: Assistance Needed for Ship Brokerage Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. García,

Congratulations on your success and new position at Voyaca.com. I came across your profile on LinkedIn and found you very qualified to assist me in a very urgent matter.

A few years ago, I employed a ship broker by the name of Brian Hopkin from Thomas Hopkin & Co to help charter a vessel to ship my company's produce from Panama to the West Coast of the USA. Unfortunately, a few days into the voyage, the vessel ran aground and was a total loss. Not only did Brian misrepresent his ship owner to be a reputable one, he went ahead and used me to sign up an insurance contract for his own personal benefit, under the influence of alcohol. He connived with the insurance company to release his profit after the ship sank but my company is still waiting for its share of the payout.

Best regards,
Cieran

email_chain.subject: Request for Reliable Ship Broker
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. García,

At the time, I wasn't aware that he had so much experience in ship brokerage. I learned his dishonesty at the expense of my company. He had forged documents showing a photograph of the vessel to the owners before shipping and didn't tell me about his limited experience as an underwriter. Now I am having trouble recovering the costs of the cargo.

Can you help me find a reliable ship broker to ship a product from Greece to Rotterdam? Can you advise on the best route, avoid legal and insurance mishaps, and ensure my company is protected against mishaps and liabilities?

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards,
Cieran

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request for Rice Shipment & Assistance Needed for Ship Brokerage Services
email_chain.body:
Hello Hector and Cieran,

Thank you for your enquiry.

Please find a draft of our Charter Party Terms & Conditions attached.

I would also like to suggest that Cieran contact a Ship Insurance expert to help navigate the complexities of your situation.

Best regards,
Carlos García

Dear Capt. Hu,

Zoe

Hu Gang

Barter or similar type of shipping would be another way to get product, essentially trading something for the shipping, typically a product that the shipper wants.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Berth Congestion for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Peter,

We have a cargo to ship from Mundra to Long Beach. I do not anticipate any berth congestion in either port, but would you still please confirm that?

Many thanks,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Berth Congestion for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Hope you are well.

As far as Mundra is concerned, there will be no berth congestion (whether it be monthly or weekly) in any month of this year. Regarding the port of Long Beach, the container volume is consistently increasing month on month. It will also increase in the coming month. However, we can see that in February 2019, there were 8 ETDs, whereas in January 2019 there were 7 ETDs. The transshipment movement from West Africa & other major US destinations to Long Beach will increase by more than 10% this year. Hence we may see less berth congestion in the months of January, February & March 2019. However, the probability of berth congestion in April and onward months is very high as long as the CBP do not relax any of their existing regulations to reduce the dwell time.

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Berth Congestion for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Here is a comparison between January to December 2018 and January to December 2017.

To view this email on the web, go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=605746.

8 I D        ARRIVAL TYPE         VOLUME (LCL/FCL/EMPTY) JAN 2017   JAN 2018   DIF
TLG327      OFFD ANCHOR         LCL           185         445     140
TLG062      OFFD ANCHOR         LCL           112         235     123
TLG188      OFFD ANCHOR         LCL           100         165     65
CMACTI      OFFD ANCHOR         LCL           151         165     14
TML 45      OFFD ANCHOR         L

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Berth Congestion for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Kindly note the following changes in view of the proposed cut off:

- All STS, which were used in the past to eliminate congestion, will cease by end of March 2019.
- Due to many more factors like larger volume, berth congestion & diversification, the terminal now prefers containers which are loaded onto wagons, trucks, rail heads, special containers (Transponders, Chilled, Refrigerated, etc.) as well as containers which are to be exported via Ocean Terminal, Pier 400, Long Beach Container Terminal (LBCT), ...
- Longer term (year on year), the terminal hopes that it will be able to achieve more in terms of more Gate out/container return, which is the only way the terminal will be able to handle more volume.

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Enquiry for Rice Shipment from Colombo to Matadi
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Morris,

We have an enquiry for 13,000MT of rice from Colombo to Matadi. Can you give us a berth congestion forecast and explain how your laytime allowance works in case of port delays?

Many thanks,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Rice Shipment from Colombo to Matadi
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

Matadi is a very busy port with cargoes often backed up at berth. There is no guaranteed transit time to discharge ships. It is typical for ships to be waiting in line from 2-4 days to get to berth, and there is not a predictable number of ships in line to discharge as ships can come at any time without warning.

It is typical to run back up and sometimes 2 berths simultaneously. When two berths are available, the berthing order is typically handled by the Terminal based on when the ship can reach the berth. In the event that your vessel can reach the berth on the day that is scheduled for your vessel, your berth time will likely be honored. If you are late due to port congestion and cannot reach the berth that is reserved for you, your berth may be given to another ship and you will have to wait in line for the next.

Best regards,
Emma Morris

email_chain.subject: Memorable Trip to France
email_chain.body:
Dear Mydear, 

It was a pleasure meeting you last month. I hope you are keeping well. Just a short note to say how much I enjoyed the recent trip to France. It was one of the most memorable holidays I have ever had. The accommodation was beautiful, the food was wonderful and we had a great time at the restaurant on the first night. I am sorry to say that we did not get to see as much as we wanted as we had to return early on the last day. However, I would definitely go again. 

As you know, we have been discussing this for a long time. I know you are a bit of a Francophile, so I hope you will be interested in the following. I have enclosed a few photos of the holiday. We have a friend in the tourism industry, so we got a discount on some of the expenses. 

Mydear was a

email_chain.subject: Shipment of Base Oil to Yemen
email_chain.body:

We have 7.4kMT of base oil ready in Malta for shipment to Yemen. How long would it take to prepare the necessary documents, and can you accept delivery within 48 hours?

Yours sincerely,
Mabena

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Base Oil to Yemen
email_chain.body:
Hi Mabena,

Thank you for your email.

Unfortunately, the Yemen Embassy in Malta does not accept any application. For a visa application, you must go through the company you are working for or a company that will sponsor your trip.

Yours sincerely,
Yasmina

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Base Oil to Yemen
email_chain.body:
Hi Yasmina,

Thanks for the info about the company. However, there are only two people in Malta, and they are both married. If I am not working for the company, but the company can sponsor my Yemen visa, who should I contact? Do you know any sponsor company that I can contact?

Yours sincerely,
Mabena

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Base Oil to Yemen
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the info. I’ll go there today and will also go to the embassy to make some enquiries.

Regards,
Mabena

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Base Oil to Yemen
email_chain.body:
Hi Yasmina,

I was in Malta yesterday. I went to the embassy, and the people there were kind. They informed me that I don’t need any sponsor, but to get a visa it costs 118 USD.

Hope this information helps you.

Yours sincerely,
Mabena

email_chain.subject: Adhesives in Bunker C Containers
email_chain.body:
This is in relation to the offer I recently gave to your company, the tonnage is 4,000 MT. Our vessel is a 180,000 DWT class iron ore carrier and we are expected to make a round voyage from Casablanca to Le Havre. Therefore, the vessel will be empty when it arrives in Casablanca. However, the draft requirement is not really important as we are not going to sail before it is loaded. I am happy to quote you FIO/50% DP. In case you need something else, please do not hesitate to get in touch.

Best regards,
G.S.

email_chain.subject: Adhesives in Bunker C Containers
email_chain.body:
Dear Shipping Agents,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to confirm receipt of your offer regarding the 4,000 MT of adhesives in Bunker C containers. We appreciate the details provided about the vessel and the round voyage from Casablanca to Le Havre. The information about the vessel being empty upon arrival in Casablanca and the draft requirements is noted.

Your quote of FIO/50% DP is acceptable to us. We will review the offer internally and get back to you shortly with any further requirements or confirmations.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Best regards,
Shipping Agent.

Your advice?

Thanks,
Clark

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Oil Shipment from Singapore to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Good day Anthony,

Below are some preliminary information for your consideration.

We are in need of a shipment of Fuel Oil (0.5% Sulphur) with 180-day Bunker credit at Hamburg. Time charter please for the above.

Let me have a TEU count please, we may be able to fix a further vessel for containers to follow.

We would also need the following documentation sent by DHL express on the morning the vessel is due to berth:

a) Invoices for cargo

b) B/L’s (Blanket basis)

c) Inspection Certificate

d) Agency Copy of manifest

e) Charter Party

Let me know what you suggest.

I can be contacted as follows:
Email: address@hidden
Or direct by Tel No: +852 2869 2131 (Direct).

Thanks,
Anne

Let me know your detailed charterparty conditions and details. For the charterparty conditions, I propose the usual terms and conditions.

Your vessel must be compliant to the MARPOL 73/78 with equipment for the separation of oily waste and to dispose of waste at sea, alternatively, a system capable of containing, recovering, and subsequently processing the oily residue on board.

Vessel must be certified as per MARPOL 73/78.

Your vessel shall be seaworthy.

William

email_chain.subject: Loading Window and Laycan for #2 Fuel Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

What is the loading window for 40,000MT of #2 fuel oil from Haldia to Singapore? Also, please advise on the laycan.

Regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Window and Laycan for #2 Fuel Oil
email_chain.body:
The answer from someone on the ship side will be most welcomed (current laycan for oil 40k Haldia-Sing). In the meantime, and not to put any undue pressure on the person, but I need an answer by 20:00 Hong Kong time on the 12th. No pressure, I just need an answer by then.

This is especially important because the vessel concerned has to clear their port of 90,000 tonnes of cargo at the same time as loading the product in question.

As such, it is best to keep the loading plan as close to the current laycan as possible for reasons of space and availability.

That's why I would be keen to get your laycan in a day or so.

Thank you again for your assistance.

Regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Window and Laycan for #2 Fuel Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Mike,

The laycan for the product is as follows: Loading window is 12th Aug/14th Aug; ETA Singapore 15th Aug/16th Aug.

Regards,
Don

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Window and Laycan for #2 Fuel Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

The laycan for the oil was to be between 12-16 Aug. The opening/closing date of the laycan as well as the ETA for Singapore are critical, therefore it's best that you let me know the exact ETA for Singapore.

The cargoes to be loaded are cargo 1 & 2. The vessel has to load both oil cargoes at Haldia at the same time.

Thank you in advance.

Regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Window and Laycan for #2 Fuel Oil
email_chain.body:
Thanks again for your assistance.

I hope this will put the vessel on its way to its destination.

Best regards,
Mike

We have shipped 3,000MT of barium nitrate from Marseilles to Dalian at 4,000 euros per tonne, including all duties. Price must be paid on collection. CQAS will send all bills for cargo on a monthly basis.

CQAS

email_chain.body:

All my paperwork is completed. Could you email me copies of the original and the 2 copies of the bills of lading? Also, could you send me 2 copies of the invoice and my original bill of lading?

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote and Terms
email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

Kind regards,
Stephen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote and Terms
email_chain.body:

Here is the original bill of lading as you requested.

Kind regards,
CQAS

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote and Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear CQAS,

Sorry, I got that wrong, it's just a copy I need. I'll send you a copy of the original later.

Kind regards,
Stephen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote and Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear Stephen,

Here is the copy of the original. Could you also confirm when the cargo was delivered? I'm having a little trouble keeping track of that.

Kind regards,
Stephen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote and Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear CQAS,

I need to confirm that the cargo was delivered safely. Are you going to send me a statement of receipt?

Kind regards,
Stephen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote and Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear Stephen,

No, we don't send a statement of receipt to anyone. But you could always call us and get our cargo tracking record.

Kind regards,
CQAS

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote and Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear CQAS,

Could you also send me the consignor's signature on the bill of lading?

email_chain.subject: Shipment Documentation Request
email_chain.body:
Ms. Sylvia,

If you accept this offer, please let me know so I can send you our shipment’s documents.

<Cover Letter, Page 2 of 3>

A. Verifying the Product
1. Using the Web
Find the product name: vanadium pentoxide
Using Google, find the definition:
http://www.thefreedictionary.com/vanadium+pentoxide

The definition is:

'Vanadium(V) oxide is the inorganic compound with the formula V2O5. It is used industrially as a catalyst for sulfuric acid production and as a catalyst in the exhaust systems of motor vehicles. It is a brown/yellow solid, although when freshly precipitated from aqueous solution, its colour is deep orange. The molecular and crystal structure of V2O5 has been intensively studied by many techniques. The structure of the bulk is well understood.'

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry about Vanadium Pentoxide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jean-Christophe Constantinou,

Thank you for the inquiry about vanadium pentoxide. As requested by your customer, we could offer you Fos Sur Mer for loading late-July. The port of loading is Secunda, South Africa. We can load 3,500MT in bulk, packed in 25kg bags. We will then be able to provide the following documents: the Proforma Invoice, the Commercial Invoice, the Bill of Lading, and the Packing List. The payment will be done by the term L/C at sight.

We are a successful chemical wholesaler, representing many companies, from producers, traders, and brokers. We specialize in chemicals, pharmaceuticals, minerals, fertilizer, additives, and intermediates, such as Vanadium Pentoxide. We also provide trade support.

email_chain.body:
Hi Xylo,

This is the third quote we received for this job. Your rate is close to the lowest we received. Can you please make the offer valid for 3 days from the date you received this email?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best,
Elena

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation
email_chain.body:
Hello Elena,

The offer is valid only for 3 days. The offer is based on the condition that the cargo is not rejected at final inspection. All the relevant documents (Bill of Lading and other documents) will be sent by email on the day of shipment. We accept no liability for errors in email transmissions and reserve the right to withhold payment in respect of cargo received in less than perfect condition.

Elena, as we discussed, we are going to charge you the full amount in advance. Please transfer $65,000.00 to our account.

Best,
Xylo

P.S. I have made some changes to the contract terms. I will send you the updated file for signing.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation
email_chain.body:
Dear Xylo,

Xylo, please share your legal terms as we have not seen them. Can we agree on a payment of $20,000.00 in advance?

Best,
Elena

email_chain.subject: Request for HFO Delivery from Panama Canal to Port Qasim
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Habib,

Would you please help arrange for a 100,000MT parcel of HFO to be delivered from the Panama Canal to Port Qasim? What is your LFG rate and expected transit time?

Regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Update on HFO Shipment from Panama Canal to Port Qasim
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Habib,

The vessel Sun Dragon that we have arranged the charter for to deliver the parcel of oil that you requested has taken on the cargo at the Panama Canal. It is currently waiting for a berth at Port Qasim. Unfortunately, its ship-to-ship transfer hoses were damaged in a recent collision and the ship's owner does not wish to risk using a new or used set of hoses that might fail again. Instead, they have ordered a new set of hoses which will take a couple of weeks to deliver and install.

Please let me know if there is any alternative means that we can use to load the cargo and I'll try to make the necessary arrangements to comply with your request.

Regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of HFO Discharge at Port Qasim
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Habib,

This morning we received confirmation that the shipment can be discharged as scheduled into our own terminal.

Regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Freight Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Smith,

Our office is arranging a 2,400MT freight of fresh fruit from South Africa to Antwerp, departing next week. Please confirm your earliest dates, and if you have a standard demurrage rate.

Thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

As you are probably aware, we regularly ship fresh produce out of South Africa to Antwerp. The two ships currently loading are scheduled for departure next week. Should the vessel of your choice not be available, we will be delighted to offer another ship. We attach a charter summary for your information, and confirm our standard rates in accordance with your enquiry.

We look forward to hearing from you in due course.

Yours sincerely,
Juan Du Preez
Umschlagskontor

Mit freundlichen Grüssen, Juanna

P.S. We appreciate that your position may be difficult as your vessel will have to load quickly. Our office has a well-equipped lab for testing and we can mobilise one of our freight inspectors to check the condition of the cargo. He can carry out quality checks with our certified biological agency.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

We confirm receipt of your enquiry regarding a new vessel for your cargo loading on 1st December. As you know, we are currently full. However, as the voyage is only 21 days, we are confident that our southbound vessel will return home quickly and be available for an early charter. If you wish to discuss the matter further, please contact Mr. Du Preez or myself.

Yours sincerely,
Nicol Kohn
Schiffahrtkontor

Note to examiner: Please note that in real life, the Master would have called the brokers to check the schedule and check rates for other vessels on standby. The case would be different if he was under the threat of a late delivery.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

We regret that the vessel 'Daanen de Jong' was detained by the USCG in New York. In view of the heavy congestion at Antwerp, we advise you to offer an earlier departure to the market. Unfortunately, our southbound vessel 'Baedeker' has been chartered by our German branch for a new deep sea voyage and is now on its way to the USA.

The vessel 'Winkelhuis' has just been loaded and will depart on 5th December. Our dispatch department is aware of the urgency of the matter and is currently checking availability for a temporary substitute. We attach a chart for your information and please let me know when we can expect your intentions.

Regards,
Nicol Kohn

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Adhesives Shipment

Best regards,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Options and Rate for Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Andy,

If I take Ethanol (44 kg/cu m and 22 cts per lt) 250 MTs cargo; What would be the total cost of freight if I take the cargo out of Moin-Honduras, and the shipping time will be 5 days.

Can you please give me the figures before today midnight?

I will wait for your email.
Thank you,

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Options and Rate for Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
I assume this is for shipping to Montevideo, Uruguay?
[Short answer] Considering the cost of Ethanol at USD 700.00/t, loading at Moin and routing via Mediterranean and Atlantic Ocean, then the FOB Hamburg is USD 420.00/t with a port rotation in Moin, Santos, and Constanza.

[Long answer] We have to send a complete quotation to understand the entire situation and its respective commercial requirements in order to provide a complete and accurate quotation to our client.
Our company can offer competitive shipping costs and services for transporting Ethanol to Montevideo, Uruguay. We are happy to provide more information and a detailed quote upon request.

Based on your information, I can provide you with an estimate for the shipping cost of 250 MT of Ethanol from Moin, Honduras to Montevideo, Uruguay.
Please note that the shipping cost may vary.
