email_chain.subject: Information Needed Before Meeting
email_chain.body:
Hi Samantha,

What information do you need from a client before starting your meeting? I found that sample email A and B are very formal. I would like to make email C more casual, just like an informal call, while still maintaining professionalism. Any tips for my next email C?

Thanks!!

+1 (870) 432-1609

email_chain.subject: Re: Information Needed Before Meeting
email_chain.body:
Hi Regina,

If I am able to answer your questions and address your concerns about working with me, I'd love to have a brief phone conversation on Monday at 12:00 pm. If this doesn’t work for you, just let me know and I'd be happy to find another time that works for both of us. You can reach me at <phone number>.

What do you think about this? Let me know!

Is this enough to cover it? If not, just let me know which topics you'd like to cover before we meet.

Sent from my iPhone

email_chain.subject: Follow Up on Our Conversation
email_chain.body:
Hello <client name>,

We spoke yesterday, and I wanted to follow up on our conversation and make sure you have everything you need to book your upcoming shoot with me.

I am available on the following dates:
Wed, December 16: 12:30 - 4:30 pm
Thurs, December 17: 8:30 am - 12:30 pm
Friday, December 18: 12:30 - 4:30 pm
Wed, December 23: 8:30 am - 12:30 pm

Please let me know which time(s) work for you and your crew.

To book your shoot, we'll need:
1. A confirmed booking time for your crew and for the photographer
2. Any special equipment your crew will need
3. A list of any foods or props that need to be provided
4. A signed contract

Best regards,
Regina

email_chain.subject: Follow Up on Our Phone Call
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon!

I'm emailing to follow up on our phone call yesterday, and to see if I can help you in any way. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Regarding our phone call:
On Wednesday, <month>, we spoke about your interest in <blank> services. You mentioned that you'd like to learn more about our services, and I'd love to help. Are you free for a short phone conversation?

Is Monday, November 2, 2020 at 12:00 pm a good time for you? If not, just let me know and I'd be happy to find another time that works for both of us. You can reach me at <phone number>.

What do you think about this? Let me know!

Is this enough to cover it? If not, just let me know which topics you'd like to cover before we meet.

Best regards,
Samantha

email_chain.body:

Ethan

email_chain.subject: Task Instructions for Email Enquiries
email_chain.body:
In this task, you will respond to two emailed enquiries. You will need to complete the following tasks in this lesson:

• Write two responses to email enquiries (one to each of the email scenarios in the lesson)
• Use more than one email scenario to practice using English email language
• Ensure that your emails have all the basic elements of an effective business email
• Understand what makes an email more effective than another
• Use email correctly for different situations
• Ensure that your emails are grammatically accurate
• Use the emails as a springboard to practice more English.

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation on L/C Value and Order Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Patrick,

Please see our response below.

Thanks,
Alan & Adam
On Behalf of Debtor Adviser
Email: alan@debtoradviser.com
Skype: alan-superuser

A: Can you confirm the L/C value of the order? We have two different values in our records. If you confirm the value, it will be easier for us to verify the total amount.

B: No worries, I confirm that the L/C value of the order is $500. On behalf of the debtor, please help us to complete the sales. Let us know when the sales is completed and when the L/C is received.

Best regards,
Patrick
Fintech Consulting Group Inc.

email_chain.subject: Charter Request for Petroleum Coke Transport
email_chain.body:
Hello X,

We want to charter a vessel to transport 2000 MT of petroleum coke from Baku to Qingdao, China. Do you have any ship available in November?

Regards,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request for Petroleum Coke Transport
email_chain.body:
Hello Bob,

Best price on spot by sea transport:
- 0.19 $/MT
- 0.05 $/MT bunker

Details:
1. Charter party done on GLS
2. Cargo: Petroleum coke - 20,000 MT
3. B/L paid - 100%
4. Sailing in November
5. From Baku, Azerbaijan to Qingdao, China

Best Regards,
X

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request for Petroleum Coke Transport
email_chain.body:
The main trick is to make this task look like it is for open charter. This makes the victim pay attention to the price, believing it is actually lower than the price of the chartered ship (by the way, let's make it 0.19 $/MT). By saying that you will pay 0.05 $/MT for bunker, the victim thinks you are buying bunker, while you are actually renting the vessel.

Also note that the shipping cost (0.19 $/MT) is given to the nearest part of the fourth decimal place, which might look suspicious if the sender and receiver have different countries. It is a very good trick to make such mistakes, as I did in email 2, or even in email 1 if the victim is inexperienced. It makes the victim think he is comparing two similar offers, which they are not, and look bad for not noticing it.

Best Regards,
Bob

Loyalty Team

email_chain.body:
Well Ivan,

That was quick! Only 16 hours after I sent you the information, you replied. I really have nothing to say here, since you already sent me your information, and I am sure you have more information to send me. So, I would like to remind you to forward your emails to me through the secure service, so that I know that you care about the secrecy of the data.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Confirmation Request
email_chain.body:
Before you send the information, Ivan, I want to check whether or not you are the one who I thought you are. Could you please write 'Hello, I know you are Yoda' in your reply?

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Final Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Great Ivan,

You are the person that I am searching for. Now I would like to send you the information I got. This is the only thing you need to send back to me in your next reply to make sure that you are the one who I thought you are. Please type 'Sign -TjamIovnOy' and send it to me. Your keyboard may type the letters wrongly, but please type the letters exactly as I write them. Otherwise, your reply may not be considered valid.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Information Sent
email_chain.body:
Great, you got the information, Ivan. Thank you very much for being so patient.

Regards,
John

I am one of the team members on the VOST e-commerce project. I will be forwarding on information you request, however, the development of the site is a lengthy process and may not be completed within the timeline you suggest. We are setting up a test environment that will allow us to provide a small group of clients with a customized website. The preliminary information you request should take us no more than two days to gather. Once we provide you with this information, you will have the opportunity to preview the site.

We will provide you with a list of benefits you can expect to enjoy from utilizing the VOST e-commerce site, and we will also explain why Safeway is working with us in an effort to gain increased efficiencies by using technology. Thanks a lot.

Best regards,
Danel

email_chain.subject: Request for Urea Shipment from Panama to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hi Franco,

We need to move 30,000 bags of urea from Panama to Liverpool. Do you have an open slot on your current round voyage, and what is your usual LMA clause?

Regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Urea Shipment from Panama to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hi Kate,

Sorry, I just saw this now. We're loading at Trincomalee on Sunday, and plan to go via Amsterdam, Rotterdam, and Aalborg to Liverpool. You'd be very welcome to join us. Our usual LMA clause is +$2.0, and I have good bunker availability for Aalborg and Rotterdam.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best,
Franco

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Urea Shipment from Panama to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hi Kate,

I just wanted to ask if you can make your booking decision this week, since my voyage is starting on Sunday?

Best,
Franco

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Urea Shipment from Panama to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hi Franco,

Many thanks. We need to look at our volume requirements in greater detail first, but would be delighted to hear from you as soon as you're ready.

Regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Memorandum of Agreement
email_chain.body:
Good morning, 
As per our conversation earlier this week, please see the attached MOA. We expect your response within the next 24 hours. 
Kind regards, 
Dan

email_chain.subject: Re: Memorandum of Agreement
email_chain.body:
Good morning, 
This was received in the inbox of one of our legal contacts a couple of minutes ago. As we discussed yesterday, this is not correct. Kindly revise it asap. 
Best regards, 
Marissa

email_chain.subject: Contract Approval
email_chain.body:
Good morning, 
Thank you very much for the contract. It will be signed by the UK top management. Kindly send the final draft asap. 
Best regards, 
Nick

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract Approval
email_chain.body:
Good morning, 
As per our last conversation, we are required to amend the attached contract to include the following statements (attached): 
a. No Transfer 
b. Owner Responsibilities 
c. Cost Recovery, and 
d. No Escrow 
Kindly attach the revised document to this email asap. 
Best regards, 
Marissa

email_chain.subject: Bitumen Shipment from Sohar to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

We’d like to fix 4,500MT of bitumen from Sohar to Colombo next month. Could you share your best freight idea and vessel name?

Thanks,
Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment from Sohar to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

What is the cargo size on barge? Is there any chance it could fit the 2100Te vessels for Colombo? Can you send the gear details?

Thanks,
Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment from Sohar to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

What is the cargo size on barge? Is there any chance it could fit the 2100Te vessels for Colombo? Can you send the gear details?

In the meantime, I tried to find some data but couldn’t. I remember that you told me the bitumen will be shipped at 5MT, 6MT, 7MT & 8MT in drums of 220L and 200L. Is it like that? If yes, could you confirm with the client that it can be shipped at 6MT per drum?

Thanks,
Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment from Sohar to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

Please confirm if bitumen shipment can be done at 6MT.

Thanks,
Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment from Sohar to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

Did you ask the vendor if bitumen shipment can be done at 6MT?

Thanks,
Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment from Sohar to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Caroline,

The gear you sent is good. If they (client) can confirm 6MT, we have 1 vessel available to Colombo.

Thanks,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment from Sohar to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Caroline,

It can be done, as they have the containers.

Thanks,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment from Sohar to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Caroline,

Please reply to the client with the following:

• Bitumen: 5300MT
• Gear
• 2200Te Vessel name: Nantong Happiness V.

Thanks,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Preece,

We need to ship 4,000 mt of Ethylene glycol from Houston to La Guaira, Venezuela. We would like a quote on FOB plus your suggested loading port and terms. Also, do you handle the insurance?

Thanks,
Ursula

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote
email_chain.body:
Good morning, Mr. Vargas.

Attached please find our shipment quote, as requested.

Should you have any additional questions or concerns, please feel free to contact me.

Sincerely,
Jimmy

email_chain.subject: Terms of Sale
email_chain.body:
Mr. Vargas,

Please find attached a copy of the Terms of Sale as agreed in our discussion today. Please note that we will be shipping via ocean and have attached the applicable rates and fees.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you,
Larry

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Order
email_chain.body:
Mr. Vargas,

Attached, please find our official confirmation of order and rates per our discussion this morning.

Thank you,
Lawrence Preece

email_chain.subject: Product Quote and Information
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vargas,

Please see attached our quote for your order and further information on the product.

Should you have any questions, please let us know.

Thank you,
Lawrence Preece

email_chain.subject: Internal Agreement
email_chain.body:
Mr. Vargas,

The attached letters 1, 2, and 3 are for the purpose of internal use only. We hereby agree to appoint Preece Shipping Company as our agents and act as our representatives for all shipping services. We agree to cover any and all fees incurred during this contract. Furthermore, we agree that any products sent via Preece Shipping Company will be accompanied by an official certificate of analysis (COA).

Thank you,
Lawrence Preece

email_chain.subject: Request for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Sheldon,

We need 7,600MT capacity for coal from Richards Bay to Maputo this weekend. Do you have an open slot?

Regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Adrian,

We have 7,000MT capacity and offer the following price in FCA and CIF terms:

Price FCA: US$150.00 per MT
Price CIF: US$175.00 per MT

Please confirm your rates to our below details.

The terms are subject to export LOI and Bill of Exchange (not negotiable).
The FCA price is inclusive of Ocean Freight.
Vessel will load at RBCT. Cargo is packed in bags with tags and wheelbarrows will be required for loading.
Payment terms are 100% 30 days net from loading at port.
The vessel will sail on Friday.

Regards,
Sheldon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good morning Sheldon,

The cargo is ready to be loaded. Can you please provide us with your vessel details for loading in Richards Bay?

Regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Adrian,

We will load your cargo on board our vessel <Vessel Name>. The following are details to keep in mind:

• A BL is required for booking and confirmation of the rate.
• The cargo will be discharged in Mozambique at the berth of your nominated port and your representative will be responsible for collection and delivery.
• Payment is via TT and 100% pre-paid upon receipt of original invoice which is based on actual consumption.
• All additional costs will be for your account and the container will be de-bagged at a pre-determined place (to be agreed with your nominated port).
• We can provide you with your nominated port agent’s contact details and will also update you when your cargo has been loaded.

Please make sure you comply with these conditions.

Regards,
Sheldon

email_chain.subject: Booking Request for Methanol Cargo
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Lin,

I’d like to book a 4,500MT cargo of methanol from Montevideo to Rotterdam for the 8th. I know you mentioned in our previous email that you’d have space for us, can you confirm?

Kind regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Request for Methanol Cargo
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Thanks for getting back to me.

I checked with the charterer and we do not have availability for the 8th. Can you let me know the details on the cargo you would like to move?

Best regards,
Lin

email_chain.subject: Update on Methanol Cargo
email_chain.body:
Michael,

We received your request and we are searching for an available freighter for your cargo of methanol. We'll inform you when the ship we are interested in is available.

Hope to hear from you soon.

Kind regards,
Lin

email_chain.subject: New Shipment Request to Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lin,

I have a container to send to Vietnam, date of shipment 7th of February. Would it be possible for you to send me an offer by the 28th of January please?

Best regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: New Shipment Request to Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lin,

Thank you very much for your offer, we have a deal and the freight will be confirmed through our usual trade financing bank. Can you please provide me with a waybill number?

I look forward to hearing from you.

Kind regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Vessel Status Update
email_chain.body:
Good morning Robert,

Just checking in to see how everything is going. Our vessel just arrived in port yesterday and has been off-hire since 2pm. We also hear that other vessels are being loaded on a first-come, first-served basis which may cause a delay in our ETA.

Please advise and let me know if you have any questions.

Best,
Stefan

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Status Update
email_chain.body:
Hello Stefan,

I know that our vessel is at berth 1 and our ETA is on Friday, which is what I have been communicating to you. That is why I’m asking you if you have any further updates. If you have any, please contact me as soon as possible.

I tried to reach you earlier today and was unable to connect. If we could have a phone call later today that would be ideal.

Best,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Security Check Update
email_chain.body:
Hello Robert,

We will be going through security tonight at 22:00. I have the ETA as 06:30 on Thursday. We have been told that there will be a job and a blast if necessary. Please be sure to let us know so we can follow up with them. If you have any further information, please let us know.

Thanks,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Security Check Update
email_chain.body:
Thank you for this update. It's important that we do our best to accommodate the security check and plan accordingly.

Best,
Robert

email_chain.subject: GMS Arrival Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello,

We have received our GMS and we are waiting for them to arrive. Could you please provide us with a time estimate of when they will arrive? Thank you!

Best Regards,
Will

email_chain.subject: Re: GMS Arrival Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the update. We have not yet received a GMS, so we will need to keep you posted as soon as we do.

Best Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: GMS Arrival Inquiry
email_chain.body:
We have received our GMS and we are waiting for them to arrive. Could you please provide us with a time estimate of when they will arrive? Thank you!

Best Regards,
Will

email_chain.subject: Re: GMS Arrival Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the update. We have not yet received a GMS, so we will need to keep you posted as soon as we do.

Best Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: GMS Arrival Inquiry
email_chain.body:
We have received our GMS and we are waiting for them to arrive. Could you please provide us with a time estimate of when they will arrive? Thank you!

Best Regards,
Will

email_chain.subject: Re: GMS Arrival Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the update. We have not yet received a GMS, so we will need to keep you posted as soon as we do.

Best Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Cotton Transportation
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We’d like to transport 2,900MT of cotton to Ghent from Huangpu. Could you let us know your best available rate, and do you work on an FCA basis?

Thank you for your time,
Henry

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Cotton Transportation
email_chain.body:
Dear Henry,

Thanks for your mail. I will try my best to find out the info from our cargo department.

Best regards,
Clark Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Cotton Transportation
email_chain.body:
Dear Clark Chen,

I am glad to hear from you. You could try any carrier, please. If they have empty sailings, they would be happy to carry our goods. Our cargo is different from other goods; we transport it through containers instead of using trucks, so our goods are more sensitive.

Let me know if you have questions or suggestions.

Thank you!
Henry

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Cotton Transportation
email_chain.body:
Dear Clark Chen,

Thanks for your reply. Could you tell me which is the best choice? Our cargo usually transports at least 100,000 tons at a time. Is it better to transport by the whole container or shipper’s owned container?

Please let me know if you have questions or suggestions.

Thanks for your time!
Henry

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Cotton Transportation
email_chain.body:
Dear Henry,

Thanks for your mail. Sorry for my delay.

Best regards,
Clark Chen

email_chain.subject: Request for Cargo Loading
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. An,

If you still have room on your 1st Apr laycan to Kaohsiung, can we load 5,000MT of blue crystalline sodium nitrate from Kaohsiung to Xiamen next week?

Regards,
Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Loading
email_chain.body:
Hi Phil,

Thank you for your e-mail. I cannot find the charter today, but you may confirm with me again on Wednesday.

Regards,
Jenny An

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Loading
email_chain.body:
Thanks Jenny! We appreciate it.

Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Loading
email_chain.body:
Hi Phil,

Just checked the charter contract again. It is available for loading of your cargo.

Best regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Loading
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the quick reply!

Can we have your voyage details so we can organize the delivery of our cargo? Also, what is your departure date?

Regards,
Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Loading
email_chain.body:
Phil,

Please provide this information to me and I can forward to ship agents. Also, for your information, our vessel was calling in Kaohsiung on 1st April and will load about 12,000 MT of blue crystalline sodium nitrate from Kaohsiung to Xiamen.

Best regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Loading
email_chain.body:
Thanks!

Our buyer would like to load 5,000MT on the vessel next week. If you can handle the cargo on the scheduled date, please confirm.

Regards,
Phil

email_chain.subject: Proposal for Sorghum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dominic,

Please send a proposal to ship 5,000MT of sorghum from Abidjan to Rotterdam. The ETA is within a month.

Thanks,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Interest in Sorghum Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am very interested in your proposal. I would like to know more about the following information:
1) The USD price of the sorghum.
2) When the sorghum is available to be shipped from Abidjan to Rotterdam.
3) The volume of the sorghum in cubic meters.
4) The total amount of USD that would be charged for handling fee, shipping fee, insurance fee and other fees.
5) How long is the normal delivery time for shipping from Abidjan to Rotterdam.

Thanks for your assistance and your prompt reply.

Regards,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Interest in Sorghum Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Thank you for your assistance and information.
1) USD $100 per MT
2) 1 month
3) 5000 cubic meters
4) USD $100,000
5) 20 days.

Thank you very much for your assistance.

Regards,
Dominic

email_chain.subject: Re: Interest in Sorghum Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am very interested in your proposal and I would like to do business with you. Thank you for your prompt reply.

Regards,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Interest in Sorghum Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Thank you for your interest in our business. We are willing to do business with you. However, we would like to ask you some more information:
1) How long does it take for the cargoes to arrive at Rotterdam?
2) Do you have enough credit for our business?
3) Please confirm your email again: peter@hotmail.com
4) Please confirm your address: Queen 1003, Hangzhou City, China.

Thank you very much for your attention.

Regards,
Dominic

email_chain.subject: Fuel Oil Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Brown,

I have 4,500 MT of fuel oil available from ARA. Do you have a vessel that is scheduled to load mid-April?

Thanks,
Michelle

email_chain.subject: Re: Fuel Oil Availability
email_chain.body:
Mr. Brown,

I was recently forwarded your e-mail. I have a vessel (MT EVROS V) that is scheduled to load in ARA mid-April, and I would like to inquire about your offer. What price are you offering? Please let me know if this is something you are interested in. I look forward to hearing back from you.

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Offer for Fuel Oil
email_chain.body:
Mr. Brown,

I am glad to hear that you are interested in our offer. My company is offering $3.20 per MT fob for your vessel. Please let me know if you would like to accept our offer, and if you would like to proceed, I can send you a contract in order for us to formalize our agreement.

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Our Offer
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Brown,

I just wanted to follow up on our conversation this morning. It would be great to hear back from you and to learn whether you want to move forward with us. I look forward to hearing back from you soon!

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Revised Offer
email_chain.body:
Mr. Brown,

We would like to make you a better offer. What would you be willing to accept?

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on New Contract
email_chain.body:
Mr. Brown,

I hope you're doing well and have had a chance to review the new contract I sent you. I just wanted to reach out and see if you had any questions on it. Also, I wanted to confirm whether you are still interested in receiving fuel from us. I look forward to hearing back from you soon!

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Final Follow-Up
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Brown,

I hope you're doing well and have had a chance to review the new contract I sent you. I just wanted to reach out and see if you had any questions on it. Also, I wanted to confirm whether you are still interested in receiving fuel from us. I look forward to hearing back from you soon!

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Susan,

We’re reaching out to see if you could handle a 1000CTN container load from San Diego to Auckland, NZ. We anticipate this shipment will go on board a vessel by the end of this month. Our client requires that you use the "GENTLE" special handling service during the entire voyage. Would you be willing and able to do this? Can you also quote a freight rate and demurrage cost?

Regards,
Jeanette

email_chain.subject: RE: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Kevin,

Our customer in Auckland, NZ has asked for a tender price for a container shipment from San Diego. Could you please provide a quote?

Thank you,
Michael

email_chain.subject: FW: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Our company is in the business of making GPS tracker devices. One of our customers from San Diego, CA has asked for a quotation for the shipment of one 40ft container of our devices to Auckland, NZ. This load will require "GENTLE" special handling. Could you please email me a price?

Thanks,
Michael

email_chain.subject: RE: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir or Madam,

This is to confirm our pricing for the shipment of 1 x 40 ft HC container for 1,000 cartons of GPS Trackers from the port of San Diego, California to the port of Auckland, New Zealand. The cargo will require the "GENTLE" special handling service. We would like to quote you an FOB rate of $1,250 per container and an L/C payment term. If you would like to further discuss this quote, please contact me at your convenience.

Regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: RE: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

This is a confirmation for the quote for 1 x 40 ft HC container for 1,000 cartons of GPS Trackers.

Regards,
Kevin

email_chain.subject: RE: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

This is the invoice for the shipment of 1 x 40 ft HC container for 1,000 cartons of GPS Trackers.

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: RE: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Thank you for your letter of 8 September. I am pleased to say that we can offer a price of $1,450.

Regards,
Susan

labels.cargo_size: 1 x 40 ft HC container for 1,000 cartons

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote - Rice from Vietnam to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi,

We would like to ship approximately 30,000 MT of rice from Vietnam to Mombasa as soon as possible. The destination's preferred method is for a lump sum delivery price.

Best regards,
Tina

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - Rice from Vietnam to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your quote. Some further information:

The rice would be shipped over a number of months, but we would like the price to be fixed for all of the months. Also, the port at the destination is likely to change, so we would need the FOB price to be from either Ho Chi Minh City, Da Nang, or Cai Mep ports (but not Vung Tau port). The dates are subject to change, but we would probably want to start loading in September, and the rice will be delivered over a number of months.

Best regards,
Tina

labels.load_port: Ho Chi Minh City, Da Nang, or Cai Mep

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Rate
email_chain.body: Hi Miguel, We need to move 4,000MT of molybdenum oxide from New York to Guadalajara. Could you send me your best rates asap and please confirm if you offer a standard laycan, demurrage, and dispatch? Thanks, Tracy

email_chain.subject: Purchase Order Attached
email_chain.body: Hi Miguel, As requested, we have attached our Purchase Order. We are expecting a draft shortly. Thanks, Tracy

email_chain.subject: Re: Purchase Order Attached
email_chain.body: Hi Tracy, Thanks for the Purchase Order. We will need a pre-booking of USD 15,000, refundable once we have executed the contract, to cover our expenses and your insurance. Your estimated delivery is March 14, 2017. We would be pleased if we can quote you our normal FOB laycan, demurrage, and dispatch. Kind regards, Miguel

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Draft
email_chain.body: Hi Miguel, We have sent you a purchase order and we expect you to send us a draft. Thanks, Tracy

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Freight and Insurance
email_chain.body: Hi Miguel, Thanks for the info and for your invoice. We confirm that we would like to go with the market freight of USD 9,000 on FOB basis. Your invoice, including the commission of USD 15,000, will be sent to our bank today. Please note that we have been quoted an insurance of USD 500 by XYZ Insurance Company. Could you inform us whether you are using XYZ Insurance Company? We are informed that they are a reputable company but that they are paying out large claims in many cases. Thanks, Tracy

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Freight and Insurance
email_chain.body: Hi Tracy, Thanks for your invoice. We will contact your bank on Friday regarding the draft. We confirm that we will use XYZ Insurance Company. We will send you the insurance documentation on Friday. Kind regards, Miguel

email_chain.subject: Insurance Statement
email_chain.body: Dear Miguel, We confirm receipt of the following insurance for shipment of 4,000MT of molybdenum oxide to be shipped from New York to Guadalajara. 1. All Risk Cargo Insurance - $9,000 premium 2. Airborne Container Loss - $1,000 premium. We also confirm that we will be liable for any additional insurance premium resulting from the non-advice of the dangerous goods declaration. With regards, The AM Line Ltd.

email_chain.subject: LNG Shipment from Melbourne to Halifax
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Strauch,

It’s time for our annual port visit to North American ports. What can you offer for 11,700MT of LNG from Melbourne to Halifax in early May?

Thanks,
Mckenzie

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Offer
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Morgan,

I’ll be in Dubai next month and wanted to know if you’re in the market for 35,000MT of crude oil on our shuttle tanker. The price is $26,400MT.

Drop me a line if this interests you.

Best regards,
Conrad

email_chain.subject: Port Notice
email_chain.body:
Mr. Morgan,

No worries for the port. However, we need a two-day notice before loading so we don’t end up in a crunch.

Regards,
Mr. Stanley

email_chain.subject: Shipment Departure from Jeddah
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Carmona,

When can you expect your shipment to leave Jeddah? We'd like to arrange an RO for our bulk carrier.

Thank you,
Colleen

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Departure from Jeddah
email_chain.body:
Hi Colleen,

When should we expect your goods to leave? At the moment, the container has not been shipped out from the yard. Kindly clarify.

Best regards,
Mr. Carmona

email_chain.subject: Update on Shipment Arrival
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Can you please give me an update on the arrival of your shipment at the port of discharge?

Thank you,
Colleen

email_chain.subject: Re: Update on Shipment Arrival
email_chain.body:
Dear Colleen,

We expect to receive the goods from your port next week. Kindly let me know if there are any issues to take care of.

Best regards,
Mr. Carmona

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Shipment Readiness
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Carmona,

Is the container placed in a ready condition for shipment? Kindly confirm.

Thank you,
Colleen

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Shipment Request
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Smith,

I need 1500 m3 of crude oil shipped from New York to London by August 1st. Also, what would your demurrage rate be if we’re 15 minutes late?

Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Shipment Request
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Smith,

I’m working for American Fuel Corporation from New York and I need to receive 250 m3 of crude oil from you on July 25th. In addition, what would your demurrage rate be if we’re one hour late?

Thanks.

Regards,
Lisa

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Lisa,

Thanks for your email. Please fill in the following blanks and then return to me:

Port Name: 

Crude Oil Volume: 250 m3

Loading Date: July 25th

Discharge Port: London

Demurrage Rate for 1 hour late: 

Regards,
John Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - Delivery Time Estimation
email_chain.body:
I would like to inform you that the distance between New York and London by water is around 4550 miles. From your blanks, you will need about 64 hours to reach London if the ship moves 100 miles per day. In this case, we can conclude that if the ship arrives in 65 hours, it will be one hour late.

Regards,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Shipment of Sodium Chloride from Guangzhou to Kuching
email_chain.body:
Dear Valued Partner,

We’re looking to ship 700MT of sodium chloride from Guangzhou to Kuching on 1 December. Could you advise if you handle port dues under FOB terms, and do you accept telegraphic transfers?

Kind regards,

email_chain.subject: **SECURITY WARNING**
email_chain.body:
--- 
This was flagged by email as it was coming from an unknown sender. User profile was inspected and found to be empty. It was sent through Rapid Mailer (Mandrill)

However, it did contain a tracking number to an item that the sender said had been sent from the USA, which has led to this email. So this would likely come from some sort of automated mailer.

The files appear to be some sort of "GET mail spambot" or maybe a B2B mailer system.
The zip contains a bunch of folders and files, and does not look executable. Likely some user data.

email_chain.subject: RE: Parcel delivery from Norway

Please let us know the next steps. We should be able to collect it asap.

Sincerely,
Joe Parr

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Voyage SMMACV2749
email_chain.body: If possible, I'd like to ask a question about your voyage SMMACV2749. For 2,700MT of ammonium sulfate from Damietta to Koper, do you have capacity next week, and can we finalize a CP with minimal laycan buffer? Thanks, Karen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Voyage SMMACV2749
email_chain.body: Dear Karen, We already had two communications with you, but we didn't receive any proposal from you, even though we offered you our best C/P. Regards, Farid

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Voyage SMMACV2749
email_chain.body: Can someone please send the email thread so I can explain better what is happening? Thanks! Sincerely, Karen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Voyage SMMACV2749
email_chain.body:
Regards, Farid

P.S. Please send your proposal as soon as possible, since we want to proceed with the loading of the cargo next week. We don't know the date for the vessel yet, but the date will be available by Monday.

email_chain.subject: Request for Proposal
email_chain.body: Dear Ms. Lisa, Please send us your proposal for the 2,700 MT of Ammonium Sulfate from Damietta to Koper. We already offered you the best C/P on the market for the same voyage. Regards, Farid

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Proposal
email_chain.body: As requested, I am including a snapshot of our web portal as it appears today. It contains information about the markets in which Karen trades, and the freight rates for each trade. The portal also shows how certain factors, such as market volatility, can affect rates. Each sector displays a current snapshot of freight rates for each of the areas that Karen can trade, and a visual map indicating rate fluctuations. Also, freight rates appear in a moving graph which shows trends over the last 30 days. This is quite beneficial for traders who have to make decisions based on live market conditions. Another important function is the ship and route selector. When a ship trader selects a specific ship, the system shows in green or red the rates and savings for that specific ship on each route. This helps traders determine which ship and which route to select. Finally, a major aspect of the technology is the asset manager.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Proposal
email_chain.body: Thank you very much for the quick response and information. How do I understand this correctly? The screenshot shows the C/P from Damietta to Koper. The C/P for the voyage Damietta -> Koper is 3.25/3.70 points less compared to the CP for the same route from Rotterdam -> Damietta. This makes a total difference of 3.625 to 5.375 $/day (depending on the grade). Since the ship owner is not willing to fix the voyage for the entire laycan, but only until next week, I can't make any changes to the CP. Regards, Karen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Proposal
email_chain.body: Thanks for your reply. Unfortunately, the outlook is not good. The market for ammonium sulfate went down again yesterday, although Ammonium Nitrate, the rival product, has gone up significantly.

email_chain.subject: Scientific Inquiry
email_chain.body: The question for our scientists is: can we reverse engineer a fully functional brain on a small scale? We know the basic process: Light enters the eye through the lens and falls on the retina. Our neural pathways can recognize different light frequencies, decode them, and convert them into signals. But is it possible to create an organic working brain by synthesizing only those required ingredients?

email_chain.subject: RE: QUERY FOR DEMURRAGE DATE RATE
email_chain.body:

Information Required:

Date of Arrival: 8th February 2015
Position of Vessel: Offshore of Bandar Mahshahr, in wait for tug
Type of Vessel: 105,000 DWT, Crude Oil Tanker
Draft of Vessel: 15.50 meters

Please note that the rates provided are for when a vessel is delayed waiting for assistance such as tugs. As no demurrage is applied, no rate is provided.

email_chain.subject: RE: QUERY FOR DEMURRAGE DATE RATE
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

With reference to your email No <Email Number> dated 23/02/2015 regarding our query for demurrage date rate in Bandar Mahshahr, Suez Canal area. I would like to inform you that on behalf of our principals, the Authority of Iran Ministry of Maritime & Ports has mentioned in their letter to us No <Letter Number> dated 23/02/2015 that in the case the local vessels with 120,000 MT+ deadweight and tugboat fail to perform their commitments as per the contract for rendering the navigational service and in the case the services rendered are not up to the international standard, a local authority such as KOTTE at the port is responsible to render the services as per the contract with the benefit of local vessels with deadweight of less than 120,000 MT.

Best regards,
Principal

email_chain.subject: Shipment of EVA Resin from India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hey Nick,

We’re trying to move 8,000MT of EVA resin from India to Turkey. Would you have the space? What’s your freight rate?

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of EVA Resin from India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Andreas,

Regarding your request for 8,000MT of EVA resin from India to Turkey, unfortunately, we don't have the space for that. However, we can handle 15,000MT to Taiwan.

The freight rate would be around $10.5 per MT, definitely not $11.

Best,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of EVA Resin from India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

That's good news about the 15,000MT to Taiwan. It sounds much better.

However, I just learned that the customer in Turkey and the customer in Taiwan are the same. It's just a customer's secondary office. I don't think they will need that much EVA resin in both places at the same time. If it's 15,000MT, I'm afraid they will cancel the order.

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of EVA Resin from India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

I have talked to my customer and I was right: The secondary office is an independent operation. There is a limit of 10,000MT per office. We'll need to divide the shipment between the two offices. Can we split it? And can we lower the freight rate? This would help us get a better offer.

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of EVA Resin from India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Andreas,

Thank you for your response. I appreciate your ideas.

We're going to divide the shipment between the two offices. This means we'll need two ships and twice as many containers. I think it would be better to get a better freight rate. Is $10.5 per MT too much?

Best,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of EVA Resin from India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

That's a relief, the 10,000MT limit per office. I'm thinking 7,000MT to Taiwan.

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of EVA Resin from India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Andreas,

Great! 7,000MT. But one more question. The buyer in Taiwan doesn't need to take the full 7,000MT. He has room for just 6,000MT. Can we get a better rate with just 6,000MT?

Best,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of EVA Resin from India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

Yes, let's talk about the freight rate. We're on the same page. We're talking about 6,000MT of EVA resin from India to Taiwan. One more thing: Our shipper needs to know the port.

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.body: Dear Ms. Klein, At the moment, our vessel is not ready for transport, and we’re afraid that it won’t be until the 10th of next month. Of course, that will depend on how quickly repairs can be carried out. Our most recent repairs were completed on the 1st of March. Ms. Smith, my supervisor, says that we may be able to reschedule for the 12th of next month, but that you must let us know by the 7th of next month. Yours truly, Krishna Balasubramaniam

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Transport of Ethylene Dichloride
email_chain.body: Dear Mr. Balasubramaniam, Thank you for the speedy reply! We’re hoping that repairs can be completed as soon as possible. Unfortunately, we’re working with very tight deadlines and can’t afford to wait until March. Please contact us when you have the next available slot. Yours truly, Karen Klein

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for Seafood from Surabaya to Qingdao
email_chain.body:

We are looking to ship 400MT of seafood from Surabaya to Qingdao in July. Could you accommodate a mid-July laycan, and what is your detention and demurrage clause?

Thank you,
Maya

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Seafood from Surabaya to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Maya,

Thanks for your email and kindly note the following:

1. We would be pleased to offer the service of M/V MISC "DECCAN STAR" for your cargoes.
2. Estimated laycan: 25th - 27th July, 2013.
3. Port: Qingdao - Qingdao.
4. Loading date: 16th - 19th July, 2013.
5. Loading vessel: 8,000 CW, Reefer.
6. FIO/TFO.
7. Available refrigerated space: Total of 13,380 cubic meters (3.64/4.6/0.5/2.5m).
8. Equipment details: 20 x 40' Ref. Container, Total 800 cubic meters

Best regards,
Frank Lee

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Corn Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Can your vessel load 4,000MT of corn oil from Galveston to Qingdao by the end of May? We are looking for an L/C T/C with an expiry of 15 days.

Best,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Corn Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi,

This vessel arrived at Qingdao at the end of the day on 16 May. It is ready for discharge and we are unable to arrange unloading before 19 May. We would appreciate if you could send an amended voyage estimate to our agent so we can approve it as soon as possible.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Corn Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

Could you let me know your appointed agent in Qingdao please? We can contact them directly. Also, your intention of discharging on 19 May is not acceptable to us. A vessel lying idle for 10 days at Qingdao is unacceptable. If you can't start discharging before 18 May, we are looking for a counter-offer.

Thank you.

Best,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Corn Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

We have appointed JPT as our agent in Qingdao. This is their contact information:

JPT International Co. Ltd.
Address: Block A, Room 802, No.10 DongHaiNan Road, Qingdao, 266061, P.R.China.
Phone: 86-532-80780378/80780379
Fax: 86-532-807803

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Corn Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

We are concerned with the delay on loading by your charterer in Galveston. We suggest that your charterer completes loading before the vessel arrives in Qingdao. Otherwise, your charterer has to pay the vessel demurrage.

Our voyage estimate has already been prepared and is on its way to Jane. This is a copy of the voyage estimate for your reference.

Please also note that, according to your contract, the charterer is responsible for the costs of shifting between berths.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Corn Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Chris,

Please note that the vessel will load oil products from Galveston from 13 May to 16 May. The cargo is limited to light and mid oil. A 10% allowance is possible to be covered by 15P/15S if necessary.

It is our pleasure to accommodate your request.

Best,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Potential Buyers for Rice Shipments to Africa

A friend of mine told me about potential buyers for your rice shipments to Africa. I have great access to Brazilian rice exporters and could put together some prices for you. Let me know if you have other needs.

Thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Buyers for Rice Shipments to Africa
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Thanks for your message. I would be glad to meet your friends. Please let me know when you can make time to meet with me.

Your workmate,
Yusang

email_chain.subject: Next Steps for Rice Shipments
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hong,

I am glad to hear that you want to work with me. Please find the following attached; I want you to do the following:

- Please go to the bank and get these credits asap. US $13.5 million.
- We need around 5 containers of rice in three shipments from one Brazilian company. I know we can't finish these at once. We need at least US $1.5 million in one week. We can do this repeatedly with larger amounts.
- Please send me the price information before you go to the bank.

These will be perfectly handled when you get the credits.

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Rate Estimate for Isopropanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jonas,

Please provide a rate estimate for 4,800 MT of isopropanol from Houston to Cartagena. We’d like to get this to our factory for production as soon as possible. Do you provide cargo insurance under DAP terms?

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Estimate for Isopropanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jonas,

The 4,800 MT of isopropanol in my last email is 3x20 containers and 2x40 containers with a total capacity of 96 TEUs.

Best,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Estimate for Isopropanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Thank you for your inquiry. I am sending you a quote in this email for your review. We will require a 25% deposit to secure the space. Once this space is secured, we will provide the details for your local bank to remit payment as well as the full details of your cargo insurance and each bill of lading to be made.

Our next step will be to give our operations department the go-ahead to send you the cargo insurance declaration forms to have the bank start paying out the insurance coverage. Once the insurance has been set up, the process of shipment will begin and we will provide you with further details.

Best regards,
Jonas

Zane Griffin
Assistant to Sales

Assistant to Sales

email_chain.subject: Transition of Contract
email_chain.body:
Dear Felicia,

Please note that Dr. Alexander will be leaving our brokering firm at the end of the month. I will be taking over our contract and would be happy to meet to discuss our future collaboration. Do you have any availability early next week?

Many thanks in advance and best regards,
Angela

email_chain.subject: Re: Transition of Contract
email_chain.body:
Hi Angela,

Thanks for your quick reply. We recently set up a meeting with Patrick Winkelmayer. I believe he is the one who liked our portfolio so much. I would like to know what he has planned for the future and how he sees the possible collaboration. Patrick recently sent me an e-mail. I am including it here for you.

Best regards,
Felicia

email_chain.subject: Proposal Comments
email_chain.body:
Dear Patrick,

I received the proposal from Paul Spangler's firm. As discussed, please find my comments below:
1) In relation to the proposal, I would like to reduce the number of projects for which we would like to broker the deal with you. This is not due to concerns about your ability, but we would like to start with a smaller scope. The deal with the American electronics firm is our first priority.
2) In relation to the electronics deal, I would like to ask that you consider moving the timeline up. It's become clear to us that American firms are now looking to work with British firms to access their competitive tax rates. Moving the deal forward would make us an attractive proposition.
3) Finally, in relation to the rate you quoted for the electronics firm, I

Best regards,
Felicia

email_chain.subject: Electronics Firm Deal
email_chain.body:
Dear Patrick,

I am sorry to say that we will not be able to work with you on the electronics firm deal. In terms of negotiations, you are pushing the company to consider things that it is not ready to consider. We will not be able to work with you.

It was a pleasure working with you.

Sincerely,
Felicia

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request for Bauxite Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Brown,

We have a load of Bauxite coming out of Port Beni, Peru, approx. 40,000MT, FOB. Please advise your best freight estimate.

Sincerely,
John Paul

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for Bauxite Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

I'm assuming you're with Sigi Sanaa Shipping Corp. If that is correct, your freight rates are as follows:

HK: USD2.20/MT
TZ: USD3.40/MT
SK: USD1.10/MT
CW: USD2.00/MT
RH: USD0.90/MT
JO: USD1.90/MT

As per Custom clearance, cargo will be delivered at Sidong railway/terminal as freight, and custom and railway charges, depending on load and transportation, will be included at spot rate. This is subject to railway cooperation and availability of wagons, i.e., cannot be guaranteed until we get your instructions to load.

This is a 'FREIGHT' estimate, so let me know if you want an FOB - CIF estimate.

Sincerely,
Roger Brown

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for Bauxite Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Roger,

I need this information by close of business, 20 Mar. 2006. Are you available then?

Sincerely,
John Paul

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for Bauxite Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Roger,

Thank you for your email on March 22, 2006. I agree to your prices at USD 3.40/MT only. I was wondering if you will charge an extra amount to include another 11,600 MT of the same Bauxite to our freight. Also, we have another similar shipment at the same time with the same rate as above to FRSA, Hook with FOB of May 29th, 2006. Please advise.

Sincerely,
John Paul

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for Bauxite Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Sure. No problem. Would you send a proforma invoice and send the original to Sigi Sanaa Shipping Corporation in Manila please?

Sincerely,
Roger Brown

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request for 25,000MT Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Brown,

We are a consortium of buyers. Can you give me your best freight estimate for a shipment of 25,000MT FOB HK for delivery at the end of April 2006, destination: TZ?

Sincerely,
Myra

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for 25,000MT Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Myra,

You're with Agri-Tech, correct?

All charges are FOB, origin is Hong Kong. Here's my estimate:

HK: USD 2.20/MT
TZ: USD 3.40/MT

You can let me know the best way to remit payment to our bank.

Sincerely,
Roger Brown

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for 25,000MT Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Roger,

I need an estimate for shipment via steamer.

Sincerely,
Myra

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Rates
email_chain.body:
Jitendra,

We’re interested in bringing in 6,000MT of oilseed from Kandla to Durban in July or August. Would you be able to get back to us with some shipping rates by the end of this week?

Thanks,
Vivian

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Rates
email_chain.body:
Vivian,

You can receive a very low price on shipping 1000MT of oil seed cake from Mumbai to South Africa.

Regards,
Jitendra Singh

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Cargo
email_chain.body:
Jitendra,

You sent me an email about shipping 1000MT of oil seed cake from Mumbai to South Africa, and I am contacting you in reference to that. I have found that the clients want the oil seed cake and not the oil. Would it be possible to have the cargo include the oil seed cake only? I do not want the oil in the shipment.

Please advise.
Vivian

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Cargo
email_chain.body:
Vivian,

I have already booked the shipment to your port and the cargo will contain oil seed cake only. So do not worry, as the cargo is getting loaded.

Regards,
Jitendra Singh

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Shipment Information
email_chain.body:
Jitendra,

Why haven’t I been receiving any information about the shipment from you? I sent you my email and phone number. Can you continue to check on this with me?

Thanks,
Vivian

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Shipping Fertilizer from Dalian to Nassau
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Young,

How much does it cost to ship 300MT of fertilizer from Dalian to Nassau? What's the typical dispatch time?

Thanks,
Hannah

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Fertilizer from Dalian to Nassau
email_chain.body:
Hi Hannah,

It is about USD 100,000 for CIF term. Our delivery time is usually about 30 days from Dalian port.

Note: USD 100,000 is the total amount of the order. Please provide your full name for invoicing.

Thanks,
Annie

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Fertilizer from Dalian to Nassau
email_chain.body:
Dear Annie,

According to the details, we will give you the best rate. Please provide your full name for invoicing.

Thanks,
Molly

email_chain.subject: Price List Enclosed
email_chain.body:
Please find the latest price list enclosed.

Thanks,
Molly

email_chain.subject: Re: Price List Enclosed
email_chain.body:
Dear Molly,

Thank you for the price list. Are the prices in RMB (Chinese Yuan) or USD (United States dollar)?

Thanks,
Hannah

email_chain.subject: Re: Price List Enclosed
email_chain.body:
Dear Hannah,

USD is more accurate. Because sometimes RMB varies slightly.

Best regards,
Molly

email_chain.subject: Re: Price List Enclosed
email_chain.body:
Dear Molly,

Would it be possible to ask you to quote me the CIF price instead of the FOB price? If yes, what's your advice? CIF or FOB is better?

Thanks,
Hannah

email_chain.subject: Re: Price List Enclosed
email_chain.body:
Dear Hannah,

It depends on where you're located. It's normally more accurate to get the CIF price.

Here is the difference between CIF and FOB terms: http://www.costpacific.co/cif-vs-fob

Best regards,
Molly

email_chain.subject: Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

I am glad to provide you with a quote for your bulk corn starch shipment from Bangkok to Haiphong.

Seafreight CFR Haiphong: $1081.25 /MT
Demurrage rate: $150.00 / day

Can you let me know your exact size, quality, ETA, and type of packaging?

Looking forward to working with you,
Al

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Al,

Thank you for the quote. Please provide your bank details so that I can transfer $15,000 as an advance payment.

Best regards,
Zara

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

What a thoughtful and kind person you are. I appreciate your desire to donate the money to such a good cause, and I admire your mother's values.

Your advance payment is much appreciated, and I will use it to pay for the transportation costs. Please be assured that your shipment will be handled with utmost care and delivered to you promptly and safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to me. Looking forward to a long-lasting and fruitful business relationship with you,
Al

email_chain.subject: Change of Delivery Point
email_chain.body:
Dear Al,

I would like to change the delivery point to Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC). I have changed the booking number of the shipment. Please confirm the new details.

Best regards,
Zara

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Delivery Point
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

We're having a hard time switching the delivery point. I've talked to the shipping line and their only solution is to send the shipment back to Bangkok so it can be shipped to the correct location. Unfortunately, the cost of this is very high, and I don't think it's a viable option for you.

Best regards,
Al

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Delivery Point
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

I've talked to the shipping line again, and they have agreed to make the necessary changes to the shipment so it can be delivered to Ho Chi Minh City instead of Haiphong. However, the cost of this is still quite high, and I'm afraid it will be significant.

Best regards,
Al

email_chain.subject: Quick Chat Before Vacation
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,
Are you free for a few words before you go on vacation? If you are, please confirm your availability via email or call us back at this number +1 612 239 5823.

email_chain.subject: Feedback Discussion
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,
Thank you for confirming your availability on 2019-08-10 12:00. I was hoping to discuss your feedback. Let's start with your overall impression on the project. What I've heard so far makes me believe there might be some room for improvements. Could you please share the info below with me?
I will call you back tomorrow.

email_chain.subject: Availability for Quick Call
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,
Please confirm your availability for a quick call this week. Can you please reply with the earliest day and time? Thanks!

email_chain.subject: Project Progress Discussion
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,
How about we chat about your progress on the project on 2019-09-15 14:00?

email_chain.subject: Feedback Discussion
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,
Your feedback is crucial to us. Could you please confirm your availability on 2019-10-11 12:00?

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Soybean Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Lindberg,

I hope you're doing well. Do you have any availability in the next month or so for 8,700 MT of soybeans from Montreal to Rio de Janeiro? Also, what's your proposed demurrage rate for delays?

Kind regards,
Emi

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Soybean Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Lindberg,

Your proposal for transporting the 8,700 MT of soybeans from Montreal to Rio de Janeiro was very attractive. How soon can you have all the documents signed and ready for me? And can we have the payment ready by the 20th?

Regards,
Anel

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Response Needed
email_chain.body:
Ms. Lindberg,

Please tell me what the situation is. Our representative says he's not getting any reply from you.

Regards,
Manuel

email_chain.subject: Negotiations for Soybean Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Lindberg,

We are ready to start negotiations for shipping 15,000 MT of soybeans from Montreal to Rio de Janeiro. However, our representative says he's not getting any response from you.

Yours sincerely,
Priscila

email_chain.subject: Request to Start Shipping Process
email_chain.body:
Ms. Lindberg,

My client wants to ship 15,000 MT of soybeans from Montreal to Rio de Janeiro in April. Your earlier proposal to my client seems quite promising. Could we start the process?

Best regards,
Naji

email_chain.subject: Conclusion of Negotiations
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Selling Cheese
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Kirkman,

Hi,

I am looking to sell 10 tons of Cheese that we currently have in stock. What is the price that you are looking for?

Would appreciate it if you could let me know your best price for this cheese.

Thank you,

Henry Williams
Managing Director
John Foods Ltd.
Tel: 020-7283-9567

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Selling Cheese
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Williams,

Hi,

Thanks for getting back to me.

Our usual price for 10 tons of Cheese is €2.5 per kilo.

Will you be able to sell it for that price?

Let me know if you have any other questions.

Thanks again,

Johnathan
Johnstone Foods Ltd.
020-7447-5128

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Selling Cheese
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Johnstone,

Hi,

I would be able to sell this Cheese to you for €2.5 per kilo, but the quantities would be limited. The minimum order quantity is 10 tons.

Would you be able to offer a better price than this?

Best Regards,

Henry Williams
Managing Director
John Foods Ltd.
020-7283-9567

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Selling Cheese
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Williams,

Hi,

Thank you for your response. I will discuss this internally and get back to you with our best offer.

Best Regards,

Johnathan
Johnstone Foods Ltd.
020-7447-5128

email_chain.subject: TENDER FOR 6000MT MALABO TO CAPE TOWN
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Li,
We have a cargo of 6,000MT to be loaded in Malabo. It must be delivered in Cape Town by 11 May. Would your company be interested in tendering?
Thanks,
Kris

email_chain.subject: Re: TENDER FOR 6000MT MALABO TO CAPE TOWN
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your inquiry. Our rate for this shipment is USD1,500 per metric ton.
Looking forward to your reply.
Best regards,
Ms. Li

email_chain.subject: Re: TENDER FOR 6000MT MALABO TO CAPE TOWN
email_chain.body:
The rate is okay with us, but there is a problem with the transit time. Could you check your ETA for my customer? We are willing to pay more if it will arrive earlier.
Thanks,
Kris

email_chain.subject: Re: TENDER FOR 6000MT MALABO TO CAPE TOWN
email_chain.body:
Dear Kris,
Unfortunately, we are not sure if we can achieve the ETA. Our vessel has a good speed, but if it is ballast in Malabo, it will take at least 16 days. If the cargo is loaded in Malabo, it will have to wait for our ship.
Best regards,
Ms. Li

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Bitumen Shipment from IADC to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Dear Jelena,

We have 6,000MT of bitumen from IADC to Maputo. Could you share your available windows and dispatch incentives?

Best regards,
Harry

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bitumen Shipment from IADC to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Dear Harry,

Hi, I'm afraid our trade is more than limited to only a small network of petroleum engineers which are strictly within the company hierarchy. Our website describes the business development we're doing and, since we're not the agents of any refineries, the trucks are not available to carry the goods of other refineries.

Thank you for your understanding.

Regards,
Jelena

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Bitumen Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jelena,

Good afternoon, I am sorry if our letter was misunderstood by you. We have no other refinery that wants to deliver the bitumen to Maputo; therefore, the deal is between IADC and us. The CIF price offered is the price for Maputo.

Sincerely,
Harry

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Bitumen Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Harry,

Greetings, We refer to the emails you have sent and our last one. For clarification, please be advised that we are not a refinery; we are the Oil Services Company and the trucks belong to us. We have recently made a contract with the IADC refinery to ship 6,000MT of bitumen to Maputo and we are asking if you have some interested buyers in this location.

Regards,
Jelena

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate and Laytime Clarification
email_chain.body:
Good morning, 

Could you provide a freight estimate for 3,900MT of ethanol from Maceió to Houston in late August? Also, is laytime counted on arrival or upon NOR? 

Thanks for your help, 
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate and Laytime Clarification
email_chain.body:
Are you sure of your MT readings? Or is this based on MBBL's? These readings seem to be off by a lot. It will probably be several months till the ethanol has finished being stored in the tanks. Check if you can and let me know, please. 

Thanks, 
X

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate and Laytime Clarification
email_chain.body:
I just looked up prices for ethanol in Houston from Singapore, from Brazil, and from Egypt. They are all pretty much the same, with a 3 USD difference. In July, Brazil was cheaper, but now in August, Egypt is slightly cheaper. But, you know how quickly that could change. 

Now I know that I've tried everything and I will go back to 1 USD delivered from Maceió and maybe try again later. You could really try and find out the MT readings; I'm going to go with them. I need this so I can estimate how much gas it will take for the sale to be profitable. 

Thank you for all your help. 

You are a great addition to the company. 
Jane

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate and Commission Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Zoe, 

Could you estimate freight for 2,500MT from Maceió to Houston in late June/early July? Also, would you be willing to cover the 10% buyer's commission? 

Best, 
Aimee

email_chain.subject: Shipping Request for Petrochemicals
email_chain.body:

Please note that we want to ship 2,500MT of petrochemicals from Shanghai to San Juan. Please send your earliest laycan slot for loading and confirm your FOB terms and latest vessel laytime.

Thanks,
Seth

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request for Petrochemicals
email_chain.body:
Hi Seth,

If your goods have HS code 3004, we can offer 4 available slots for 3004 products as follows:

Feb 28-Mar 03
Mar 11-15
Mar 18-22
Mar 25-29

For FOB terms, we are open to discuss at commercial terms, but will need a tender with confidential shipping terms to verify if we can commit. Let me know which slot you want to take and if you need confidentiality.

Regards,
Andres

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request for Petrochemicals
email_chain.body:
Hi Andres,

I have some clarifying questions about your slot availability. My understanding is the following:

1) Your vessel can load 2,500MT of general cargo, including the 3004 cargo
2) Your vessel can make an East Coast USA call
3) Your vessel has laytime, i.e., 3 days of port time to load 2,500MT

Am I correct?

Thanks,
Seth

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request for Petrochemicals
email_chain.body:

Martha

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment from Yanbu to Cape of Good Hope
email_chain.body:
Morning Martha,

Unfortunately, we cannot take your methanol cargoes at the moment due to the COVID-19 situation. We are trying to arrange crew changes, but finding the correct timing and quarantine solutions is a challenge. Hopefully, we will be able to take cargoes before April. Sorry I cannot be of any help.

Kind regards,
Sven

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment from Yanbu to Cape of Good Hope
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

Thank you for your reply.

Have you changed your availability to take cargo at the beginning of April?

Best regards,
Martha

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment from Yanbu to Cape of Good Hope
email_chain.body:
Hello Martha,

Unfortunately, we have to cancel the methanol fixture to Cape Town. We are unable to take methanol cargoes due to crew changes and Coronavirus-related issues, so no availability to take your cargo. Sorry I cannot be of any help.

Kind regards,
Sven

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment from Yanbu to Cape of Good Hope

Dear Sven,

We received your latest email and apologize that you cannot assist us. We would be grateful if you could keep this information available for any future cargoes that we may need.

Many thanks,
Martha

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Second Shipment of Cotton
email_chain.body:
Hey Sam,

We are interested in the second shipment of cotton under a 50-ton container in direct sail from Santa Cruz to Newark. Will the new C/P apply the New Panama Canal toll?

Thanks,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Second Shipment of Cotton
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

Where can I find this 'new C/P' you mention? I have the latest canal treaty with me, it says nothing about a new C/P. Can you please clarify?

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Second Shipment of Cotton
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

I haven't seen anything in the canal treaty that mentions anything about a new C/P. In fact, nothing there at all about rates. It may have something about how the current method of charging is broken down. There is an addendum that you can find here: http://www.panamaxmaritime.com/AG/Panama%20Canal%20Tolls%20Agreement.pdf

Thanks,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Second Shipment of Cotton
email_chain.body:
Ian,

I suspect we will have to hire a cargo lawyer. I think you should make the accusation of discrimination then. See if the Secretary of State for Transport will provide a legal opinion. Or failing that, get a private firm to challenge the 'owners' of the canal in their own backyard. With a guaranteed doubling of the revenue, they should have no interest in the details.

As a minimum, get them to explain the 'adjusted and equitable tolls' arrangement.

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.body:

We are not familiar with cornstarch cargoes, so I don't know what to survey. I recommend that you try to find someone who handles cornstarch cargoes. Thanks for asking.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Battery Shipment
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Grain Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

I am enquiring as to your ability to transport grains from your Sydney port to ours in Seattle. We would want to use your containers to ship approximately 40,000 tons of grain.

Could you advise me of the approximate cost and timing of delivery? Could you also supply me with a copy of the relevant carriage conditions? Please also include a contact number, name, and fax number.

Thank you.

Regards,
Jill

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Slater,

Thank you for your enquiry on the transport of grains from Sydney to Seattle.

As you requested, I have enclosed a schedule and conditions of carriage.

The estimated cost for the shipment of 40,000 tons from Sydney to Seattle is as follows:

Container service: $55,000.00
Insurance of goods: $25,000.00
Total: $80,000.00

This total is for the cost of the shipping as well as for the cost of insuring the goods. For insurance purposes, we do need a complete list of the goods to be shipped, together with an approximate value of the goods and an approximate quantity. We can then insure these goods for a fixed price. To clarify, this does not include a freight charge; the freight charge is paid by you directly to the shipper.

The insurance company can then quote you for the insurance of the goods.

We use the following insurance company:
A Insurance
New York.

Also, the estimated time of arrival is 1 month from the date of departure.

If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Grain Shipment Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Slater,

Thank you for your request for a quote for shipping 40,000 tons of grains from Sydney to Seattle.

Unfortunately, we are unable to supply a firm price at this stage due to certain missing details. Specifically, the goods to be shipped are not specified, and no approximate value has been provided. Also, no fixed quantity has been advised.

Once you provide us with these details, we will be able to give you a firm price.

Please provide this information at your earliest convenience.

Regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Final Quote for Grain Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Slater,

We are pleased to advise you that we can offer you the shipping of 40,000 tons of grains from Sydney to Seattle.

The approximate cost of shipping the goods, inclusive of insurance, is $50,000. To ship these goods, a quantity must be specified.

Regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for LPG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good morning Peter,

It’s been a while, how’s everything going with you? I trust you’re still doing well on the ship, and I hope there are no problems! I’m really excited for your plans for the new year. I heard that you’re doing very well as the 2nd Officer on board your new vessel. Great work!

We’re sourcing a 2,500 MT shipment of LPG from Dalian to Fujairah. Do you have a vessel available that’s open in the next two weeks, and at what cost?

Kindly,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good morning Sarah!

Thanks for the email. We just came in from our shift, and we’re happy to hear from you. Please accept our apologies for the delay. We’re doing well on board. How about you? I heard that you just took a new job, congratulations!

I’m glad to hear about your plans for the new year. You’re looking to find a ship soon, right? We have a vessel that’s available from Dalian to Fujairah in two weeks. At what rate do you wish to move the cargo?

Regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good morning Peter!

Thanks for the response, we’re doing well on our end. How about yourself? I heard you just started a new job, congrats! We’re still looking for a vessel to transport the cargo. How soon do you wish to confirm the details?

Kindly,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good morning Sarah,

Thank you for the email. Sorry about the delay. How are you doing? I heard that you’re still looking for a new vessel to transport your cargo. Don’t worry about it, we understand. We’re very open for business. We’re actually available now if you can confirm your details by the end of the day.

Regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

We’re really excited for the news! We'll confirm the details shortly.

Kindly,
Sarah

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

Great, we need your quotation asap. I would need to know your costs for both modes of transport: Airfreight, Road, or Ocean freight, as our client is not sure which is best. Do you do full container loads only? Could you give us an idea of the cost for 100 pallets from the USA to Europe? Is the transportation cost including insurance and delivery to the factory door? We have very little time and need a prompt response. Please send an email with your rates and we will compare.

Many thanks,
AA
