email_chain.subject: Urgent Need for Dry-Bulk Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Chen,

We have an urgent need for a ship, 50,000 DWT size, with good dry-bulk and/or ore carrier experience for the transportation of between 20,000 and 25,000 MT of iron ore from Dampier to Yuan Island. Please confirm your vessel’s availability, draft, and size, and also the availability of existing ballast water. When can you have your vessel at sea, and does it accept 'dumping' of cargo in the event of a strike?

We would be most grateful if you could provide a detailed specification of your vessel, including crew, safety records, and insurance policy information, by 7th August.

We will contact you regarding further details after this date.

Yours faithfully,
Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Need for Dry-Bulk Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vernon,

Thank you for your enquiry.

We are pleased to inform you that we have an 87,000 DWT ocean-going ore carrier on our register. The vessel is 12 years old and has passed rigorous safety inspections. She has been chartered to an oil company for the past 3 months and is now available from 15th August.

In the event of a strike, the vessel has the capability of ‘dumping’ her cargo.

We would be most grateful if you would advise the load port, discharge port, estimated cargo quantity, loading time, and estimated number of loading/discharging crew.

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Yours faithfully,
Mr. Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Need for Dry-Bulk Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

Thank you for your swift reply.

With your permission, I enclose an outline of the proposed charter, which covers the period 10th September to 31st October 2011. In addition, I enclose a Letter of Inquiry, which we have requested from Dampier Iron Ore and from Port Walling.

I would be grateful if you would check these and advise on any corrections that you require.

I trust that the agreement will meet with your approval, and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Yours faithfully,
Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Need for Dry-Bulk Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Richard,

I have reviewed your letter, and I confirm that our vessel will be ready at sea by 15th August, so your preferred dates are acceptable. With regard to the charter, the only changes that I require are the amounts and unit prices for port, light, and insurance; and the percentage of each these that are to be deducted from the charter.

I trust that these amendments will be acceptable to you.

I will revert with confirmation and insurance policy documents once we have both agreed on the terms.

Yours faithfully,
Jin Jing

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Need for Dry-Bulk Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

The amendments to the charter agreement are acceptable to me. I enclose a signed copy of the charter agreement, together with a draft insurance policy.

I would be most grateful if you could confirm that the vessel is ready for loading by 17th August.

Yours faithfully,
Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for 1,100MT of Shoes
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Jones,

We are looking to ship 1,100MT of shoes from Rotterdam to Boston. Can you confirm your earliest available sail date, and can you let me know if you have a regular schedule?

Kind regards,
Anne

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 1,100MT of Shoes
email_chain.body:
Anne,

We would be happy to help with your shipment. Our regular weekly sailing is on the 23rd of the month. This shipment will sail on the 25th of March. Please confirm your delivery address and let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Don

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 1,100MT of Shoes
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

Yes, I think that works for us. The final destination for the goods will be Boston, MA. We will be clearing the goods through Port Newark, NJ.

Thank you for your help!
Anne

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Shipping to Boston, MA
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

I’m following up about the shipping to Boston, MA. I spoke with our customs broker who said they will need to ship from NJ. Can you let me know if that will be a problem?

Thanks,
Anne

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Shipping to Boston, MA
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

NJ is not a problem. The vessel leaves from Rotterdam, then stops in Houston and NJ, before going to Boston. The final destination for the cargo is Boston, and you will clear the cargo in Boston, so that is fine.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.
Don

email_chain.subject: Shipping Details for Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Anne,

The carrier for this shipment will be ZIM Lines. They will export from Rotterdam, and stop in Houston, before sailing to Boston. All shipments are delivered FCA (Free Carrier). This means the carrier will deliver the cargo at their warehouse in Rotterdam, from where you will be responsible for paying for the cargo and the customs duties. You will also be responsible for unloading the cargo, or arranging for that to be done.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.
Regards,
Ed

email_chain.subject: Quote Update for Your Shipment
email_chain.body:
Anne,

Can you please let me know if you have any questions about our quote? We’ve already run out of our weekly quota, so we will have to sell your cargo at market price.

Regards,
Don

email_chain.subject: Methanol Shipment to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hi Aziz,

Our vessel is scheduled to discharge 11,000MT of methanol in Saudi Arabia. Your FOB terms look promising; do you accept CIF terms as well? Also, are there any charges for net tankering?

Best,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hi Abhiraj,

Greetings from the sea.

Our agent in Saudi Arabia will handle the lift-booking and transport methanol from the Red Sea to Yanbu. In addition to your FOB price, are there any additional costs such as bunker charges?

Our priority is the safety of the cargo. However, in the unlikely case of any spillage, our liability will be limited to cleaning costs only. Can we discuss this further?

Yours,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hi Aziz,

Thank you for your swift response. However, the transit time from the Red Sea to Yanbu by road is 3 days, which has added considerably to our costs. We would like to work out a compromise to ensure that this cargo reaches Yanbu in the minimum possible time.

Best,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hi Abhiraj,

I have attached a CIF quote for your review.

Regards,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hi Aziz,

Thank you for the CIF quote. However, we prefer FOB terms.

Best,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hi Abhiraj,

We are also open to FOB terms.

Regards,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Chartering Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

We’d need to charter 35,000MT of iron ore from Korea to China. Could you confirm if your vessel can carry the required weight?

Regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Chartering Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Hi Frank, Sorry for the late reply. Yes, we can carry 35,000MT of ore from Korea to China. We have a team that is waiting to charter a vessel. Please share with us the details of the vessel so that we can see whether we can do the charter.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Chartering Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Scott,

I will reply with the details of the vessel.

Regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Chartering Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Hello Frank, The specifications are as follows:
Length: 164 meters
Width: 27 meters
Height: 11 meters
Cargo capacity: 7000MT
Additional details:
- Vessel was built in 1995
- It has been used for shipping raw materials
- It has 6 layers, which are lined with waterproof cloth and epoxy
Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Chartering Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We’re ready to charter our vessel for the shipping of iron ore from Korea to China. We’d like to charter your vessel for 10 days from September 5 to 14. During the charter period, the vessel will be carrying up to 35,000MT of iron ore from Korea to China. Our team will be available for consultation to discuss the terms of charter and address any questions that you may have.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Chartering Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Scott,

I have a question about the vessel. Can you tell me if there are any modifications that have been made to the vessel after it was first built in 1995?

Thanks,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Chartering Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Yes, there have been some modifications made to the vessel since it was built in 1995. The first modification was in 2010 when a new engine was installed. This new engine has increased the vessel’s cargo capacity to 7000MT and increased its efficiency. In 2017, the vessel underwent another modification in which its six layers were lined with waterproof cloth and epoxy. This modification has improved the vessel’s ability to carry cargo without leaking and increased its durability. We believe that these modifications have improved the vessel’s performance and made it a better choice for shipping iron ore.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Chartering Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Frank,

We are still interested in chartering your vessel for the shipping of iron ore from Korea to China. We’d like to charter your vessel for 10 days from September 5 to 14. During the charter period, the vessel will be carrying up to 35,000MT of iron ore from Korea to China. Our team will be available for consultation to discuss the terms of charter and address any questions that you may have.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Diesel Shipment from Odessa to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hello Max,
Your boat would be perfect for our jobs in August. Would you be interested in lifting 7,000MT of diesel from Odessa to Saudi Arabia at US$50 per metric ton?
Kindly,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment from Odessa to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Joe,
Are you asking me if I want to do the job or not? I will lift the diesel at US$75 per metric ton. I hope that is a more reasonable price. Please call me back so we can arrange.
Max

email_chain.subject: Final Offer for Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Joe,
US$75 is our final offer and we must close this deal in August. If we don't close by August, I can't guarantee this rate. We hope you will work with us.
Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Final Offer for Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
I'm sorry Max but we can't go any higher than US$60 per metric ton. Would you be interested in 10,000MT instead of 7,000?
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: Final Offer for Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Joe,
Are you insane? I will lose money if I lift at US$60 per metric ton.
Max

email_chain.subject: Urgent Cargo Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Phil,

Can you suggest any cargo in NY or NJ that we can ship to our Antwerp port this weekend? It’s for a client who is in a hurry.

Regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

We have received your enquiry and can confirm that we have a regular cargo out of Port Newark (New Jersey) this week which we would be happy to include your freight.

Here are the details:
- Departing on Tuesday 21st December.
- Collection of goods by 1200 hours Monday 20th December.
- Pickup from 1 Star. East Coast Express.
- Contact name is John.

For details regarding the vessel and sailing time, please contact Vanessa Stuart (081-7109099 or email vstuart@vohgroup.com).

If this is acceptable, please respond back to me via email as soon as possible. If you wish to discuss anything in more detail, please call.

Thank you for your enquiry.

Regards,
Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

I just need to confirm whether you are proceeding with the space for your cargo from New York on our vessel. We are collecting on 18th of October and departing the 19th, so would need a positive answer in the next few days so we can reserve space for you. Please advise.

Many Thanks,
Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

I am forwarding this email to John who is our contact with 1Star Express. If you can discuss direct with John and agree on a pickup date, that would be great.

Thanks,
Vanessa Stuart
Vice President
VOH Global Cargo Management, Dublin

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Request
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Vanessa was saying we are still waiting for confirmation of 18th of October for our collection in Newark, NJ. We would need a reply from you to let us know if that is OK or not. I’ll be out of the office on Friday but Vanessa can contact you if you can let us know by Thursday.

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

Thanks, we are ok for Monday the 18th. Is that still ok with you? We will collect the 17th at the latest if required.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Maersk confirms opening of new Singapore-Yantian-Busan-Vladivostok service
email_chain.body:
Hey Scott,

Happy to inform you that we have received the Maersk announcement on the new SINGAPORE - YANTIAN - BUSAN - VLADIVOSTOK service:

Opening to Busan and Vladivostok from Yantian. Direct Vladivostok import & export service. Full-weekly. Targeted to start May 2017.

Vessel: MV MAERSK SOUTH WALES.

The schedule is as follows:

YM - Yantian Wednesday port stay two days.
YB - Yantian Thursday port stay two days.
YS - Yantian Saturday port stay two days.
YV - Yantian Monday port stay two days.

Schedule to Busan and Vladivostok will be provided soon.

Best regards,
Maersk Team

email_chain.subject: Updated schedule for new YANTIAN - BUSAN - VLADIVOSTOK service
email_chain.body:
Dear Partners,

Thank you very much for your feedback regarding our new YANTIAN - BUSAN - VLADIVOSTOK service. The updated schedule is as follows:

YM - Yantian Wednesday port stay two days.
YB - Yantian Thursday port stay two days.
YS - Yantian Saturday port stay two days.
YV - Yantian Monday port stay two days.

Schedule to Busan and Vladivostok as shown on the file.

The first sailings for the new service will be:

YM - dep Yantian Wed 24/5 ETA Busan 31/5 ETA Vladivostok 05/06.
YB - dep Yantian Thu 25/5 ETA Busan 01/6 ETA Vladivostok 05/06.
YS - dep Yantian Sat 27/5 ETA Busan 03/6 ETA Vladivostok 07/06.
YV - dep Yantian Mon 29/5 ETA Busan 05/6 ETA Vladivostok 09/06.

Best regards,
Maersk Team

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Graphite, Leather, and Button Batteries
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Robertson,

Could you supply the following: 50MT of graphite, 40 pallets of leather, and 6,000 units of button batteries?

In what ports are you based? What are your freight rates, and could we have a couple of alternate port options?

Warm regards,
Luciana

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Graphite, Leather, and Button Batteries
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Bice,

We look forward to your reply.

We currently have the required inventory at our port of origin in Sydney, Australia.

Our shipping service is scheduled for this Friday (30th March), and the vessel arrives on the 5th of April.

As you have indicated the products we can dispatch straight to your preferred port.

However, in this instance, due to our contracts with major partners, we are obliged to transport our merchandise through our domestic port (and not your preferred port).

Your goods will therefore be transported to Melbourne and discharged at the port of Melbourne, Australia.

Your goods will arrive between 8-10 days from dispatch and can then be collected by yourselves.

Again we look forward to hearing from you in the next 48hrs so we can make the necessary arrangements to dispatch your order.

Best regards,
Fergus

email_chain.subject: Dispatch Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Luciana,

I would like to advise that as per our agreement with the company, we will be dispatching your order via the contracted port of Melbourne, Australia.

Please note that your products will not be available for collection until 8-10 days from dispatch, as this is the delivery time from the port of origin (Sydney) to the port of Melbourne.

We would greatly appreciate if you could also let us know when the delivery address is confirmed, so we can make the necessary arrangements.

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Fergus.

email_chain.subject: Re: Dispatch Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Fergus,

That's fine.

Our delivery address is:
31 Six Joes Street, Richmond

And can you let us know the estimated cost of transportation?

Best regards,
Luciana.

email_chain.subject: Shipment Update
email_chain.body:
Hi Luciana,

We can advise that our shipment has arrived and is currently being unloaded from the ship.

We are expecting the goods to be available for collection at the port sometime this afternoon.

If this is not possible please let us know if we can send you an update tomorrow.

Kind regards,
Richard

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Update
email_chain.body:
Hello Richard,

Thank you for confirming your delivery schedule.

Your shipment will be collected by our port forwarder as soon as it becomes available for collection.

We will let you know when the goods are delivered to our warehouse.

Best regards,
Luciana

email_chain.subject: Delivery Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Luciana,

We have arranged delivery to your address of:
31 Six Joes Street, Richmond

Please let us know if there are any problems receiving the goods.

Best regards,
Fergus

email_chain.subject: Merchandise Dispatch Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Paul,

We would like to advise that the required merchandise has been dispatched from the Port of Melbourne in Australia.

The goods were delivered to our warehouse on the 8th of March.

Please advise if you have any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Fergus

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Inquiry for Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body: We have a 4,500MT shipment of high-quality fuel ready to export from the Murmansk port. Can you provide a freight rate and advise your earliest available berth? Thanks, Marvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Marvin, Thank you for your email of 5th June. Our current rates (including all charges) for the carriage of fuel in bulk to the following ports are as follows (if you have other ports, please let me know): Murmansk Port, Russia - Hamburg, Germany - Rotterdam, Netherlands - Le Havre, France - Antwerp, Belgium (Main ports only) 3500 metric tonnes up to a maximum of 300 metres on 34,500 DWT tankers: €200 per metric ton 3,001 to 5,000 tonnes on tankers up to 23,000 DWT: €280 per metric ton 6,001 to 12,000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,000 DWT: €280 per metric ton 12,001 to 16,000 tonnes on tankers up to 50,000 DWT: €280 per metric ton Kind regards, Bryan

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Bryan, Many thanks for your quotation. It is a little too high. I am trying to find a carrier who can offer a more competitive rate. Can you please send me your best freight rate in bulk? I have found that another carrier has offered the following rates: Murmansk Port, Russia - Rotterdam, Netherlands 2001 - 10000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €218 per metric ton 10001 - 15000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €215 per metric ton 15001 - 20000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €213 per metric ton I hope you can assist. Kind regards, Marvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Marvin, Thank you for your email of 14th June. Our best rates on tankers up to 34,500 DWT for your shipment are as follows: Murmansk Port, Russia - Rotterdam, Netherlands 4,500 tonnes: €210 per metric ton Kind regards, Bryan

email_chain.subject: Freight Service Inquiry
email_chain.body: Please confirm the cost of this freight service for the shipment from Abidjan to Fort-de-France. Regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Service Inquiry
email_chain.body: Confirm the sending date and the base cost of the shipping from Abidjan to Fort-de-France. To make a cost calculation, it is necessary to know the dimensions and weight of the goods (package). Dear Sir, In reference to the subject, we ask you to send us the dimensions and weight of the goods to Abidjan, and the location of the delivery.

email_chain.subject: Shipping Information
email_chain.body: Attached, please find the following information to send us your offer for the shipping from Abidjan to Fort-de-France of goods located on board the M/V.

email_chain.subject: Shipment Offer Confirmation
email_chain.body: Dear Sir, We thank you for your email and your shipment offer for the shipping of goods located on board the M/V.

email_chain.subject: Contract Draft for Signing
email_chain.body: Dear Sir, In response to your request, we enclose the draft for the signing of this contract to ship goods located on board the M/V. If you agree with this proposal, kindly sign and return this draft without delay. We hope to have a quick reply from you. Please note that a business trip is required to take possession of the goods. In accordance with this contract, we take charge of the transportation of goods by sea from Abidjan to Fort-de-France of goods located on board the M/V.

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Contract
email_chain.body: Dear Sir, Thank you for your draft contract signed and returned to us. This means that you agree to ship your goods. This contract is henceforth between us. Please note that a business trip is required to take possession of the goods. In accordance with this contract, we take charge of the transportation of goods by sea from Abidjan to Fort-de-France.

email_chain.subject: Appreciation for Your Services
email_chain.body: You guys are like the backbone of this market. I'm so happy that we are trading with a company that's really good at it!

email_chain.subject: Interesting Trading Insights
email_chain.body: This post will be sent to one of my friends from NYC and to a couple of friends from England. Would you mind if I copied and pasted this to a couple of emails? No spam, just stuff you might find interesting. It's just really interesting.

email_chain.subject: Appreciation for Your Content
email_chain.body: I just wanted to let you know how happy I am that I found you. Now I don't have to scour the web to find solid stories, analysis, and humor. Your commentaries help me focus on the markets and do my own research. I just wanted to tell you how much I appreciate your hard work.

email_chain.subject: Appreciation for Your Readers
email_chain.body: I just wanted to let you know that you guys have the best readers around. Just after my last post was sent out, you guys...

email_chain.subject: Enjoying Your Content
email_chain.body: I'm not an investor, but I am a person who enjoys the information that you provide. I really appreciate the effort you put into your posts and the way you include different points of view. I hope that you are enjoying this post, and I hope that it's useful.

email_chain.subject: Thank You for the Information
email_chain.body: I really appreciate all the information you provide. I don't have the time to keep up with the news, so this helps me get the information that I need. Thank you again for this. I hope this post has been helpful.

[insert five (5) more price points that are current, as well as deals in a price range showing these are happening within the last month or so]

Regards,
Johannah Zabcjok

email_chain.subject: Re: FERT Price Update and Offer Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the update,

In reference to our email regarding our offer of 2780:

You confirmed to us that your sales team confirmed the deals in place were between 2845 to 2870 for the 1st of November delivery. Yet you are demanding we confirm our offer of 2770.

I am not sure why this is so, but it is clear to me the market price is closer to 2870. At this point, we would rather make our arrangements for 1st of Nov delivery at a time when we know the market has risen, rather than a time when it is sitting on its low.

But please advise what exactly you expect from us.

Sincerely,
Johannah Zabcjok

email_chain.subject: Long Time No See
email_chain.body:
Hey Mom,

It’s been 6 years since we saw each other. Are you still in Hong Kong? I am now a captain in the army. I can’t believe how fast the time has gone by.

email_chain.subject: Re: Long Time No See
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain Yang,

I was glad to get your email. Yes, I am still in Hong Kong, but I will be moving to Beijing soon. Please don’t worry. I am very well, and I hope you are as well. Now you can tell me about your life. Where are you stationed? And where are your wife and children? How old are they?

email_chain.subject: Re: Long Time No See
email_chain.body:
Hi Mom,

I am glad that you are still doing well. My family is fine. My children are getting bigger. My oldest is almost 6 years old, and my youngest is 4. I will have to wait a little longer until I can send you pictures of them. I am stationed near Guangzhou. My wife and I don’t see each other very often, so I guess you could say that we are basically divorced.

email_chain.subject: Re: Long Time No See
email_chain.body: Hi Captain Yang

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bayuk,

I’m seeking a vessel for 9,600MT of sugar from Nouakchott to Kotka. Could you advise me if your vessel is available at the end of September, and if so, how long your laytime is?

Thank you,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelly,

In response to your email regarding the sugar shipment to Kotka, we cannot start the sugar movement at the end of September. The vessel must be here by the 25th of August, otherwise there will be delays.

Kind regards,
Alasdair

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Alasdair,

1. Could you please confirm your position?
2. If you can start the load before the 25th of August, please indicate, because we don’t have any vessel yet.
3. How long do you need for the complete vessel loading?

Thank you,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Kelly,

1. My position is that we cannot start sugar movements before the 25th of August, so your vessel will have to be here before this date.
2. Please provide your owners’ vessel to fix this movement at the latest before the 25th of August, otherwise the loading won’t be possible and you will have to find another loading port.

Kind regards,
Alasdair

email_chain.subject: Media Reports and Market Impact
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

I am intrigued by the media reports that you are a potential buy for Chemical Inc. Do you have any comments on this story?

I would also appreciate it if you could forward me your internal report on the market impact of the U.S. falling price of naphtha.

Thanks!

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact
email_chain.body:
Hi Martin,

This has to be a joke. I don't know of any report that Chemical Inc. is a target for acquisition.

Best regards,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

No joke here, I just read in the news that "Chemical Inc. is reviewing its strategic alternatives". Does this mean that they are thinking of buying you?

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact
email_chain.body:
No worries Martin,

We are watching the market closely. The naphtha market is hard to predict. We are all at the mercy of OPEC production decisions. The question we are facing is whether we should buy long term or short term, or maybe even store.

What is your thinking on this?

Cheers,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

I am an external consultant for Chemical Inc. I am currently preparing a report on the impact of naphtha price movements and I would appreciate your comments on this. You can reply via email or phone me direct at (123) 456 789 and I will share it with my colleagues at Chemical Inc.

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Confidential Report

I have managed to get a draft copy of the report by the Chemical Inc. consultant on the naphtha market. I understand that this is a confidential document. Can you confirm that this is the case?

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Palm Oil Shipment from Bintulu to Tocumen
email_chain.body:
I’m interested in moving 5,000 tons of palm oil from Bintulu to Tocumen (Panama). Freight and laycan are negotiable, so please respond with an offer.
Best,
Monet

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Palm Oil Shipment from Bintulu to Tocumen
email_chain.body:
My name is Olga. I am the director of the international department in one of the exporting companies in Colombia. Our company is one of the biggest palm oil exporters in Colombia. This is the reason why I am writing to offer you the opportunity to be our agent for the deliveries of 5,000 tons of palm oil from Colombia to Tocumen (Panama).
If you are interested in cooperating with our company, we can sign the agency contract and begin the export-import operations right away.
I would like to know how much you charge for this kind of shipment as an agency commission.
Best regards,
Olga

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Agency Proposal
email_chain.body:
My name is Colibri. I am the manager of this company. I would like to confirm your interest in our proposal to be our agent in Panama for the delivery of 5,000 tons of palm oil to Tocumen airport.
As you asked, we are offering you to sign the contract in which you would receive a commission of $5 per ton.
After your response, I can arrange a video-conference to discuss all the details of the agreement and begin the operations right away.
Looking forward to your reply,
Colibri

email_chain.subject: Proposal for Palm Oil Shipment from Bintulu
email_chain.body:
Hi,
This is probably the most cost-effective way to sell our surplus palm oil to the buyer in Panama.
Our company has more than 100,000 tons of palm oil from Bintulu available, and we would like to sell the 5,000 tons to this buyer as well as the rest.
We are willing to give you $1 per ton of palm oil, which means that if you are able to sell the 5,000 tons at $9.95 per ton, you will earn $4.95 per ton.
Please let me know if you are interested.
Regards,
Ivan

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Vessel Availability
email_chain.body: Please confirm your vessel's availability for the above cargo. Include your draft requirements, the earliest date you can start loading, and your ETA at Casablanca. Thank you, Jane

email_chain.subject: Monthly Cargo Loading Forecast
email_chain.body: Our team is carrying out a month’s cargo loading forecast that will be circulated to all shippers the first week of January. If you have multiple vessels sailing within that period, please confirm the earliest expected sailing dates to avoid double booking. Best regards, Jane

email_chain.subject: Offer for Empty Containers
email_chain.body:
Good day Hong, 

Thank you for your offer to buy empty containers from us. Our containers are located in Aqaba, and our port of discharge is Tripoli. We believe the following offer will be of interest to you: 

2,000 x 20ft reefer - Free of Cost 

Please advise if the offer above is still available. Thank you. 

Regards, 
Ms. Banks 
HNB International LLC

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Empty Containers
email_chain.body:
Good morning Ms. Banks, 

Thank you for your email and inquiry. Are you a trading house or a trading firm? Have you ever traded with the Gulf region before? Have you ever bought containers from the Middle East? If you are serious about this business, I can invite you to become an agent of HNB International, LLC. As an agent of HNB, you will be reselling our products in your country, and we will be buying back from you for further reselling to your local customers or for re-exportation. All you need to do is to get your local bank to open an account for you, and we will be able to process your purchase order. I will be glad to process all the documents on your behalf to get the transaction started. Please advise me with this information, and I will forward the contract to you. 

Regards, 
Hong

email_chain.subject: Urgent Shipment of IT Equipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Mjönes,

We have two pallets of IT equipment that need to be moved from Stockholm to Oslo ASAP. The value of the goods is between $40,000 and $50,000. Could you arrange pickup in Stockholm on Monday and delivery in Oslo before Friday?

We look forward to working with you on this project.

Sincerely,
Ulf Vikman

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment of IT Equipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

Thank you for your response.

Our client needs to pick up the goods on Monday, but they want to ship the goods the same day (today). They want to have them delivered to them in Oslo by Thursday morning.

I hope this is not a problem for you. We need to confirm that this is possible by this evening.

Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment of IT Equipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Mjönes,

Yes, we can deliver the goods on Monday morning. We can pick them up at your office in Stockholm this afternoon.

You may not need this, but our client also requires a clean bill of lading.

Let us know if this meets your needs.

Thank you for your business.

Sincerely,
Ulf Vikman

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment of IT Equipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

That is perfect. You are in luck, as our client needs a clean bill of lading.

We would like to send you the bill of lading this evening. Can you arrange the pickup with our client tomorrow?

I think our client will be at the warehouse from 8 AM to 6 PM tomorrow. Is that acceptable to you?

Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment of IT Equipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

My colleagues and I just reviewed the bill of lading. We noticed that it was missing our address. We need to make sure that the address on the bill of lading is correct.

Can you check it and make sure it is correct?

Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment of IT Equipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

Thank you for your help.

I spoke to my colleagues and we all agree that the address on the bill of lading looks right. Can you please check your end and make sure that the address matches your files?

Let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.body: Thanks for your reply, Ms. Jenkins. Greatly appreciate it. We’re now expecting the vessel to be ready around the 7th of May, so as per your quotation, we’ll need a rate of $95/MT to reach Mersin from Damieta. Please let us know if you can confirm. Thanks again, Jon

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Vessel Readiness and Rate
email_chain.body: Thank you, Jon. I’d like to clarify that it will be a multi-user bill of lading. With that in mind, you are aware that you will need to take care of shipping marks as well as the delivery terms. A. Full clean fuel to the spec of EN590. B. Quantity. C. The port of loading. D. The port of discharge. E. The latest receiving vessel’s ETA. F. The final quantity as agreed upon. G. The final date and the day of loading. H. Terms of payment. Please, send the bill of lading with the terms of payment and the actual date of loading. Also, as per the agreement, we’ll be paying your company once you send the official signed bill of lading. So,

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Vessel Readiness and Rate
email_chain.body: Right, thanks for the clarification.

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Vessel Readiness and Rate
email_chain.body: Excellent, thank you for your confirmation. As we previously agreed, we’ll be paying you once we receive the vessel’s draft survey from your vessel’s captain as we need this document for the custom’s clearance procedure. This will be done via Western Union. Our CEO’s email is

email_chain.subject: Shipment Inquiry for August
email_chain.body:
Hey Jake, 
We’re looking to pick up 20,000MT from Sumatra to Suez around August. Can we have a four-week laycan, starting 1st August? Any ideas about freight and duration of voyage? 
Regards, 
Stanley

email_chain.subject: Invitation for Iron Ore Transport Offers
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Steffes, 
Our Hamburg South America Line was approached by your agents E & T Group to transport iron ore from Indonesia to South America. You are hereby invited to send your offers for the transport of 20,000mt of iron ore, with a laycan from 1st August to the beginning of September. 
The main characteristics are as follows: 
- The load will be from the Sumatra region 
- The cargo will be iron ore of Fe 62% 
- The discharge port is to be selected and confirmed by the buyer 
Please send all offers on a non-negotiable basis (ex works) in USD based on the FOB Hamburg price of iron ore (i.e., US$78/mt). For the selected shipping line, please send the freight and sailing costs in USD (ex works). 
Regards, 
Hamburg South America Line

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Inquiry for August
email_chain.body:
Sorry for the delay in getting back to you. We’ve been dealing with an issue concerning the vessels’ bills of lading. 
I understand your cargo will be subject to an inspection at the port of discharge. Since this is out of our control, you should contact your broker or agent to determine the inspection’s requirements, including duration and time of day for the inspection. The bill of lading, while you were out, contained a statement stating we were responsible for the inspection's duration. We subsequently deleted that paragraph. 
We understand your client will be taking full responsibility for their merchandise at the port of discharge. Therefore, they should assume responsibility for ensuring that their merchandise clears customs. We understand that you are working with our agent at the port of discharge to file the necessary documents to clear the cargo. However, if you encounter any problems, please feel free to contact us. 
Regards, 
Jake

email_chain.subject: Update on Discharge Port and Bill of Lading
email_chain.body:
I hope you’re well. 
The client has changed the discharge port from Hamburg to Antwerp, Belgium. Unfortunately, we had to sign a bill of lading without notifying you because the cargo was already on board and sailing. We will now follow your advice and contact our agent at the port of discharge to make sure all of the necessary documents are filed in order to clear the cargo. 
As requested, I will also forward a copy of the bill of lading to you and hope to have a firm confirmation of the inspection schedule for the cargo. 
Regards, 
Stanley

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Cargo Clearance and Inspection
email_chain.body:
Hi Stanley, 
We have received confirmation from our agent in Antwerp that the necessary documents have been filed and the cargo is cleared. 
The inspection should start tomorrow morning, beginning at 9 am. 
I will forward a copy of the bill of lading to you as soon as possible. 
Regards, 
Jake

email_chain.subject: Re: Logistics Contact for Milled Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Friends,

Terry

email_chain.subject: Re: Logistics Contact for Milled Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: Logistics Contact for Milled Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
James has forwarded me your email and I see that you're contacting me regarding our logistics. We are considering moving a rice product of 8,400MT from Narita, Japan to Tandag, Davao and were wondering if you can help us with this matter.

Our load will be arriving around May 22nd 2014 and the destination will be Tandag, Davao. We can have an officer at the airport as well for unloading purposes. We are considering unloading at Tandag Airport itself and sending the load to various ports where our clients are.

Can you kindly advise us on:
1) Unloading charges at the airport
2) Port selection for the delivery of the products
3) Cost of hiring a truck

Do you have an email address that I can reach you at?

Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Container Shipping Investments
email_chain.body:
Hello Sir,

Do you think a big container ship will be built in China? Is it better to own a small ship or to own an interest in a large container ship?

Thank you,
Andre

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Container Shipping Investments
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Since my last letter, I have been reading a book on the Container Shipping Business and have a lot of ideas. Here is one of them: Will a large container ship be built in China? Is it a good investment to own a small container ship or to own an interest in a large ship? I believe that the container shipping industry will get better and better. At this time, the shipping market is very strong.

Here is the conclusion:
It is better to own a small container ship than to own an interest in a large container ship. We should stick to our belief.

Thank you,
Andre

email_chain.subject: Further Thoughts on Container Shipping Investments
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Since my last letter, I have been reading a book on the Container Business and understanding the idea. After a lot of thinking, I found a logical solution. It is better to own a small container ship than to own an interest in a large container ship. That is the truth. We can be more stable in the long run.

Please do not forget what I have said. I am waiting for your reply.

Thank you,
Andre

email_chain.subject: Urgent Shipment Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Abdullah, Could you please take the following materials from Jeddah to Port Said on short notice? 
1. 100,000MT of 92-octane gasoline
2. 1,500MT of wax
3. 500MT of acetone
And would your demurrage rate be lower after 60 days of laytime?
Thanks,
Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Ramesh, Our present demurrage rate is 14,000 Saudi Riyals per day. This rate is reduced to 10,000 Saudi Riyals per day after 30 days of laytime. Your case falls in this category. I will arrange for the chartering.
Thanks and regards,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Change of Discharge Port
email_chain.body:
Can you please deliver the shipment to Tehran?
Thanks,
Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Discharge Port
email_chain.body:
Of course. I will give you a price for transshipment on short notice. Can you please clarify if you will need any ocean freight services as well?
Thanks,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Discharge Port
email_chain.body:
Yes. Please send us your quotation for both ocean freight and transshipment.
Thanks,
Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Discharge Port
email_chain.body:
OK. The total price for ocean freight and transshipment is 200,000 Saudi Riyals. Is this acceptable?
Thanks,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Discharge Port
email_chain.body:
It is too high. Please get back to me in 12 hours with a lower price.
Thanks,
Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Discharge Port
email_chain.body:
OK. I have brought the price down to 150,000 Saudi Riyals. Please confirm your acceptance by Monday night.
Thanks,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Discharge Port
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your help. I have accepted your offer of 150,000 Saudi Riyals.
Thanks,
Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Discharge Port
email_chain.body:
Thank you very much. I am waiting for the funds to be sent. Please keep me informed about your progress.
Thanks,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Discharge Port
email_chain.body:
Yes, of course. The transaction will take one week. I have asked the bank to keep me informed about the transaction status.
Thanks,
Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Options

email_chain.subject: Rate Request for Polymer Shipment
email_chain.body: I hope this email finds you well. We need to ship some polymers from Rotterdam to Mexico City at the beginning of August. Could you please send us a rate? Best regards, Thor

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request for Polymer Shipment
email_chain.body: Anne-Marie, I found another company offering sea transport from Rotterdam to Mexico City. Do you think you can still beat their rate? Best regards, Thor

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request for Polymer Shipment
email_chain.body: Hello Thor, Our estimate will give you the exact rate based on the pickup and delivery dates being the same and the amount of goods shipped being 50 CBM. If your pickup date is July 10, 2017, and the delivery date is July 20, 2017, with the amount of goods shipped being 25 CBM, an extra cost will apply. Our company charges $0.05 per CBM per day, so the extra cost is $25 (25 CBM * $0.05 per CBM per day * 20 days). Regards, Anne-Marie

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request for Polymer Shipment
email_chain.body: Hello Anne-Marie, Do you have experience in moving polymers? Is your quote correct? What is your contact information? Regards, Thor

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request for Polymer Shipment
email_chain.body: Hello Thor, our quote is correct. We have been moving polymers for many years. My contact information is below. Contact: Anne-Marie, Cellphone: 314 567 345, Email: anne-marie@example.com

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request for Polymer Shipment
email_chain.body: Hello Anne-Marie, I understand that your move is in August, not July. We can make changes to our quote for you. Best regards, Thor

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request for Polymer Shipment
email_chain.body: The quote you gave is for July 10-20. Can you give me a new quote? Our quote is the same for the whole month of August. If the extra charge is high, you can use two shipping dates. Regards, Anne-Marie

email_chain.subject: Laycan Slots for July - Crude Palm Oil from Medan to Manila
email_chain.body:
Hi Marco,

Quick question: any laycan slots left in the first week of July for 9,500MT of crude palm oil from Medan to Manila? Also, what daily demurrage rate are you proposing?

Best,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Laycan Slots for July - Crude Palm Oil from Medan to Manila
email_chain.body:
Hi Tom,

There are no slots in the first week of July for 9,500 MT from Medan to Manila.

However, there are slots in the second week of July for 9,500MT of crude palm oil from Medan to Manila. The demurrage rate is $100 per day, but we can negotiate for $70 per day.

How about the week of July 10?

Best,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: Laycan Slots for July - Crude Palm Oil from Medan to Manila
email_chain.body:
Hey Marco,

I will double-check with the charterers tomorrow and let you know.

You don’t mention in your offer who the cargo is consigned to and whether it will be bunkered on board the vessel. You also don’t mention if the cargo is new or residue and whether it is clean or oil-contaminated.

Best,
Tom

Anne Jackson

Jim Cox

Thank you for your email. As I said before, I cannot confirm the quantity. Please see my remarks below:

Yours sincerely,
Anne Jackson

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Vessel Availability for Scrap Metal Shipment to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rudolph,

Our customer has instructed us to ship 1,800MT of scrap metal to China. Could you kindly confirm if you have any available vessels to take the cargo next week?

Regards,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Introduction to New Business Partner
email_chain.body:
Hi Chris,

I hope you are well. I am writing to introduce a new business company with which I have a strong relationship. They offer a variety of shipping services, including containers on charter, reefer containers, and trailers, as well as dry containers of all types and sizes for worldwide transport.

Additionally, they provide new and used shipping containers for sale and rent. Below are some types of shipping containers they offer:

- 20' Standard Dry Container
- 20' High Cube Dry Container
- 20' High Cube Flat Racking Container
- 20' High Cube Open Top Container
- 20' Standard Open Top Container
- 20' High Cube Refrigerated (reefer) Container
- 20' Standard Reefer Container
- 20' Standard Folding Car Container
- 20' Standard Lashing Bars Container
- 20' High Cube Lashing Bars Container

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability for Scrap Metal Shipment to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rudolph,

I need to confirm if the vessel which arrived first will cost 18 million naira due to the delivery delay. Can you also confirm how many containers will be loaded on this vessel?

Regards,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability for Scrap Metal Shipment to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

Please kindly advise on the following:
1. How many days did it take for the ship to return?
2. What was the length of the trip?
3. What kind of vessel did you charter?
4. What is the vessel name?
5. What is the ETA of the vessel?
6. What is the arrival time?
7. How many days will the vessel be delayed?
8. What will be the delay charges?
9. Which port will the vessel anchor to after discharging the last cargo in the Philippines?
10. What is the approximate duration it will take the vessel to reach our port?
11. What was the voyage of the vessel?
12. What is the gross weight?
13. What is the name of the shipping company?
14. What is the flag?
15. What is the LCR?

Best regards,
Rudolph

email_chain.subject: Request for Tank Cleaning Services
email_chain.body: Dear Shipping Manager, I am writing to inquire about tank cleaning services for 20,000MT of feed oil. Our product is being delivered from our facility in Houston, Texas. Please let me know if you can assist with this request. Best regards, John Doe.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Tank Cleaning Services
email_chain.body: Dear John Doe, Thank you for your inquiry. Can you confirm if you can provide a 5-day notice in Rotterdam? Please send me the last 3 months' pricing for tank cleaning and container shipping. Also, let me know if you have another location in Rotterdam where I could receive shipments. Regards, Shipping Manager.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Tank Cleaning Services
email_chain.body: Dear Shipping Manager, Thank you for your prompt response. Please send me the last 3 months' pricing for tank cleaning services. Regards, John Doe.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Tank Cleaning Services
email_chain.body: Dear John Doe, What are the main services provided by Port Authority? Are there any specialized containers which need to be taken on board when carrying hazardous goods? Can you please let me know what duties the ship's crew perform during customs clearance? What is the process for trans-shipping of cargo from a container ship to an FEU? Regards, Shipping Manager.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Tank Cleaning Services
email_chain.body: Dear Shipping Manager, What do the markings on a ship's hull mean? Do you know any US-based ocean liner companies? Where can I find the IGS code for RPD/CFL, and the latest data for gasoil for the last 12 months? What is the difference between a seaman and a deckhand? Where can I find an average salary per year for each position? Is there a difference between a tank cleaner and a ship cleaner? Why are containers important to the maritime industry? How does the tidal window work? Regards, John Doe.

email_chain.subject: Vessel Requirement for Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Amanda,

We’re looking for a vessel to take 1,000MT of methanol from New Orleans to Hong Kong. How does your laycan fit our 20-day laycan, and is it possible to have a split discharge?

All the best,
Pete

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Requirement for Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Pete,

Sounds good! How about two trips 1,000MT each on a 10-day laycan, and a split discharge? 65-35 either way. 65% should be on the North American Coast, 35% can be discharged in Hong Kong or Japan.

Let us know!
Amanda

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Requirement for Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Amanda,

So on the first voyage, it would be 65-35 delivery, and then for the second voyage it would be 35-65. Does this sound good to you?

All the best,
Pete

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Requirement for Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Pete,

Perfect! I will send the fixture confirmation now.
Amanda

email_chain.subject: Self-Driving Car Project Clarification
email_chain.body:

Thanks,
Hanan

email_chain.subject: Dataset Decomposition Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Hanan,

Let me make sure I'm understanding your request correctly. Are you asking us to decompose two decades of dataset into a more manageable number of, say, three to four decades, so that I can apply this new algorithm to the entire dataset with more manageable storage?

I'm not quite sure what you mean by 'decompose the first 10 years,' but I'll guess that you are asking to compress the first 10 years of data down to a smaller amount. If that is your request, I'll note that the changes in the dataset have slowed considerably, so I would expect that the 11th decade would have a smaller compression than the 10th decade. Is that your intent?

Thanks,
Ben

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Detained Cargo in Liberia
email_chain.body: Greetings! My name is Mary Wells. As a financial advisor to the Wilson family, I am pleased to introduce this matter to you, especially since you have proven your ability to carry out your operations without much delay. I wish to inform you that the personal effects of my clients, Mrs. Glenda Wilson and Mr. Michael Wilson, were loaded onto your vessel named MT “” and shipped from Southampton to Monrovia, Liberia, dated 10th May 2008. I wish to inform you that the goods, which comprise one Rolls Royce and four pieces of household goods, have been detained by the Liberian authorities for the past three years as they claim that the customs documents were not properly filled. This has forced Mrs. Glenda and Mr. Michael Wilson to incur huge demurrage and storage fees which they cannot afford to pay now.

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body: Thanks for your email and apologies for my delay in replying. I don’t think that there is an issue with the cargo in Liberia; it is no longer onboard the vessel, but I have sent you a scan of a document from the shipping line saying that they can assist with releasing the cargo. It’s my feeling that there is a bureaucratic delay in Liberia and you might have to employ a solicitor to assist. Do you have any ideas about that? Best regards, Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Detained Cargo in Liberia
email_chain.body: Ah yes, that explains a lot. We’ve not got any vessels at present. Sorry. Regards, Steve

email_chain.subject: Next Steps for Cargo Release in Liberia
email_chain.body: I have some information for you regarding what I’m sure will be your next job. You need to visit Liberia. I’ve made an arrangement with the Liberia International Trade and Transportation Secretariat to assist you with the release of the cargo. I’ll send you a document of authority signed by the director of the importation department at the customs department of Liberia. Do you have a representative there who will be able to pick it up on your behalf? If not, let me know and I’ll contact the Liberian secretary. Don’t worry about the rest, I’ll handle it. Regards, Steve

email_chain.subject: Cargo Ready to Load in Rotterdam

Dear Mr. Wickramaratne,

I’m with Man Industries Limited, a supplier of 1,450MT’s of baking soda to Sri Lanka. I’m writing to inform you that my client is looking to ship the aforementioned cargo from Colombo, Sri Lanka.

In my previous letter, I mentioned that they were looking for a shipping company to transport the cargo from Colombo, Sri Lanka to Busan, Korea. I have a proposal from a US company but the FOB price is quite steep. My client has told me to speak to local shipping companies in Colombo and I was wondering if you could offer them a more cost-effective solution?

As always, it would be a pleasure to do business with you.

Kind Regards,
David Young
Manager, Man Industries Limited

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Bluth,

We have 100 tons of LPG to ship from Bahrain to Cairo, Egypt. We are interested in your available 25,000DWT vessel and would like to discuss laycan and ETA. We would also like to know whether the goods are dirty or clean.

Thank you,
Sophie

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Mr. Bluth,

Thank you for your reply. Can you please send an estimated FOB price and any additional information you might have about laycan, ETA, and IFO price? We would like to discuss this shipment, although we might not need it as soon as you mentioned. But we could also be interested in the earlier date, so please send more details.

Thank you,
Sophie

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Hello Sophie,

Can you please share the material specification? The general rule is to ask for all the details required to take an offer. This way, you will reduce the time spent on exchanges, and you will know whether you will be interested in that opportunity.

Thank you,
Mr. Bluth

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Ms. Sophie,

Thank you for your reply. We have the following specification: C3+ Headings 2711, 2712, 2903, 2905, 290.

Thank you,
Mr. Bluth

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your offer. Please, add the insurance amount, insurance rates, and freight charges.

Thank you,
Sophie

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
We would like to offer you a price of $100,000 as 5% deposit and $95,000 as 95% L/C at sight, plus $3,000 as insurance. Please note that we do not include the freight charge in our offer because the shipper is responsible for it.

Thank you,
Mr. Bluth

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

We’d like to ship 300MT of caprolactum from Cotonou to Dover. Could you suggest if after-hours berthing is available and if we could load on a vessel berthed at a berth located in the South Container Terminal?

Regards,
Pauline

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Thanks Pauline,

I checked the schedules and I think you mean the Commodore. This is our weekly spot cargo service, loading containers for France.

The Commodore berths at the South Container Terminal but we can't berth there this week. There are no slots available and the berths have to be occupied in a particular order.

South Container Terminal berths are occupied in this order: 5, 1, 2, 4, 7, 3, 6.

This week we have the Commodore coming in from Kingston on Wednesday. This is the first available berth for that vessel so we are expecting her to be berthed at 6 South. The ship is due to sail to Cherbourg on Friday night.

I hope this helps.

Regards,
Geraldine

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Berth Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

Could we get more details of the available berths next week?

Regards,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: Bulk Cargo Loading
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

We will need some bulk cargo loading in the next few days. Could we get some advice as to which berths will be free next week?

Thanks,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Berth Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

Do you know which berth and slot the next Commodore is going to berth? We've had cargo arriving and other cargo waiting for loading so we could try and get an early booking.

Regards,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: Current Flat Situation
email_chain.body:
Deidra,

I thought it would be useful to start a dialogue about the current flat situation. Do you agree that January levels are unsustainable and, if so, what will it take to increase business?

With best regards,
Teo

email_chain.subject: Re: Current Flat Situation
email_chain.body:
Teo,

I cannot say more at this point. However, I know that we could start a conversation by considering reducing prices to the point where we could generate a large volume of business again. What do you think about it?

With best regards,
Deidra

email_chain.subject: Re: Current Flat Situation
email_chain.body:
Teo,

I am not against the idea but I need to be convinced that it is good for the business in the long term. Anyway, I know that January levels are unsustainable and it is better to consider reducing prices and increase the volume of business rather than going down the road of layoffs.

With best regards,
Deidra

email_chain.subject: Re: Current Flat Situation
email_chain.body:
Teo,

Let us continue our conversation to define together what our level of business in the short and long term would be in a scenario of sustained price reduction. What is your current opinion on that point?

With best regards,
Deidra

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation on Steam Coal Shipment
email_chain.body: Could you provide us with the best rates for a 150MT shipment of steam coal to Tocopilla, Chile? Please include a complete quotation with all freight, brokerage, storage, and other relevant charges. Regards, Jon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation on Steam Coal Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Jon, I am Duglas Brown, director of Romco Mining Ltd. Romco is involved in the mining and export of several types of coal from different regions of the world. Our requirements for steam coal are as follows: Sulphur 1.5% max, Calorific Value 6,000 kcal/kg min, Ash Content 15% max, Moisture Content 5% max, Volatile Matter 23% max, Other Minerals 18% max, Fines 5% max. With these quality standards, our coal will be competitive in any market. Please send us your price per ton CIF to the port of Antofagasta. We will review it and get back to you. Best regards, Duglas Brown

email_chain.subject: Invitation to Visit Our Website
email_chain.body: Dear Jon, We look forward to seeing your offers. In the meantime, we invite you to visit our website for more details about our company, subsidiaries, and staff. You can also take a virtual tour of our mining and processing facilities. Our website has been recently updated and optimized for mobile phones. Regards, Ron Skye

email_chain.subject: Re: Invitation to Visit Our Website
email_chain.body: Dear Ron, I have reviewed your site. It’s very impressive and the navigation is convenient. The layout is intuitive and well-organized. I especially liked the Product section with detailed coal quality data and the Quality section with standards. The Health and Safety and Environment sections show your commitment to improving worker conditions and ensuring safety. The Visual Tour is also very informative. Could you please send us the prices and complete specifications of your product? Regards, Jon

email_chain.subject: Re: Invitation to Visit Our Website
email_chain.body: Dear Jon, We are unable to meet your request. Please check other offers. Regards, Ron Skye

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Absence of 18% Other Minerals
email_chain.body: Hello Ron, Could you please tell me more about the absence of 18% other minerals in your product? Best regards, Romco Mining Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Shipment of Motors from Singapore to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Batra, 
We expect to ship 3,000MT of motors from Singapore to Colombo by April 1st. Would your vessel be available for a short-term voyage, and are you flexible on ballast condition? 
Best regards, 
Ernest

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Motors from Singapore to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ernest, 
The 'Coastline' is currently berthed at Kakinada on the Indian coast and I expect to receive her draft survey report on or about the 25th. Her charterers are currently assessing the bunkers required by the vessel for Singapore. However, we may be able to depart the previous fixture for Singapore as early as the 26th of March. 
As far as ballast conditions are concerned, your charterers could also try 'Coastline's' current charterers (i.e., 'Sambalino' of the same owners) as they will be arriving from a short haul fixture at the moment and may be in a position to proceed immediately to the loading port in ballast. Alternatively, you may wish to proceed ballast and obtain fuel in advance of loading. 
Any more information you require, please feel free to contact me on the below. 
Best regards, 
Mr. Batra

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Motors from Singapore to Colombo
Re: Shipment of Motors from Singapore to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Batra, 
Thank you for sending the Sambalino draft survey. I am pleased to inform you that Sambalino would arrive in 6 days. Please revert for further details. We are expecting to send the draft survey of the Coastline shortly. 
Best regards, 
Ernest

email_chain.subject: RE: Charter of Vessel

Vidyasagar

email_chain.subject: Offer for Oil Shipment from St. Petersburg to Ankara
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ahmed,

I'm writing on behalf of Mr. Kane to offer our tender and services to ship your oil from St. Petersburg to Ankara. We have extensive experience handling similar loadings within the specified time frame. Please see below for our best offer:

Date of Shipment: 15.06.2021
Product: M-1000
Origin: St. Petersburg, Russia
Destination: Ankara, Turkey
Quantity: 55,000 MT
Payment Terms: CIF + HLD
Payment Mode: 20% IFT / 80% TT

Our offer is valid until 05.06.2021. If you would like to discuss this further, please don't hesitate to call or reply to this email.

Best regards,
Felix

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Oil Shipment from St. Petersburg to Ankara
email_chain.body:
Dear Felix,

Thank you for your email dated June 15, 2021.

We have a long-standing relationship with your company and greatly appreciate your work with us.

We can confirm that you are among our preferred shippers. Please feel free to submit a quote.

Kindest regards,
Ahmed

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Oil Shipment from St. Petersburg to Ankara
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ahmed,

We are happy to submit a quote for you. We have been transporting gasoline to St. Petersburg for over 6 years and have extensive experience with the Russian bureaucracy. Please see below for our best offer:

Date of Shipment: 15.06.2021
Product: M-1000
Origin: St. Petersburg, Russia
Destination: Ankara, Turkey
Quantity: 55,000 MT
Payment Terms: CIF + HLD
Payment Mode: 20% IFT / 80% TT

We can also ship your cargo to Dammam or Bandar Abbas, if that is preferable.

Please confirm the validity of this offer, and we will draw up the contract.

Best regards,
Felix

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Aluminum Billets Shipment

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Aluminum Billets Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Gert,

We were informed that the ship that went to Karachi in mid-April was the 5000MT Midas Glory, owned by ICB. After a short delay, they loaded 6 x 50MT billets.

If you want, we can assist you to load this cargo on a ship that is due to sail from Port Klang in May. We can also supply you with your bunker, provisions, and ship's stores. Please check out our website at: http://www.singarama.com.sg or send me an email with the details of the cargo and ship, and we can get back to you.

Regards,
Susan

For your convenience, we have also included a scanned copy of the email for your records. The document was received via e-mail and is an exact copy of the original.

Xander

The buyer agrees to FOB at USD 11,375.68. We can offer CIF for USD 13,513.55. The buyer also wishes to increase the quantity to 8,000 metric tons. Please confirm the laycan extension.

Thanks Liz, I will confirm the CIF and laycan extension with the supplier.

Xander

email_chain.subject: Sailing Issues
email_chain.body:
Respected all,

Sometimes we are not getting good sailings of our vessels due to tonnage/delivery date issues. What should we do in such circumstances? It is important to send our vessels on voyages or in case of problems related to cargo, it is better to keep vessels waiting for best tonnages/best delivery. Please also let me know your experience in this regard.

Regards,
Dinesh Kumar

email_chain.subject: Re: Sailing Issues
email_chain.body:
Dear Dinesh,

The vessel broker with insurance company underwriter with another insurance company on 11/19/06 was not expected to work with the cargo owner, so after prepay, IMO charges are included.

Regards,
Team

email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Our ship is berthed at SOHAR for discharging cargo of urea and in a few hours, the cargo is going to be discharged and we are approaching for next cargo. If there is any inquiry regarding any cargo from your side please let me know your proposal.

We are ready to carry any type of cargo as per vessel strength and with 40 days in ballast.

You are requested to send any cargo to the owner's email, meaning it will be taken care of by the owner and it is the owner's responsibility to carry any type of inquiry on that cargo to the vessel. Please advise accordingly.

Kindly note that under above circumstances it will save lots of money which is spent on agency for discharging cargo in the port.

Regards,
Muthiah Singh

email_chain.subject: Closing Balance and Vessel Position
email_chain.body:

We've checked about the closing balance but unfortunately it is not there anymore. We were sure that it was there as we did it some days ago. Our manager is not in the office right now.

90W/00N
Course: 290T
Speed: 12.1 knts

Please advise.

Vessel 24

email_chain.subject: Negotiation for Cargo on DFRA Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cullen,

I am sorry that we didn't find a solution for the cargoes on the DFRA vessels. I understand that if my offer of $5.25 is not satisfactory, then a freight should be negotiated at the price of an alternative vessel. I look forward to hearing your proposal.

Many thanks,
Ed Brown

email_chain.subject: Re: Negotiation for Cargo on DFRA Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brown,

We regret that DFRA was not able to fulfill the commitment given to you by the master of the sea-going DFRA and express our sympathy at the difficulties this must have caused for your company. If you would like to enter into discussions for a future contract, we will gladly take this up with you. If you need some payment for the cargoes already on board, this may be possible. We regret this will not be possible at a higher rate than the rate quoted for the passage itself, i.e., $5.25. We await your instructions.

With best wishes,
John Cullen

email_chain.subject: Re: Negotiation for Cargo on DFRA Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cullen,

I understand that it will not be possible at a higher rate than the rate quoted for the passage itself, i.e., $5.25. However, I thought I would ask anyway. We just found out that we are in serious financial trouble. We will be lucky to make payroll next week. I am hoping that you will be able to find it in your heart to show some mercy. We know you have so much money. You see, you need to trust us. We can do this. We will find a way. Please let us use your ship. We’ll pay back the money once we have time to figure it out. But you need to help us out. Thank you for your time. We know you will be able to make the best decision possible.

Best regards,
Ed Brown

email_chain.subject: Re: Negotiation for Cargo on DFRA Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brown,

I’m sorry to hear that you’re in trouble. However, I’m not able to help you. The rules are strict and this is what is written in the contract. I hope you will be able to make payroll somehow.

Best regards,
John Cullen

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Freight Shipping
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

I am looking to transport 45,000 kg of high-density polyethylene pellets from Mumbai to Miami. Could you kindly let me know if your vessel is available and provide a freight quote based on CFR terms?

Regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Freight Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

I have a question regarding your services in transport logistics. Do you have experience moving materials across the world using freight? I'd love to know more about your freight shipping rates and if you offer international or domestic services. Additionally, I'd like to know if you've ever delivered large items like a truck or a ship, as this is something I'm interested in learning more about. If so, please let me know if you can provide international shipping services and your freight shipping rates.

Looking forward to hearing back from you,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

I was just wondering if you could provide me with more details about your shipping services? Specifically, I'm curious about your pricing for international shipments and if you have any special deals or discounts available. I'm also interested in learning more about the availability of your vessels and if you can provide real-time tracking information.

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Shipment of Refined Petrol from Fujairah to Durban
email_chain.body: I'm arranging to ship 7000MT of refined petrol from Fujairah to Durban, for 10 March. Could you confirm your ETA for Durban? Regards, Rudi

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Refined Petrol from Fujairah to Durban
email_chain.body: Hi Rudi, thanks for the offer. Unfortunately, we are no longer in a position to offer our services. Kind regards, Peter

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Payment and Service
email_chain.body: A short while ago you offered to carry goods on my behalf to Durban, and I was to pay you US$2800. I did pay, but have never heard from you or your company. Now I'd like to get your response please? Have you received the money, and is it in my favor? I'd really appreciate your swift response. Thanks, Rudi

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Payment and Service
email_chain.body: Rudi, thanks for your patience. A certain cargo of ours failed to get through customs in South Africa, and as a result, I could not send you the money. We tried the next day but the problem persisted. I have only just spoken to the customs people; they've agreed to do me a favor - the cargo in question is ours, but the papers are in the name of a different company. They've agreed to let the goods out so I can get hold of my money. If I can get my money in a few days, I'll send you the money and make arrangements for it to reach you. Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Payment and Service
email_chain.body: Hi Peter, thanks for your email, and I'm sorry about the delay. What exactly do you mean when you say your money has failed to get through? I'm keen to find out as much as I can. Rudi

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Chemical Shipment from Westport, LA to Long Beach, CA
email_chain.body:
Ms. Helberg,

We have a 5,000MT shipment of chemicals from Westport, LA to Long Beach, CA. We would like to know how much you charge for this service. Additionally, are you facing any dock congestion at Long Beach?

Thank you,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Chemical Shipment from Westport, LA to Long Beach, CA
email_chain.body:
Hi Adam,

Good day!

Our website shows a discount of 6% on your proposed service. Based on your email, here is an estimate of your shipment:

Carriers	Ocean Freight	Cost Savings	Consignee/Port Load
Sea Land	1,862 USD	3%	Shippers/Port Origin
Port	1,858 USD		Amount 362 USD
Port of Discharge		Total in US $	Payments
Long Beach		6% OFF

Fine Print:
Westport:
Destination:
We do not have local agents at this port. We only ship out from LA, Long Beach, or Hueneme.
This means:
We cannot arrange local delivery pickups and nor can we do heavy handling activities at the port. These must be arranged by the owner of the shipment or by a 3rd party company on his behalf.

Best regards,
Ms. Helberg

Hello Neil,

We are having difficulty communicating with our warehouse operation at this time and I want to discuss your shipment request with them. You will be notified as soon as I receive a response.
