email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Transporting Used Milkers
email_chain.body:
Hey Jane,

We are interested in taking on a cargo of used milkers. If we could move the milkers from Lydenburg, RSA to Gaborone, Botswana, can you send us the details for loading and unloading on each side, then a complete logistics and transport plan?

Sincerely,
Karen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Transporting Used Milkers
email_chain.body:
Our milkers will arrive on 28 July 2016 from Cape Town to Lydenburg by ship. If you can receive these milkers by road and transport them from Lydenburg to Gaborone, Botswana, please let us know your plans and the cost of the transport.

Sincerely,
Aaron

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Transporting Used Milkers
email_chain.body:
Yes, we can take the milkers off the ship at Lydenburg and transport them from there to Gaborone. We will use our tippers and 40ft containers for transporting these milkers. We will receive them and bring them to Gaborone where you will be able to pick them up.

Cost of transport will be:
 - Lydenburg to Gaborone: R7000 per tipper
 - Load, transport and discharge at Gaborone: R12 000 per

Please let us know when you will receive the milkers on the ship in Lydenburg so that we can plan our collection.

Sincerely,
Bridget

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Transporting Used Milkers
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the logistics plan. The milkers will arrive on 27 July 2016 at 09h00. The ship will berth in Lydenburg at 09h00 and will be at anchor waiting for customs clearance and other paperwork.

Please pick the milkers off the ship at 09h00 as the captain of the ship will sail at 13h00 to Cape Town.

Also, please let us know if you want to transport these milkers from Lydenburg to Gaborone by tippers or trucks, and we will prepare an order for the milkers.

Regards,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Rate Estimate
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

Could you please give me an estimated freight rate for transporting X of Y from A to B? Our vessel needs a rest stop at C to take on bunker fuel. Bunkering is an industry term which means that you need to go to a specific point to fill up with diesel and other lubricants. We usually use lube oil to make sure that the engines are in good condition and that they can run smoothly. We can get bunkering services from different companies.

Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Rate Estimate
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the request.

I will email the details of the freight rate to you shortly.

email_chain.subject: Feedback on Website
email_chain.body:
Dear Team,

We have received your feedback on the website and we are really appreciative of your constructive criticism. We will certainly take it into consideration in order to improve our work and increase the level of services we provide. You can rest assured that we will make every effort to improve the quality of the information we provide to the public and to keep it relevant and up to date.

I would also like to ask you whether you can provide us with more details regarding the inaccuracies you noticed in the information we posted on our website?

Thank you once again for your valuable comments. Thank you for your interest in our project.

email_chain.subject: Roof Leak Issue
email_chain.body:
Hello,

There is a problem with the roof of my house and I'm not sure what to do about it. When it rains, the water leaks through the roof into my bedroom. We had a leak a few years ago when it rained really hard, and our home insurance paid for a new roof. However, the leaky roof was not included in our insurance policy.

I am wondering if I should hire someone to fix the roof or if there is some other way that I could fix it myself. I am not a professional, but I am fairly handy and I am not afraid of doing a bit of hard work.

Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Roof Leak Issue
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email.

As you mentioned in your email, you were charged $5000 for your treatment.

- Payment Terms

- Delivery Time

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Rate Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Ting,

Here are the shipment terms and conditions:
- From: Guangzhou, China
- Destination: Manila, Philippines
- Quantity: 2,000MT (approximately 28,000 boxes, Gross 1000@1.2Tons)
- Payment Terms: The exporter shall arrange a Bank Letter of Credit to the order of Kimono Inc. (Korean Export Company). Cash / Bank Cashier Check in US Dollar at 60% of value in the Letter of Credit. The balance shall be paid in cash upon confirmation of inspection results at origin.
- Export License: Appropriate customs and commercial licenses
- Delivery Time: By sea, with 21 days ex-work, 15-30 days by air, as per agreement.

Sincerely yours,
Drew Wong

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Rate Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Drew,

1. Your company shall provide a Letter of Credit in favor of Hapag-Lloyd (Shipping line).
2. You will be responsible for all taxes/duties and all associated costs including local, state, and federal.
3. Your company will bear the cost of the shipment to include cost of packing and insurance.
4. The cost of the shipment shall be paid on the 10th day of the last month of every quarter.
5. Shipping schedule shall be agreed upon between your company and Hapag-Lloyd (Shipping line).
6. The shipment shall be delivered 30 days after the shipment date.

Best regards,
Ting

P.S. 1000 Box is 2500.00 per tonne
28,000 Box = 70,000

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Shipping Lumber from Vancouver to Inverness
email_chain.body:
Hi Lyle,

We’re considering shipping 35,000 metric tons of lumber from Vancouver to Inverness. Can you advise us about the import restrictions for pine?

Warmly,
Logan

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping Lumber from Vancouver to Inverness
email_chain.body:
Hi Logan,

Thanks for your email.

Unfortunately, the shipping of pine from Vancouver to Inverness is banned by law. I’m afraid we’re going to have to pass on your shipment.

Best regards,
Lyle

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping Lumber from Vancouver to Inverness
email_chain.body:
Actually, there’s an alternative – the business needn’t try to find out whether the lumber is in compliance with U.S. law, but simply can certify to that effect. A problem arises in distinguishing between logs and lumber, and lumber that has been cut and sawn and lumber that is not sawn. And even a commitment to pay for a formal inspection would not be sufficient to get past U.S. Customs’ questions. So, when the importing country wishes to assure itself that U.S. law is being complied with, the issuing country may provide an assurance in the form of an import certificate, an export certificate.

Best regards,
Lyle

email_chain.subject: Booking Request for VLGC Cargo
email_chain.body:

Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Request for VLGC Cargo
email_chain.body:
Vanessa,

As mentioned earlier, please see attached our company's terms and conditions which we would like you to sign in return. We will also send you the same request as we sent to LME.

Regarding our booking requirements, as discussed earlier, we are willing to book 5-7 vessels on a voyage charter basis for 1,000-10,000MT with the following cargo requirements:
- Commodity: JP54
- Origin: Asia
- Destination: West Africa
- 1 or 2 vessels with DAP or CIF for each cargo.

We would also like to charter other vessels on a shorter route for 1-2 weeks each and the same freight terms should apply as above.

If you can please arrange these chartered vessels on a regular basis. We would like to make these bookings in June and July.

Look forward to receiving your response.

Best,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Request for VLGC Cargo
email_chain.body:
Vanessa,

I just wanted to check that you had received and signed the attached. We have now received the signed copies from all your brokers which will be sent to you soon.

Regarding the other chartered vessels, as you can see from the attached schedules, there is a lot of uncertainty in both Asia and West Africa and it may be difficult to charter vessels. We will try to provide you with options if we can.

We have also prepared a list of the cargoes that we would like to book for each vessel in the 1st week of August. Please see the attached.

We look forward to receiving your comments.

Best,
Jack

email_chain.body:

Vanessa

Jack,

We have attached the charter vessels and the different cargoes that we are considering. We have requested these cargoes from you in the past, however, you have failed to reply to our emails. Please see the attached and provide us with options so we can arrange the vessels.

As you are aware,
Vanessa

Brijesh

Brijesh

email_chain.subject: CIF Rate Inquiry for Oil Cargo

email_chain.subject: Re: CIF Rate Inquiry for Oil Cargo

Could you please give me your details, such as company name, port of discharge, vessel size, and size of cargo for which you want to book space in order for us to provide you further details. email_chain.subject: Re: CIF Rate Inquiry for Oil Cargo
email_chain.body: Dear Adam, Could you provide your CIF rate for a cargo of oil from the Black Sea to Thailand with 10-14 day laycan and 30 days free time at the discharge port? Warm Regards, Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: CIF Rate Inquiry for Oil Cargo
email_chain.body: We charge 28 cents per MT/MT on Mt/Mt ASP/ICE Brent for the CIF rate. Could you please give me your details, such as company name, port of discharge, vessel size, and size of cargo for which you want to book space in order for us to provide you further details. Warm Regards, Adam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment
email_chain.body:

Sorry for the delay in replying. Kindly find attached the vessel specifications and yard drawings as requested. Our yard has a soil forking reach of 38m from the berth and we have 5.8m draught available inside our dock. The dimensions of our dock are 320m length by 30m width.

Regards,
Kerwin

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote: Crude Oil Transport from Saudi Arabia to Oman

Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Crude Oil Transport from Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

I can accommodate your shipment in my tanker at a freight rate of $15 per MT. The laytime policy for oil tanker shipments is generally a maximum of 14 days, but I would like to clarify with you the details of the shipment and payment to schedule the loading and confirmation of laytime. Please revert to me.

With regards,
Zachary

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Crude Oil Transport from Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
Dear Zachary,

I hope this message finds you well. Regarding the shipment, here are the details:

* Destination: Shallow seaport in Oman
* Volume: 4,000MT
* Delivery: January 15-30

The freight rate of $15 per MT sounds good, and I agree to confirm the details of the shipment and payment as well.

Sincerely,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Crude Oil Transport from Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Crude Oil Transport from Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
Hello Mike,

Best regards,
Zachary

Mike!

In response to your email below, I must apologize for my delay in replying. I was out of town on business for a few days. Your shipment has been sitting in the receiving bay for the past week and, except for a few calls from me, the loading has yet to begin. Your shipment arrived at our port of origin (Toronto) on Monday the 5th of November.

The supervisor in charge of the loading area tells me that some of the pallets were not properly packed and a few were even too heavy. I am

email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

I am still awaiting payment for the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp that you purchased from us back in March. I really do hope this isn't another one of your stunts, as you promised that payment would be made before now.

If you fail to pay within 7 days of receiving this message, I will be forced to contact our solicitors and take action against you. I hope this is not required.

Kind Regards,
Oliver Moussa

email_chain.subject: Final Notice: Payment for Unbleached Sulphate Pulp Purchase
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

I have now had to refer your company to our solicitors regarding the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp that you purchased from us back in March. This has now been ongoing for almost 12 months, and you have continuously promised payment yet failed to do so.

You have now wasted a considerable amount of our time with your constant lies and I am extremely upset by this. This is the final time I will be contacting you, and I advise that you take this matter very seriously as our solicitors will be taking action against your company.

Kind Regards,
Oliver Moussa

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request for LNG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Parkin,

Can you please provide a freight estimate for 6,000MT of LNG from Mopan in the US Gulf to Antwerp in July? Is port rotation compulsory for this service?

Kind Regards,
Cassie Manwell

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for LNG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Manwell,

Thank you for your enquiry. We have provided you with a proposal for the movement of 6,000MT of LNG from the US Gulf to Antwerp in July. The price for the cargo at the level mentioned in the proposal is on the basis of a fixed FOB rate. We can also offer this cargo with a FCN, however, this is calculated on the basis of a CBM charge of $1.20 per CBM based on the CBM declared on the cargo. In both scenarios, the CIF rate is fixed, and cargo would be delivered to the discharge port on the same day. In regards to port rotation, this would be at the shipper's request, subject to prior agreement between all parties.

We would ask that you review the proposal and send back a copy of the commercial terms (either C/P or C&F).

Best regards,
John Parkin

email_chain.subject: Charterparty Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Dalschaert,

With reference to our recent e-mail communication, I am writing to inform you that our chartering division has raised an enquiry with London regarding our agreement with their provisions in terms of the GCM/Voyage charterparty (as drafted by BIMCO).

This charterparty refers to a CBM charge of $1.20 per CBM as the basis of calculation for a FCN charter. This rate was introduced to reflect the charterer's ability to make a simple and accurate calculation based on the CBMs stated on their cargo. Our customer, Shell, has explained to us that they will not proceed with this arrangement for their LNG shipments unless the CBM charge is less than 90 cbm.

We are also asking that BIMCO changes the wording of the applicable provision of the GCM/Voyage Charterparty to ensure

Best regards,
Cassie Manwell

email_chain.subject: Re: Charterparty Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Dalschaert,

In line with our previous e-mail communication, please find attached a proposed amendment to the current GCM/Voyage charterparty draft that BIMCO has produced for consideration.

The proposed amendment is as follows:

18.30.1 Freight shall be calculated at $1.20/ cbm based on the CBM declared by the cargo.

This would be effective for cargoes delivered after 1st January 2003.

Please let us know if you would be agreeable to this amendment, and, if so, we will pursue this with BIMCO.

With many thanks,
Best Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Available adhesives space? Antwerp to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Olsen,

Could you handle a 2,600MT cargo of adhesives from Antwerp to Liverpool before month’s end? Also, can you provide your typical demurrage and dispatch rates?

Thanks,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Re: Available adhesives space? Antwerp to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
One of the greatest challenges we all face in the ocean freight market is breaking through the noise and finding the shipping capacity to transport cargoes from port A to port B at a good price, with reasonable delivery times. With this in mind, I'm writing to see if you can help me with some much-needed space in the coming weeks. I'll be looking to send 2,600MT of adhesives from Antwerp to Liverpool.

If this seems like a good match, please let me know your pricing, as well as any relevant booking terms and the ports you can accept. Please also send your demurrage and dispatch rates so we can plan for them in the event of a delay.

email_chain.subject: Available bitumen space? Yanbu to Jeddah
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Dorsey,

Got a question: any chance you have space this week for 4,800MT of bitumen from Yanbu to Jeddah? Please let me know if demurrage might be an issue.

Cheers,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Re: Available bitumen space? Yanbu to Jeddah
email_chain.body:
One of the greatest challenges we all face in the ocean freight market is breaking through the noise and finding the shipping capacity to transport cargoes from port A to port B at a good price, with reasonable delivery times. With this in mind, I'm writing to see if you can help me with some much-needed space in the coming weeks. I'll be looking to send 4,800MT of bitumen from Yanbu to Jeddah.

If this seems like a good match, please let me know your pricing, as well as any relevant booking terms and the ports you can accept. Please also send your demurrage and dispatch rates so we can plan for them in the event of a delay.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Petcoke Tenders
email_chain.body:
Greetings Mrs. Bird,

We are waiting on a number of tenders for an 8,000MT cargo of dry petcoke to Port Elizabeth. We’re currently unsure if the US Gulf can produce enough tonnage to meet our requirements. Can you please provide some estimated tonnages, and inform us of any other points of origin that could be competitive?

Kind regards,
Lewis

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Petcoke Tenders
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

The M/V Ostende is due to load a cargo of petcoke from Grays Harbor and delivery is scheduled for early November. The US Gulf is the only origin that we can produce in volume. We currently expect to have sufficient petcoke available to meet all of our charterers' requirements. However, you will still need to present your documentary requirements (full set of Bills of Lading (BLs) and your Charter Party, LPA Form 1, and their most recent IOPPCA, etc.) to obtain our booking approval.

The US Gulf produces 3 grades of petcoke: a very fine grade, a coarse grade, and a lamellar (wax contaminated) grade. We are able to book all 3 grades of petcoke on an as-available basis.

We will soon update our webpage with the latest information.

Best regards,
Rebecca Bird

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Inquiry
email_chain.body:

Would you please kindly provide us with detailed freight rates for the following cargoes to China?

S/2106: 60,000MT LDPR 18-20%CL 42,000 – 56,000 CHEMICALS
S/2196: 6,000MT N-HEXANE

Thank you for your attention.

Yours faithfully,
Lewis Brereton

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

These are some of the best pricing sources for dry bulk ship broking data. I am unable to assist with specific brokerage inquiries at this time.

Alice Ho

email_chain.subject: Discrepancy in Coal Shipment Invoice

email_chain.subject: Request for Change in Delivery Destination
email_chain.body:
Hello Maria,

We have 24,100MT of coal ready in Pulau Belawan bound for Kuantan. Is there a way we could move this to Muara Berau instead? Kindly provide us with an updated estimate for the delivery date and draft limitations.

Best,
Makara

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Change in Delivery Destination
email_chain.body:
Dear Makara,

Thanks for your email. I have asked our shipping department to look into the availability of tugboats in Kuantan. We shall confirm with you as soon as we have further information.

Thanks,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Change in Delivery Destination
email_chain.body:
Dear Makara,

Thank you for your enquiry. Unfortunately, we cannot guarantee the availability of tugboats at Muara Berau due to limited resources. However, we will do our best to assist you with your transportation needs. Our vessel is currently sailing from Muara Berau towards Pulau Belawan and we estimate arrival at Muara Berau on 13 May. We will provide updates on the availability of tugboats as soon as possible.

Kind regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Change in Delivery Destination
email_chain.body: There are no vessels available at Muara Berau for the next 4 days. In order to minimize your waiting time, we have found a tugboat service company that has vessels available near Jakarta, which is about 12 hours away from Muara Berau. Their pricing is higher than our normal tugboat services but they are able to guarantee availability within 48 hours. Would you like us to proceed with this option? Kindly confirm with me on your decision. Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Diesel Shipment Request
email_chain.body:
Hello Tom,

Could we move 40,000MT of diesel from Panama to Nantes next week?

Kind regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

I am writing to you as I need your help. A couple of days ago I received an email from my contact person in the company. The reason is that the invoice of the company has not been paid.

It has been explained to me that the delivery documents have been lost. So, according to my knowledge, it is important for the company to give me a copy of those documents. I will do my best, but I cannot reach the person in charge right now. I will contact him later this evening.

But my friend, we are talking about a considerable amount of money.

The contact person told me that it could be a problem to get the copy of those documents but it should not be a problem. However, I wonder if you have any idea what could be the problem? I need to know how much

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

I am very sorry for the delay. I need some help with this email. Can you help me?

Best regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

Can you help me? I want to check a grammar in this email, but I need to know if my analysis is correct.

The email is talking about the documents that have been lost. So, the writer is asking the receiver about the documents, not to pay the amount of money.

I would like you to help me. Can you please check the content and analyse it?

Tom,

Thanks for your help.
I am checking the email.
I think the email is about documents but the amount of money has been lost. There is a mistranslation here.

Dear Tom,

Can you tell me the result of your analysis? I want to be sure if my English is correct

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

I would like you to check the email to make sure I did not make any mistake. If the email is about money lost, I need to do something. Otherwise, the contract will be broken. I will be at my office next week.

Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

Thanks for your help. I have received your last email and I am now sure I understood the content of the email. So, there is no problem.

By the way, I will be out of my office next week. I will not be able to receive emails for a week.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
I am happy that you are still out of your office. But I am still looking for a way to make sure that the documents were not lost. The manager of my company is furious. He does not want to give me any help. I do not understand it. He is my friend, so I do not understand his behaviour. What should I do? Could you help me?

Tom,

I am sorry to have disturbed you.

Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Dear Tomas,

Your email is not about money. The email is asking for help. But the manager has already been informed about the problem and he will help you. You need to help the manager and try to explain him that the mistake has been made and not you. He will give you all the documents you need.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

Thanks for your help. Sorry for disturbing you.

Bye

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Quote - Barley Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Nudell,

My company wishes to book a vessel to transport 15,000 MT of barley from South Africa to India. We have contacted the cargo port today and they confirm a loading window of 10-15 August.

Could you please provide a detailed freight quote for your vessel under FOB terms and advise your available window?

Many thanks,
Sasa

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Quote - Soya Cake Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Nudell,

I would like to ask if you can arrange the FOB shipment of 13,500 MT of soya cake from South Africa to China. The cost should be within the range of $310-330 per MT + Agency fee of $220-250 + insurance cost of $0.60/MT.

Please let me know if your cost fits this range.

I look forward to your reply.

Regards,
042
